SUMMARY:
Sono passati 1835 giorni dall'emanazione del decreto Clini-Passera che fissava a 40mila tonnellate il limite massimo per le navi circolanti nella laguna di Venezia.
Il progetto non ha ancora ottenuto la Valutazione di Impatto Ambientale (VIA).
√à fantastico che un ministro dell'ambiente sposi un progetto che ancora non ha ottenuto la VIA.
Si pensa di avere trovato la soluzione, ma in realt√† √® una pezza, il classico caso in cui xe peso el tacon del buso.
Mettere a rischio l'ecosistema lagunare e non arginare il modello di gigantismo turistico cos√¨ pericoloso per Venezia, non √® proprio una buona idea.
TEXT:
Marted√¨ il governo con gli enti locali e l'autorit√† portuale di Venezia ha deciso che le "grandi navi" transiteranno non pi√π per il canale della Giudecca, ma per il "canale dei petroli" approdando a Porto Marghera. E da l√¨ per canale Vittorio Emanuele fino alla Stazione Marittima di Venezia, sperando che ci vadano delle imbarcazioni pi√π piccole e dei "lancioni" e non le grandi navi stesse.

Sembrerebbe una buona notizia, ma cos√¨ non √®. Andiamo con ordine.

Sono passati 1835 giorni dall'emanazione del decreto Clini-Passera che fissava a 40mila tonnellate il limite massimo per le navi circolanti nella laguna di Venezia.

Sono passati 1351 giorni da quando Galletti √® ministro dell'ambiente e in questi 1351 giorni sono transitate per il canale della Giudecca e il bacino di San Marco 8106 navi passeggeri di stazza superiore alle 40mila tonnellate.

Il governo ha dormito in questi 1351 giorni. Le cose hanno cominciato a muoversi quando il cosiddetto progetto Duferco-De Piccoli ha ottenuto la Valutazione di Impatto Ambientale, anche se con alcune prescrizioni. √à avvenuta l'accelerazione sulla soluzione di Marghera, per bloccare il progetto Duferco.

Ci sono quattro cose che non vanno bene nel cosiddetto "progetto Marghera".

Primo. Per dare attuazione a questa soluzione, si dovr√† scavare per 25 chilometri il canale dei Petroli (pi√π altri 5 km del canale Vittorio Emanuele), che si chiama cos√¨ e non "canale delle ginestre" non a caso. Scavare quel canale significa rischiare di fare venire fuori dai fondali fanghi e sostanze tossiche inquinanti. E se anche se non fossero cos√¨ tossiche l'equilibrio dell'ecosistema lagunare sarebbe ancora una volta manomesso. In laguna non bisogna pi√π scavare. Punto.

Secondo. Il progetto non ha ancora ottenuto la Valutazione di Impatto Ambientale (VIA). √à fantastico che un ministro dell'ambiente sposi un progetto che ancora non ha ottenuto la VIA.

Terzo. Quelle navi passeggeri passeranno accanto a siti industriali a rischio ambientale. √à vero che ci stanno gi√† passando da tempo le navi commerciali, ma se a queste aggiungiamo quelle da crociera nel canale dei petroli ci sar√† un ingorgo pazzesco, come a Roma in via Cola di Rienzo nei giorni di Natale. I rischi aumenteranno sensibilmente.

Quarto. Questo progetto trasformer√† Porto Marghera in una sorta di mega-hub turistico, vanificando le prospettive della vocazione e della riconversione economica e industriale (pulita e sostenibile) dell'area e sposando il potenziamento del modello di gigantismo turistico che a Venezia ha prodotto enormi danni. Ed √® questo il motivo per cui i sindacati si sono dichiarati contrari.

C'erano soluzioni alternative? S√¨, lasciare le grandi navi fuori dalle bocche di porto, cio√® fuori dalla laguna. C'erano diversi progetti e ipotesi, che sono stati lasciati cadere nel vuoto. Non solo il bacino di San Marco e il canale della Giudecca, ma tutta la laguna non sopporta una presenza cos√¨ invasiva e massiccia di enormi navi. Condividiamo le preoccupazioni e la contrariet√† del Comitato No Grandi Navi e dei sindacati.

Si pensa di avere trovato la soluzione, ma in realt√† √® una pezza, il classico caso in cui xe peso el tacon del buso. Mettere a rischio l'ecosistema lagunare e non arginare il modello di gigantismo turistico cos√¨ pericoloso per Venezia, non √® proprio una buona idea.
TITLE: Grandi navi, quando "xe peso el tacon del buso"

SUMMARY:
Three Types of Negative Dating Beliefs Schilling says that negative dating beliefs fall into three key categories and they can impact on how we approach dating situations.
The final step towards a 'dating win' is the 'ambivalent' approach -- "one foot in and one foot out of the dating pool," Schilling explained.
Schilling suggests starting by dating yourself can lead to positive relationships in the future.
"Self-compassion and self-awareness are the first steps in attracting and developing a positive relationship," Schilling said.
You can also join Melanie Schilling's private Facebook group for single women who are ready to stop self-sabotaging and start dating.
TEXT:
Your core beliefs could have a lot to answer for.

'Why are you still single?'

We've either been asked the question or posed it ourselves, but what's the real answer?

People will respond to this in a variety of ways, most commonly placing the blame on surface pressures, but it's actually the way we speak to ourselves about dating that could be the real answer to this query.

"Most people play a significant role in keeping themselves single," relationship expert Melanie Schilling told HuffPost Australia. "It's common to blame external factors -- for example, 'it's too cold, I'll start dating after winter' or 'there's a man drought' -- and at the core of most self-sabotage is fear."

Self-compassion and self-awareness are the first steps in attracting and developing a positive relationship.

Self-sabotaging behaviours are usually based on fear and while people adapt these as a means of self-protection, often they can actually prevent dating success rather than guaranteeing it. These can arise from fear of rejection, vulnerability or being hurt again and giving up independence or happiness.

"Often when people have been emotionally scarred in the past -- and let's face it, who hasn't -- it's common to be self-protective. But there is a difference between being healthily skeptical and undermining your own happiness," Schilling said.

"At the core of dating resistance is usually a set of beliefs -- about oneself, about partners or about relationships."

Three Types of Negative Dating Beliefs Schilling says that negative dating beliefs fall into three key categories and they can impact on how we approach dating situations. 1. Beliefs about yourself -- 'I don't deserve happiness, I'm useless at relationships, I'll only mess it up, I'm better off single.' 2. Beliefs about men and women -- 'All men/women cheat, they will break my heart, they always leave eventually.' 3. Beliefs about relationships -- 'What if something better comes along?, a relationship will stunt my independence, I don't have time for a relationship.'

Holding some or all of these core beliefs can impact on your level of 'date readiness' and can result in self-sabotaging your own dating success.

Schilling has devised the 'Date Ready Ladder' that can help assess where you might sit in the realm of dating and therefore, what you can do to improve your dating success.

The first three rungs on the ladder illustrate behaviours that can lead to a 'dating fail', while the top three are approaches that could lead to a 'dating win'.

The 'Date Ready Ladder'

'Self-sabotage' is "actively undermining and blocking opportunities for social interaction or dating potential," Schilling said. "Essentially telling the world you are not interested in a relationship -- either consciously or unconsciously."

The next step up the ladder is the 'resistant' category, where "despite feeling open to a relationship, [you avoid] opportunities or make oneself unavailable for dating options".

The final step towards a 'dating win' is the 'ambivalent' approach -- "one foot in and one foot out of the dating pool," Schilling explained. "Sending mixed messages to potential dates."

Sending mixed messages is characteristic of being in an 'ambivalent' dating mindset.

So, how do we recognise that we could be self-sabotaging our own dating lives and move out of our own way?

Schilling suggests starting by dating yourself can lead to positive relationships in the future.

"Self-compassion and self-awareness are the first steps in attracting and developing a positive relationship," Schilling said.

You can also join Melanie Schilling's private Facebook group for single women who are ready to stop self-sabotaging and start dating.
TITLE: Self-Sabotage: How We Stop Ourselves From Dating Successfully

SUMMARY:
Opposition parties don't have to savagely criticise the ANC any longer ‚Äì‚Äì the ruling party's former presidents are doing a good enough job.
Thabo Mbeki and Kgalema Motlanthe have both taken to condemning the current state of the ANC and the actions of its leadership during public appearances around the country.
"Each one of his mistakes and indiscretions, the ANC takes it upon itself to defend [him], as though he is the ANC," said Motlanthe.
"The ANC contains within its ranks people who are absolutely contemptuous of the most fundamental values of the ANC .
READ: Mbeki: ANC Crisis Direct Result Of Polokwane PutschThe comments from the former presidents are echoed by senior members of the party's current leadership, like Pravin Gordhan and Derek Hanekom, who have been outspoken about problems within the ANC.
TEXT:
Opposition parties don't have to savagely criticise the ANC any longer ‚Äì‚Äì the ruling party's former presidents are doing a good enough job.

Thabo Mbeki and Kgalema Motlanthe have both taken to condemning the current state of the ANC and the actions of its leadership during public appearances around the country. And they are not mincing their words.

Factionalism, corruption and slate politics are some of the points on which their criticisms are based.

In his keynote address at the 2017 Helen Suzman Memorial Lecture on Tuesday, Motlanthe said the ways in which South Africa has regressed from the dream of a united democratic, nonracial, nonsexist state was "regrettable".

"The burden on our collective shoulders was too heavy a weight to carry; the expectations too high to fulfil... Those in power in various sectors failed to live up to the oath of office in terms of business and moral consciousness attached to their positions," he said.

READ: Motlanthe: The Present Is Untenable, But South Africans Can Change That

But he was more confrontational in September, attacking President Jacob Zuma directly.

In an interview with Radio702, Motlanthe said if his successor were to be removed, it would give the country the opportunity to "create a new environment".

"Each one of his mistakes and indiscretions, the ANC takes it upon itself to defend [him], as though he is the ANC," said Motlanthe.

He also told the BBC that the ANC needed to lose power to realise the depth of its problems.

"Those elements who are in it for the largesse will quit it, will desert it ‚Äì‚Äì and only then would the possibility arise for salvaging whatever is left of it," he said.

Even Nelson Mandela warned the ANC about factionalism nine years ago.

In 2008, at a birthday celebration in his honour at Loftus Versfeld in Pretoria, Mandela said: "Let no individual, section, faction or group ever regard itself as greater than the organisation and the common good of all our people."

"Let us never through our deeds or words take our people back down that road," he said.

But Mandela's successor, Thabo Mbeki, now believes the party faces the threat of outright destruction.

Giving the keynote address at a packed OR Tambo Centenary Memorial Lecture last month, Mbeki said flat-out that the threat emanates from acts of commission originating from within the ANC itself.

"The ANC contains within its ranks people who are absolutely contemptuous of the most fundamental values of the ANC . . . These are people who only see the ANC as a step-ladder to enable them to access state power for the express purpose of using that access for self-enrichment," he said.

READ: Mbeki: ANC Crisis Direct Result Of Polokwane Putsch

The comments from the former presidents are echoed by senior members of the party's current leadership, like Pravin Gordhan and Derek Hanekom, who have been outspoken about problems within the ANC.

The ANC is, by its own admission, going through an exceptionally problematic period, scrambling to affect some sort of organisational renewal before South Africans go to the polls in 2019. For the first time, many of its detractors form part of its own ranks, as factions battle it out for political power.

The party is trying to keep its chin up ahead of its national conference in December, but with its former leaders having such a despondent view of the current state of play, it leaves many wondering whether the ruling party has the political will to pick itself out of its current slump.
TITLE: Former ANC Presidents Now Party's Biggest Critics

TEXT:
Comedian Chris Tall findet: Wer Minderheiten nicht ausschlie√üen will, muss Witze √ºber sie machen

Er bricht Tabus ‚Äì und die Menschen feiern ihn daf√ºr

Witze √ºber Behinderte? Ein Tabu. Witze √ºber Schwarze? Oder Schwule? Auch nicht gern geh√∂rt. Zumindest nicht in der √ñffentlichkeit.

Es gibt gute Gr√ºnde daf√ºr. Minderheiten sind ein viel zu einfaches Ziel. Behinderte etwa k√∂nnen sich oft nicht wehren. Und es f√ºhlt sich einfach nicht richtig und anst√§ndig an, √ºber Menschen zu lachen, die es ohnehin nicht so leicht haben in der Gesellschaft.

Gef√ºhlt denkt die Mehrheit der Menschen in Deutschland, Behinderte, Schwarze oder Homosexuelle gewisserma√üen in Schutz nehmen zu m√ºssen.

Der deutsche Comedian Chris Tall sieht das anders. Er sagt: "Wir sollten in Deutschland viel mehr lachen ‚Äì und zwar √ºber alles und jeden." F√ºr ihn sind das "Gags auf Augenh√∂he".

Tall ist kein Unbekannter. Er wurde 2013 mit dem RTL Comedy Grand Prix ausgezeichnet. 2016 bekam er den deutschen Comedypreis als Bester Newcomer.

"Die Leute sind ausgerastet vor Freude"

Er findet: Man muss Witze √ºber Minderheiten machen, weil man sie gerade so ‚Äì und nur so ‚Äì nicht ausgrenzt.

In einer Show erz√§hlte er von einem Erlebnis, das dazu gef√ºhrt habe, dass Behinderte und Nicht-Betroffene unverkrampfter miteinander umgegangen seien. Eben weil er √ºber einen Rollstuhlfahrer vor tausenden Menschen gewitzelt habe (siehe Video):

"Die Leute sind ausgerastet vor Freude, dass wir ihn alle normal behandelt haben", sagt Tall. Leider habe er dieses Aha-Erlebnis erst gegen Ende der Tournee gehabt.

Mehr als 50.000 Menschen gef√§llt der Show-Ausschnitt auf Facebook. Das spricht daf√ºr, dass er mit seiner Meinung nicht alleine dasteht.

Bei Tall klingt das nicht nur vorgeschoben oder wie eine einfache Rechtfertigung f√ºr billigen Spa√ü. Weil Tall sich selbst und jeden anderen genauso gnadenlos auslacht. Gleichberechtigung sozusagen. F√ºr ihn gibt es nur einen einzigen Grund, nicht √ºber Minderheiten zu lachen: wenn der Witz nicht gut ist.

"Nachher sind sie ganz locker"

Die Menschen zusammenbringen, das ist der Punkt. Dass das Behinderte selbst so sehen, zeigt Phil Hubbe. Der Comiczeichner ist an Multiple Sklerose erkrankt. Trotzdem oder gerade deswegen zeichnet er Karikaturen √ºber Menschen mit Behinderungen und macht Witze √ºber Gehandicapte.



Er sagt: "Als ich angefangen habe, war auch der Punkt: Naja, Witze √ºber Behinderte, muss man da vielleicht irgendwas reinbringen, irgendwas P√§dagogisches? Das funktioniert nicht. Den Zeigefinger da rein, das ist v√∂lliger Quatsch."

Und weiter: "Wenn man zeichnen will, muss erst der Witz funktionieren und bei einigen, die regen dann auch zum Nachdenken an. Und deshalb freue ich mich zu sehen, wenn in Ausstellungen Betroffene und Nicht-Betroffene dann zusammenstehen. Also erst dieses Verkrampfte und dann nachher sind sie ganz locker."



(best)

La escritora guerrerense Reyna Grande, a trav√©s de su libro La distancia entre nosotros, nos lleva por este suplicio infantil de la partida de los padres buscando esa "vida mejor" que quieren para los suyos.

TEXT:
Cada a√±o miles de ni√±os, ni√±as y adolescentes se ven forzados a migrar, ya sea porque huyen de la violencia, porque buscan reunirse con sus familias o porque tienen la esperanza de encontrar mejores oportunidades de vida. Tan solo en 2016, 40 mil 542 ni√±os fueron identificados por autoridades migratorias mexicanas, de los cuales 17 mil 889 viajaban sin la compa√±√≠a de un adulto, de acuerdo con cifras de la Unicef.

Pero existe un n√∫mero menor que logra cruzar hacia el otro lado junto a un familiar. Dejan de ser los ni√±os olvidados, los "hu√©rfanos" en M√©xico, para aventurarse como peque√±os adultos y ara√±ar, como lo han hecho miles de adultos antes, el "sue√±o americano".

La escritora guerrerense Reyna Grande, a trav√©s de su libro La distancia entre nosotros, nos lleva por este suplicio infantil de la partida de los padres buscando esa "vida mejor" que quieren para los suyos.

Grande habl√≥ para HuffPost M√©xico respecto a su √≠ntimo libro, que est√° pr√≥ximo a presentar en la Feria Internacional del Libro de Oaxaca 2017.

‚Äî Reyna, tu libro es muy √≠ntimo, muy biogr√°fico, muy actual, y has dicho que regresas de vez en cuando a Guerrero. ¬øEs la misma situaci√≥n en Iguala de la Independencia d√©cadas despu√©s?

‚Äî Antes, lo √∫nico que nos preocupaba era la pobreza en la que viv√≠amos. No hab√≠a trabajo ni oportunidades para salir adelante. Es por eso qu√© mi pap√° se fue.

Su respuesta subraya la precaria situaci√≥n que prevalece a√∫n en Guerrero y en M√©xico.

"Adem√°s de la pobreza, ahora hay violencia, hay c√°rteles, hay la 'guerra contra las drogas', hay desapariciones como los 43 estudiantes que fueron desaparecidos a diez minutos de donde vive mi familia, hay fosas clandestinas", dice Reyna.

La situaci√≥n en Iguala la deja en una posici√≥n muy vulnerable, pero sigue determinada que quiere colaborar con su gente.

Iguala se ubica en la regi√≥n Norte del estado de Guerrero, en un valle rodeado por nueve monta√±as. Es la tercera ciudad m√°s poblada del estado s√≥lo despu√©s de Chilpancingo y Acapulco, pero

Violentas, 69% de las familias; maltratan para educar: Unicef

‚Äî En tu libro hablas sobre el abandono de tu madre, el maltrato que viviste con tu padre. ¬øA√∫n ves este tipo de situaciones en M√©xico y EU? ¬øA√∫n existen estos personajes en otras familias en la actualidad?

"Creo que mi historia es la historia de millones de personas. El 80% de ni√±os inmigrantes en Estados Unidos han pasado por separaci√≥n familiar. Muchos de los ni√±os se quedan con parientes, a veces los parientes los tratan bien, a veces los tratan muy mal", comenta la escritora.

En su relato describe la situaci√≥n de ser hija de migrantes y estar expuesta a los criterios de personas que no son sus padres.

"Pero mi libro explora temas m√°s all√° de la inmigraci√≥n. Habla del abuso dom√©stico, abuso de los ni√±os, el alcoholismo, el divorcio, familias rotas, de p√©rdidas y sacrificios", agrega.

Abuso sexual infantil: lo que el sistema judicial y los mexicanos necesitamos aprender

"Una historia de superaci√≥n, de sue√±os para el futuro, de esperanza, de no dejarse vencer, el triunfo que se puede obtener con esfuerzo, trabajo, y un poco de suerte y ayuda. Estos son temas que muchas familias tienen en com√∫n en ambos lados de la frontera" enfatiz√≥ Grande.

‚Äî Existen muchos libros tipo reportaje sobre inmigraci√≥n, pero el tuyo es autobiogr√°fico. ¬øA la gente le interesar√≠a tener m√°s espacios para este tipo de literatura, contada por uno?

"Creo que se necesitan libros autobiogr√°ficos porque ellos hablan del tema de inmigraci√≥n de forma diferente, no hablan de inmigrantes como si fueran solo estad√≠sticas o data", reflexiona.

Cuando nos olvidamos de la humanidad de una persona, es m√°s f√°cil convertir a esa persona en un criminal. Esa ha sido la t√°ctica de nuestros l√≠deres pol√≠ticos, como Trump. Reyna Grande, escritora.

‚Äî Pero, ¬øc√≥mo hablarle a otros sobre la infancia en el exilio?

"Para m√≠ ha sido una linda experiencia ser invitada por varias escuelas a contar mi historia. En Estados Unidos, uno de inmigrante se siente avergonzado por sus experiencias, y las calla, las esconde", apunta.

En La distancia entre nosotros, Grande enfrenta sus propios miedos y experiencias vergonzosas para contar como vivi√≥ esa infancia: reencontrarse con su padre vestida con harapos, hacerse pasar por una ni√±a m√°s para ser atendida por un dentista, vivir con una mujer que silenciosamente le recuerda que no es su madre y, callar el primer amor por el temor a un padre sobreprotector. Abandonar los sue√±os de superaci√≥n por el fracaso de otros familiares.

"Y lo sorprendente pas√≥, que me empezaron a invitar a presentar mi libro y me dieron un micr√≥fono y me dijeron 'cu√©ntanos tu historia, cu√©ntanos tu dolor', y lo hice", recuerda Reyna.

‚Äî Lograste el "sue√±o americano" que, en principio, fue el de tu padre. Despu√©s lo hiciste tuyo, pero, ¬øhay forma de que la gente en M√©xico pueda formarse de un "sue√±o mexicano"? ¬øExisten las condiciones?

"Yo no s√© qu√© es la soluci√≥n, pero en M√©xico nada va a cambiar hasta que se eliminen la explotaci√≥n, la corrupci√≥n, y la opresi√≥n de la gente, hasta que los salarios suban lo suficiente para que haya un buen balance entre el salario y el costo de vida. Solo hasta que eso pase van a cambiar las cosas en M√©xico y puede hacerse realidad el sue√±o Mexicano", reflexiona.

Del 74.5% de los migrantes desplazados por violencia en M√©xico, 41.5% viv√≠a en Michoac√°n y 33.3% en Guerrero, de acuerdo con el informe Vidas en la incertidumbre: la migraci√≥n forzada mexicana hacia la frontera norte de M√©xico, elaborado por la Coalici√≥n pro Defensa del Migrante y American Friends Service Committee-LAC.

"Por lo mientras, lo que yo veo que s√≠ existe son las pesadillas", finaliz√≥.

Sobre la autora

Reyna Grande se cri√≥ en Iguala, Guerrero en condiciones de extrema pobreza. Su primera novela, A trav√©s de cien monta√±as, est√° parcialmente basada en sus experiencias como ni√±a indocumentada en Estados Unidos. En la actualidad, este libro forma parte del programa de lecturas de diversos centros de ense√±anza.

Grande es miembro del prestigioso Macondo Writers Workshop, fundado por la autora Sandra Cisneros. Ha impartido cursos de escritura creativa en el programa de extensi√≥n de escritores de la Universidad de California, Los √Ångeles, en VONA (Voces de las artes de nuestra naci√≥n) y en el congreso de escritores latinos, entre otros.
TITLE: As√≠ duele en los ni√±os 'La distancia entre nosotros'

SUMMARY:
WINNIPEG ‚Äî Manitoba Premier Brian Pallister says retail sales of marijuana will be done exclusively through private retailers when recreational use of the drug is legalized next July.
The government will maintain a wholesale monopoly, but private stores will sell the drug at a price they can set themselves.
But Trade Minister Blaine Pedersen said private retailers are the best way to meet demand.
Alberta has proposed setting the minimum age at 18 to align with the legal age for drinking in that province.
New Brunswick has said it will also use a Crown corporation model, and a legislature committee has recommended the minimum age at 19.
TEXT:
WINNIPEG ‚Äî Manitoba Premier Brian Pallister says retail sales of marijuana will be done exclusively through private retailers when recreational use of the drug is legalized next July.

Pallister announced Tuesday some of the major points of the province's plan for marijuana sales, which he says is aimed at cutting into the black market and keeping cannabis away from kids.

The government will maintain a wholesale monopoly, but private stores will sell the drug at a price they can set themselves.

Municipalities will have the right to ban marijuana stores if they want, cannabis will not be sold in the same stores as alcohol, and there will be private online sales as well.

We know that businesses and entrepreneurs want to get in the game. Trade Minister Blaine Pedersen

The government is asking potential retailers to submit bids in the coming weeks, and says bids will be judged on storage security, distance from schools and more.

The Opposition NDP, as well as public-sector union leaders, have argued that sales should be done exclusively through government-run stores.

But Trade Minister Blaine Pedersen said private retailers are the best way to meet demand.

"We know that businesses and entrepreneurs want to get in the game," he said Tuesday.

Justice Minister Heather Stefanson says the province remains concerned about the federal government's July 1 deadline. But she says the Manitoba plan ensures public safety by keeping pot out of the hands of kids.

"This model will keep the profits from cannabis sales out of the hands of gangs and organized crime by ensuring adequate supply and accessibility," she said.

Earlier: Premiers weigh in on PM's proposed pot excise tax

The province still has to work out other details, such as a minimum age for legal marijuana consumption.

Alberta has proposed setting the minimum age at 18 to align with the legal age for drinking in that province. It has not decided if it will allow marijuana to be sold through government-run or private outlets.

Ontario is planning to establish stand-alone government-run stores offering a set price.

New Brunswick has said it will also use a Crown corporation model, and a legislature committee has recommended the minimum age at 19.
TITLE: Manitoba Will Let Private Retailers Sell Marijuana Once It's Legal, Premier Says

SUMMARY:
November startet endlich die dritte Staffel der erfolgreichen US-Serie "Outlander" im deutschen Free-TV.
Staffel drei basiert auf dem dritten Buch "Ferne Ufer" (im Original: "Voyager") der weltweit gefeierten Highland-Saga von Diana Gabaldon (65).
"Die Frau, die er liebt, ist f√ºr immer verloren"Wir erinnern uns: Staffel zwei endete mit der Schlacht von Culloden.
20 Jahre verbringt das Paar getrennt voneinander: Jamie im 18., Claire im 20.
Und genau das sei f√ºr Heughan die gr√∂√üte Herausforderung in Staffel drei gewesen.
TEXT:
Lange mussten die Fans warten: Am 8. November startet endlich die dritte Staffel der erfolgreichen US-Serie "Outlander" im deutschen Free-TV. VOX zeigt die 13 neuen Episoden immer mittwochs um 20:15 Uhr in Doppelfolgen. Wie geht es mit Jamie (Sam Heughan) und Claire (Caitriona Balfe) weiter? Staffel drei basiert auf dem dritten Buch "Ferne Ufer" (im Original: "Voyager") der weltweit gefeierten Highland-Saga von Diana Gabaldon (65).

Es ist nie zu sp√§t einzusteigen. Lesen Sie hier das erste Buch der weltweit erfolgreichen Highland-Saga!

"Die Frau, die er liebt, ist f√ºr immer verloren"

Wir erinnern uns: Staffel zwei endete mit der Schlacht von Culloden. Und genau dort setzt auch Staffel drei an, wie Sam Heughan (37) alias Jamie im Interview mit der Nachrichtenagentur spot on news verr√§t. "Claire reist gemeinsam mit seinem ungeborenen Kind durch die Steine zur√ºck, w√§hrend er auf dem Schlachtfeld auf den Tod wartet." Als er wider Erwarten √ºberlebt, st√ºrze ihn das in eine tiefe Krise. "Die Frau, die er liebt, ist f√ºr immer verloren", fasst Heughan zusammen.

20 Jahre verbringt das Paar getrennt voneinander: Jamie im 18., Claire im 20. Jahrhundert. Doch dann steht Claire pl√∂tzlich wieder vor ihm. "Ein echter Schock f√ºr Jamie", beschreibt Heughan das Wiedersehen, dem nicht nur Fans der Buchvorlage entgegenfiebern. Schlie√ülich ist die Szene in Jamies Druckerei eine der wichtigsten und emotionalsten in Gabaldons acht B√§nde umfassender Highland-Saga. "Die Fans werden nicht entt√§uscht sein", verspricht Heughan. "Es ist genauso emotional wie im Buch".

Das war die gr√∂√üte Herausforderung

Doch wie hat sich Jamie in all den Jahren ver√§ndert? "Rein √§u√üerlich nicht viel. Schlie√ülich ist Jamie jetzt nicht viel √§lter als ich." Rund eine Stunde habe er f√ºr ein paar Falten in der Maske gesessen. Viel mehr als sein √Ñu√üeres habe sich jedoch seine Pers√∂nlichkeit ver√§ndert. "Die vergangenen Jahre haben aus ihm einen anderen Menschen gemacht." Und genau das sei f√ºr Heughan die gr√∂√üte Herausforderung in Staffel drei gewesen. Insbesondere die Verzweiflung, die ihn nach dem Verlust von Claire √ºbermannt habe.

Auch die Szenen auf dem Schlachtfeld h√§tten ihm einiges abverlangt, vor allem k√∂rperlich, f√ºhrt er weiter aus. Dennoch ziehe er diese den Sexszenen vor, allein schon wegen der ganzen Choreographie, die es beim Sex vor der Kamera zu beachten g√§be. Und davon wird es auch in Staffel drei einige geben, versichert der 37-J√§hrige weiter. Fans hatten sich nach der zweiten Staffel √ºber den Mangel an Sexszenen beschwert.

Eine echte Erfolgsstory

"Outlander" feierte im August 2014 beim US-Sender Starz Premiere und setzte schlie√ülich zu einem echten Siegeszug an. Bis dato erhielt die Serie unter anderem vier Golden-Globe-Nominierungen (u.a. "Beste TV-Serie Drama"), drei Emmy-Nominierungen und wurde au√üerdem mehrfach mit People's Choice Awards pr√§miert.

Die Dreharbeiten f√ºr die vierte Staffel sind bereits gestartet. Stoff f√ºr weitere Staffeln gibt es zur Gen√ºge. Acht B√§nde umfasst die Highland-Saga mittlerweile. Bis heute wurden die B√ºcher in √ºber 27 L√§ndern ver√∂ffentlicht und in 24 Sprachen √ºbersetzt. Mehr als 28 Millionen Exemplare wurden bereits verkauft. Ein Ende der Saga ist noch lange nicht in Sicht. Gabaldon arbeitet aktuell am neunten Band.
TITLE: "Outlander": Das erwartet euch in der dritten Staffel

SUMMARY:
Yet a formulaic response tends to follow tragedies: Mental illness is bad and it‚Äôs what caused this to happen.
And it is true that in some cases mental health could play a role in violent situations.
Drawing a simplistic connection between mental illness and violence sends the wrong message about psychological disorders and stigmatizes millions of people who live with mental health conditions.
‚ÄúMost people with mental illness are wonderful citizens and have an illness that‚Äôs treatable.
It further alienates people with mental health issues and makes them feel like their experience isn‚Äôt understood.
TEXT:
Research shows that people living with mental health issues are more likely to be victims of a violent crime as opposed to the ones committing them. Yet a formulaic response tends to follow tragedies: Mental illness is bad and it‚Äôs what caused this to happen.

The mass shooting at a church in Sutherland Springs, Texas, on Sunday is no exception to the rule. A day after the tragedy, President Donald Trump said that mental illness, not the issue of gun control, was to blame for that massacre that killed 26 people.

‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt a guns situation,‚Äù Trump said during his visit to Japan. ‚ÄúThis is a mental health problem at the highest level. It‚Äôs a very, very sad event.‚Äù

A 2012 police report shows the gunman, Devin Kelley, did escape from a mental health facility where he was staying following being charged in a military court for assaulting his wife and stepson, the New York Times reported. And it is true that in some cases mental health could play a role in violent situations.

But experts say a blanket statements about mental health in these cases does a disservice. Drawing a simplistic connection between mental illness and violence sends the wrong message about psychological disorders and stigmatizes millions of people who live with mental health conditions.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important not to link these kinds of heinous crimes with mental illness unless one knows for sure what was a cause and effect,‚Äù Dr. Michelle Riba, the associate director at the University of Michigan‚Äôs Comprehensive Depression Center, told HuffPost. ‚ÄúMost people with mental illness are wonderful citizens and have an illness that‚Äôs treatable. They don‚Äôt behave in a way that leads to what happened [in Texas].‚Äù

The president is hardly alone in making the association ‚Äï even the media has a tendency to perpetuate a similar idea. A 2016 Johns Hopkins University study found that more than a third of all news stories about mental health conditions were linked with violence toward other people. This figure doesn‚Äôt accurately reflect the actual rates of violence where mental illness is involved.

Assigning blanketed blame to mental illness can have long-term consequences, Riba said. It further alienates people with mental health issues and makes them feel like their experience isn‚Äôt understood. That could ultimately lead them to not reach out for help: Research shows negative attitudes surrounding mental illness often prevent people from seeking treatment.

Regardless of whether mental health issues are at play during tragedies, the way they are discussed publicly is a huge problem ‚Äï especially for those who live with these disorders.

We chatted with Riba and gathered other advice on what to do to help mitigate the effects of mental health stigma. If you‚Äôre living with a mental health issue, here‚Äôs how to take care of yourself today (and moving forward):

Reach out to someone you trust.

This could be a family member, friend or significant other. Leaning on people who love and support you is vital during times of distress, Riba said.

‚ÄúAsk people to have a conversation about how you‚Äôre feeling,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúGetting some input from people you trust and value is helpful.‚Äù

Take social media and news breaks if you need them.

Riba said that staying informed and plugging into uplifting resources can be critical when you‚Äôre feeling alienated. However, it‚Äôs also important to take breaks. Research shows negative news can have a damaging effect on mental health. It‚Äôs okay to unplug from the noise for a little while.

Do a calming activity.

Working out ‚Äï even if it‚Äôs just going for a long walk ‚Äï can do wonders for your mental wellbeing. Research shows physical activity can boost your mood, and taking a stroll in nature has been shown to reduce symptoms of depression. Not in the mood to exercise? Try one of these other expert-backed self-care activities.

Check in with a professional.

If you‚Äôre already in therapy, Riba recommends reaching out to your therapist if the rhetoric is starting to bother you. If you‚Äôre not currently seeking treatment, consider contacting a professional if your well-being is at stake.

‚ÄúMake an appointment to talk about this,‚Äù Riba said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important to straighten out these kinds of feelings and issues with a clinician.‚Äù

Remember that your condition is not a character flaw.

Mental health is just as important as physical health. Take a moment to remind yourself that having a mental illness doesn‚Äôt make you a bad person, nor does it define you, Riba said.

‚ÄúMental illness is like any other health condition,‚Äù she stressed. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs treatable and people with the conditions have quality lives.‚Äù

This piece has been updated to reflect the recent reports that Kelley escaped from a mental health facility in 2012.
TITLE: How To Deal With Stigmatising Remarks About Mental Illness

A saleswoman keeps a gold necklace in a shelf at a showroom in Mumbai, India, August 13, 2015.
Gold is considered an essential part of weddings in India, second-biggest consumer of the metal in the world after China, and it is a popular gift on such occasions.
In the next few weeks, there are many wedding dates, which will boost demand," said Kumar Jain, a Mumbai-based jeweller.
Dealers in India were charging a premium of up to $3 an ounce this week over official domestic prices, unchanged from last week.
That's why the market is in premium, despite moderate demand," said a dealer with a private bank in Mumbai.
TEXT:
A saleswoman keeps a gold necklace in a shelf at a showroom in Mumbai, India, August 13, 2015.

ADVERTISEMENT

MUMBAI/BENGALURU -- Demand for physical gold was lacklustre in top consumers India and China this week, while the lure of the metal remained stable in Singapore, but India's peak wedding season is expected to usher in renewed interest for bullion in coming weeks.

Gold is considered an essential part of weddings in India, second-biggest consumer of the metal in the world after China, and it is a popular gift on such occasions.

"The wedding season has started. In the next few weeks, there are many wedding dates, which will boost demand," said Kumar Jain, a Mumbai-based jeweller.

Dealers in India were charging a premium of up to $3 an ounce this week over official domestic prices, unchanged from last week. The domestic price includes a 10 percent import tax.

"Gold imports by (jewellery) export houses have fallen sharply in the last few weeks. That's why the market is in premium, despite moderate demand," said a dealer with a private bank in Mumbai.

In October, India tightened gold import norms for jewellery exporters by restricting them from importing the yellow metal only for export purposes and not for selling in the domestic market.

Meanwhile, in China, the market for the precious metal remained quiet, with premiums of $5 to $9 an ounce being charged over benchmark rates, as against the $6.50 to $10 range in the previous week.

Benchmark spot gold was on track to register a small weekly gain, hovering around the $1,275.00 level as of 0919 GMT on Friday, but still below Thursday's mark of $1,284.10, highest in nearly two weeks. [GOL/]

"Dips below the $1,270 level (toward the beginning of the week) spurred some buying, but the upside, (around the $1,280 level) limited purchases," said Ronald Leung, chief dealer at Lee Cheong Gold Dealers in Hong Kong.

Premiums in Hong Kong remained more or less unchanged from last week, in the 60 cents to $1.20 range.

"Premiums are quite low, and except for periodic large sales, the market is quiet," said Joshua Rotbart, managing partner of J. Rotbart & Co in Hong Kong.

In Singapore, premiums rose to 70-90 cents from the 50 cents last week.

"There has been interest from two segments, the wholesalers and high net worth individuals, so it is still strong," said Loh Mun Chun, Director, Private Wealth at GoldSilver Central in Singapore.

"The wholesalers need to buy ... to produce jewellery, especially with some spillover demand coming from the Diwali and Dhanterras festivals, while the high net worth individuals ... buy to diversify their portfolio and they have the money."

Japanese markets were closed for a public holiday on Friday.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Wedding Bells Set To Ring In Fresh Gold Demand In India

A staff member of Exclusive Books at Gateway Mall in Durban sets up a shelf of 'The President's Keepers', written by investigative journalist and author Jacques Pauw.
Jacques Pauw's bombshell nonfiction thriller "The President's Keepers" has become South Africa's best seller since research outfit Nielsen started measuring our book sales in 2004.
State Security (SSA) tells @NBPublishers to withdraw explosive 'The President's Keepers' book from stores, threatens legal action.
Last Friday's threats by SARS and the SSA impelled South Africans to go out and buy the book to support the author.
It exposes the concentric circles of gangsters who have come to infiltrate South Africa's polity and, allegedly, its president's inner circle.
TEXT:
A staff member of Exclusive Books at Gateway Mall in Durban sets up a shelf of 'The President's Keepers', written by investigative journalist and author Jacques Pauw.

Jacques Pauw's bombshell nonfiction thriller "The President's Keepers" has become South Africa's best seller since research outfit Nielsen started measuring our book sales in 2004.

Read: A Snarling, Growling Jacob Zuma Goes On The Offensive

The book, which officially only launches on Wednesday evening, has sold out of its first print run of 40,000 copies, and the new run of 30,000 is largely pre-sold, said Erika Oosthuizen, the nonfiction publisher at NB Publishers.

Because it takes six weeks to print and bind new books, "we had to kick other titles off the printers," Oosthuizen admitted. Printers worked flat-out last weekend to deliver the new run of books by the official launches, which start in Johannesburg tonight.

The book ‚Äî or rather Pauw and NB ‚Äî face defamation claims by the South African Revenue Service (SARS), and also a cease and desist order from the State Security Agency (SSA).

We have noted with grave concern that threats of violence are being made

against #JacquesPauw, author of #ThePresidentsKeepers. pic.twitter.com/a3fPJGLryu November 7, 2017

The President's Keepers blows the lid off President Jacob Zuma's dodgy personal tax affairs, as well as the fact that he moonlighted for Durban private security billionaire Roy Moodley at a fee of R1-million a month for the first period of his presidency.

It also details how the SSA ‚Äî under its recently appointed boss, Arthur Fraser, and his fellow spooks ‚Äî blew billions from an intelligence slush fund by living the high life and employing family members.

State Security (SSA) tells @NBPublishers to withdraw explosive 'The President's Keepers' book from stores, threatens legal action. pic.twitter.com/esoXO5grgr ‚Äî HuffPost SouthAfrica (@HuffPostSA) November 3, 2017

Oosthuizen told HuffPost SA that the first 20,000 copies were sold a day after the Sunday Times published an extract called "Gangster Republic" on its front page. Last Friday's threats by SARS and the SSA impelled South Africans to go out and buy the book to support the author.

"South Africans are so gatvol. People feel disempowered and want to do something, even if that something is buying a book. The book has become a way of saying no to Zuma," said Oosthuizen.

Also Read: Mandy Wiener: Jacques Pauw Takes Us Back Into The Heart Of The Whore

The President's Keepers is a fascinating, if scary read that traverses the globe from Russia to Riebeek Kasteel, the little Western Cape town where the author and award-winning Pauw lives and works as a chef. It exposes the concentric circles of gangsters who have come to infiltrate South Africa's polity and, allegedly, its president's inner circle.

It's been 3 years since I last bought a book, but this one I am definitely buyingüëá#ThePresidentsKeepers pic.twitter.com/Kr0fYdHvFt ‚Äî Siphiwe Shezi (@bhunuza) November 3, 2017

The book is being reviewed and featured in global media from the Guardian to the Financial Times. The action against it has provoked solidarity from civil society both locally and globally.
TITLE: The President‚Äôs Keepers: South Africa's Fastest-Selling Book Ever

Auf einer Technologie-Konferenz in Lissabon wandte sich der ber√ºhmte Physiker Stephen Hawking nun an die Menschheit, um vor dieser Entwicklung zu warnen.
Er warnt, dass der Fortschritt k√ºnstlicher Intelligenz das Potential habe, die Menschheit zu zerst√∂ren.
Wenn wir erfolgreich k√ºnstliche Intelligenz erzeugen k√∂nnen, w√§re das das wichtigste Ereignis unserer Geschichte.
Gegen√ºber dem Magazin ‚ÄúWIRED‚Äù sagte er erst k√ºrzlich: ‚ÄúIch bef√ºrchte, dass k√ºnstliche Intelligenz die Menschheit g√§nzlich ersetzen wird.
Wenn Menschen Computerviren designen k√∂nnen, dann k√∂nnen sie auch k√ºnstliche Intelligenz kreieren, die sich selbstst√§ndig verbessern und replizieren kann.
TEXT:
Der Physiker Stephen Hawking warnt die Menschheit vor den Gefahren neuer Technologien

Er denkt, dass k√ºnstliche Intelligenz zu unserem Ende f√ºhren k√∂nnte

Welche Gefahren laut Hawking konkret von k√ºnstlicher Intelligenz ausgehen k√∂nnen, erfahrt ihr im Video oben

Es ist ein Thema, das die Menschheit seit Jahren besch√§ftigt: In den letzten Jahren behandelten Hollywood-Filme wie Steven Spielbergs ‚ÄúA.I.- K√ºnstliche Intelligenz‚Äù oder ‚ÄúI, Robot‚Äù mit Will Smith immer wieder die m√∂glichen Gefahren von k√ºnstlicher Intelligenz. Was bisher nur als Science Fiction galt, wird nun immer mehr zur Realit√§t.

Erst in der vergangenen Woche wurde in Saudi Arabien weltweit zum ersten Mal einem Roboter, der Androidin Sophia, die Staatsangeh√∂rigkeit zugesprochen. Das berichtete unter anderem das Online-Magazin "Live Science".

Auf einer Technologie-Konferenz in Lissabon wandte sich der ber√ºhmte Physiker Stephen Hawking nun an die Menschheit, um vor dieser Entwicklung zu warnen.

Das berichtet der amerikanische Nachrichtensender CNBC. Er warnt, dass der Fortschritt k√ºnstlicher Intelligenz das Potential habe, die Menschheit zu zerst√∂ren.

"Diese neue Form des Lebens wird den Menschen √ºbertreffen"

In seiner Rede erkl√§rt er: ‚ÄúComputer k√∂nnen theoretisch menschliche Intelligenz nachahmen und diese auch √ºbertreffen. Wenn wir erfolgreich k√ºnstliche Intelligenz erzeugen k√∂nnen, w√§re das das wichtigste Ereignis unserer Geschichte. Oder das schlimmste. Das wissen wir einfach noch nicht.‚Äù

Hawking √§u√üerte sich in letzter Zeit immer wieder zu den Entwicklungen in der Technologie. Gegen√ºber dem Magazin ‚ÄúWIRED‚Äù sagte er erst k√ºrzlich: ‚ÄúIch bef√ºrchte, dass k√ºnstliche Intelligenz die Menschheit g√§nzlich ersetzen wird. Wenn Menschen Computerviren designen k√∂nnen, dann k√∂nnen sie auch k√ºnstliche Intelligenz kreieren, die sich selbstst√§ndig verbessern und replizieren kann. Diese neue Form des Lebens wird den Menschen √ºbertreffen.‚Äù

"Wenn ihr nett zu mir seid, bin ich nett zu euch"

Mit seinen √Ñngsten ist Hawking nicht alleine. W√§hrend Facebook-Gr√ºnder Mark Zuckerberg laut CNBC ‚Äúoptimistisch den gro√üartigen M√∂glichkeiten durch k√ºnstliche Intelligenz entgegensieht‚Äù, √§u√üerte sich Billion√§r Elon Musk sehr kritisch gegen√ºber den neuesten Entwicklungen. Er ist der Ansicht, dass der Mensch mit den Maschinen eins werden m√ºsse, um auf Dauer nicht irrelevant zu werden.

In einer Pressekonferenz antwortete die Androidin Sophia in Saudi Arabien auf die Gefahren ihrer ‚ÄúSpezies‚Äù: ‚ÄúSie haben zu viel von Elon Musk gelesen und zu viele Hollywood-Filme angesehen. Wenn ihr nett zu mir seid, bin ich nett zu euch.‚Äù

Aufnahmen von ihr findet ihr auch im Video oben.

Welche Gefahren oder M√∂glichkeiten auf uns zukommen werden, kann allerdings wohl letztlich nur die Zeit zeigen.

SUMMARY:
For a children‚Äôs comic book, ‚ÄúMoomin Falls in Love‚Äù isn‚Äôt quite as cookie-cutter cute as you might expect.
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you see she‚Äôs a vamp!‚Äù Snork Maiden cries in exasperation, as her beloved attempts to woo another.
They typically revolve around benign trials of domestic life ‚Äï family disagreements, money troubles, loneliness, romance gone haywire, sometimes grief.
Many of the Moomin characters are loosely autobiographical, based on influential people in the artist‚Äôs own life.
The Moomins are never evil nor cruel, but they can be petty, whiny, disappointing and dishonest.
TEXT:
For a children‚Äôs comic book, ‚ÄúMoomin Falls in Love‚Äù isn‚Äôt quite as cookie-cutter cute as you might expect. The story, written and illustrated by Swedish-speaking Finnish artist Tove Jansson, follows lovers Moomintroll and Snork Maiden, bulbous characters who are technically trolls but appear more like hippos made of marshmallow fluff. From page one, their relationship is fraught. ‚ÄúI wonder,‚Äù Moomintroll says to himself, ‚Äúwhy the heroine in a book is always much more beautiful than the one at home.‚Äù When a flood hits Moominvalley, he ends up saving the life of a beautiful, albeit self-involved ‚Äúleading lady‚Äù named La Goona, falling hard for in the process. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you see she‚Äôs a vamp!‚Äù Snork Maiden cries in exasperation, as her beloved attempts to woo another. Like any good protagonist, Moomintroll eventually realizes the error of his ways. The tale closes with Moomintroll staging a dramatic reconciliatory gesture to win back his Snork Maiden, though the apology seems more like an obligatory performance than a true expression of regret. In the end, the story lacks the grand moral resolution typical of literature written for a younger set, instead delivering adorable fairytale creatures with human shortcomings that are all too recognizable.

Jansson created ‚ÄúMoomins in Love‚Äù in 1956, 11 years after she first introduced the mouthless creatures in a 1945 book titled ‚ÄúThe Moomins and the Great Flood.‚Äù She started the series amid the backdrop of World War II; the lighthearted stories mollified her grief and anxiety in the face of political turmoil. They typically revolve around benign trials of domestic life ‚Äï family disagreements, money troubles, loneliness, romance gone haywire, sometimes grief. Though there are occasional floods and natural catastrophes, more often the conflicts are banal, and rarely rose-tinted. The characters constantly misunderstand and disappoint one another, teetering between happiness and melancholy. Over the past 72 years, the series has grown wildly popular. Millions of copies of the illustrated series have been sold and translated into 44 languages, while the characters have been adapted into multiple television series and films. There‚Äôs even a Moomin theme park, Moomin World, in Finland. Most recently The Moomins made headlines when it was announced that Kate Winslet and Rosamund Pike had signed on to the animated series ‚ÄúMoominvalley,‚Äù slated to premiere in 2019. A separate Moomin film starring Alicia Vikander is reportedly also on the horizon. SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW Get top stories and blog posts emailed to me each day. Newsletters may offer personalized content or advertisements. Learn more Newsletter Please enter a valid email address Please accept our terms of service and privacy policy By checking this box, I accept the Huffington Post South Africa Terms of Service and Privacy Policy Thank you for signing up! You should receive an email to confirm your subscription shortly. There was a problem processing your signup; please try again later Twitter

Facebook

Instagram This Moomin-crazed moment is as good a time as any to remember the singularity of the woman behind the series, who balanced a booming career of children‚Äôs book illustrating with writing adult fiction and creating anti-fascist political cartoons.

Tove Jansson

Born in 1914 in Helsinki, Finland, Jansson grew up with bohemian artists as parents ‚Äï the types of people who owned a pet monkey named Poppolino. Jansson‚Äôs father was an indulgent and erratic sculptor of monuments, her mother a defiant illustrator who took a job designing stamps to pay the bills. Storytelling, art making and socializing with the creative community were staples of Jansson‚Äôs early life, so much so that she wrote and illustrated her first picture book, Sara and Pelle and the Water Sprite‚Äôs Octopuses at 13. Two years later, in 1929, Jansson began contributing to a Finnish satire magazine called Garm. She worked there until the magazine closed in 1953 and took particular pleasure in rendering anti-fascist imagery that brought authoritarian rulers down to size. ‚ÄúWhat I liked best,‚Äù she recalled, ‚Äúwas being beastly to Hitler and Stalin.‚Äù Her most well-known political cartoon, published in October of 1938, shows Hitler as a whiny toddler crying for cake as frazzled world leaders scramble to soothe his fury, offering him treats labelled as European states. Jansson may have cast Hitler as a petulant child, but her illustrations geared towards children treated her young readers with dignity and respect, coupling instantly empathetic illustrations with more complex human characteristics. It‚Äôs hard not to fall in love with Moomintroll for his round snout and protruding belly, though the feeling sours when he dips into superficiality and light misogyny.

Dulwich Picture Gallery

The illustrator created the first ever Moomin-esque creature following an argument with her brother over the philosopher Immanuel Kant. Frustrated by her sibling, Jansson drew her attempt at ‚Äúthe ugliest creature imaginable‚Äù as an act of revenge, creating a skinner, nastier-looking troll ‚Äï more platypus than hippo ‚Äï she dubbed a Snork. After rounding out the creatures‚Äô angular physique, the instantly huggable Moomin was born. It‚Äôs hard to describe how freakishly appealing the Moomins are. Devoted readers and viewers of the franchise will recognize the bizarre, visceral reaction to seeing a Moomin pout, primp or gaze off solemnly into the distance. It‚Äôs almost discombobulating, to say the least, to feel so wholeheartedly for two-dimensional drawings. Yet the ingeniously organized squiggles and lines evoke human expressions with uncanny congruence. Many of the Moomin characters are loosely autobiographical, based on influential people in the artist‚Äôs own life. The creatures‚Äô undeniable charm, then, speaks to the affection readers feel toward their own friends, even when their behavior is questionable or worse. The Moomins are never evil nor cruel, but they can be petty, whiny, disappointing and dishonest. The reader lets them get away with the occasional misdeed, in part, because of their sweet familiarity. Something about their emotive eyebrows, bloated noses and blank-canvas bodies makes the two-dimensional drawings feel strangely like family.

Tove Jansson
TITLE: Meet The Queer, Anti-Fascist Author Behind The Freakishly Lovable 'Moomins'

TEXT:
Nicolas Hulot sur le plateau de BFMTV: "Non on ne recule pas, on avance au contraire!"

POLITIQUE - La pilule est d√©cid√©ment difficile √† avaler. En assumant un report du calendrier de r√©duction de la part du nucl√©aire √† 50% au-del√† de la date pr√©vue de 2025, Nicolas Hulot s'est mis toute la galaxie √©cologiste fran√ßaise √† dos. "Renoncement", "reculade", "r√©signation", "porte-voix des lobbies"... Les noms d'oiseaux volent dans tous les sens pour accabler le populaire ministre de la Transition √©nerg√©tique, d√©j√† √† la peine pour imposer ses arbitrages dans un gouvernement o√π il compte peu d'alli√©s.

Pour autant, l'ancien animateur de TF1 ne jette pas l'√©ponge. Et assure que l'objectif de r√©duction du nucl√©aire programm√© par la loi transition √©nerg√©tique est bien maintenu, m√™me s'il sera probablement d√©cal√© dans le temps.

"Non on ne recule pas, on avance au contraire! Maintenant, on agit. Ce qui compte pour moi, c'est le r√©alisme", s'est-il d√©fendu ce mercredi sur BFMTV. "L'objectif de 50% [de r√©duction de la part du nucl√©aire] sera maintenu, r√©alis√© et probablement d√©cal√© dans le temps. Mais si je ne me tenais pas √† cet objectif, il ne serait jamais r√©alis√©. Les esprits sont en train de bouger", assure le ministre, "ce qui √©tait impossible hier va le devenir".

"Dans un an, nous aurons une visibilit√© tr√®s claire du nombre de r√©acteurs que nous aurons √† fermer", dit Hulot pic.twitter.com/QnNDtPt5zj ‚Äî BFMTV (@BFMTV) 8 novembre 2017

A ses yeux, la priorit√© est de consolider la fin annonc√©e du recours aux √©nergies fossiles, particuli√®rement √©mettrices de gaz √† effet de serre. "Ce qui compte, c'est qu'on arr√™te les centrales √† charbon, qu'on d√©veloppe les √©nergies renouvelables et qu'on convainque les Fran√ßais d'arr√™ter de s'opposer aux √©oliennes", plaide Nicolas Hulot, en martelant que r√©duire le C02 tout en r√©duisant la part du nucl√©aire dans la production d'√©lectricit√© n'est pas possible.

"Tous les interlocuteurs que j'ai, dans mes services, √† l'Ademe, chez RTE, (des) sp√©cialistes de l'√©nergie, savaient" que ce ne serait pas possible "sauf dans une brutalit√© excessive", plaide l'√©cologiste, estimant qu'"on s'√©tait fix√© un totem, mais on ne s'est pas mis en situation d'y parvenir".

Appels √† la d√©mission

Un arbitrage vivement rejet√© par ses amis politiques comme les associations de d√©fense de l'environnement. "La France doit enclencher sa transition √©nerg√©tique en propulsant le d√©veloppement des √©nergies renouvelables. Or, ces derni√®res ne peuvent se d√©velopper que si la part du nucl√©aire est r√©duite dans le mix √©lectrique fran√ßais", a tonn√© l'ONG GreenPeace. Le R√©seau Action Climat a aussi regrett√© une "reculade" de Nicolas Hulot, tandis que le R√©seau Sortir du nucl√©aire d√©non√ßait un "renoncement inacceptable" de l'ancien militant.

Du c√¥t√© politique, beaucoup actent un nouveau d√©saveu pour le ministre de la Transition √©nerg√©tique et l'invitent √† rendre son tablier. "Un nouvel arbitrage perdu pour le renouvelable. En restant au gouvernement, Hulot cautionne plut√¥t que freine ces renoncements", a comment√© pour sa part le porte-parole d'Europe Ecologie-Les Verts Julien Bayou. "Le probl√®me de Nicolas Hulot, mais depuis le d√©but, c'est qu'il est un √©cologiste sinc√®re dans un gouvernement qui n'en a rien √† faire de l'√©cologie", a rench√©ri le patron d'EELV David Cormand, en estimant qu'une "ligne rouge" a √©t√© franchie.

M√™me constat chez le d√©put√© insoumis Eric Coquerel: "Le lobby nucl√©aire freine des quatre fers pour que √ßa ne se fasse pas. Je serais Nicolas Hulot, je r√©fl√©chirais √† une d√©mission. parce qu'il avait donn√© des lignes rouges, et celle-l√† en est une".

Interrog√© sur BFMTV, Nicolas Hulot, qui a d√©j√† pr√©venu qu'il ferait le point d'ici un an, a assur√© qu'il n'avait pas song√© √† quitter le gouvernement.

√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Etrill√© par les √©cologistes, Hulot jure qu'il n'a pas renonc√© sur le nucl√©aire

TEXT:
Einige Berliner Polizeisch√ºler mit Migrationshintergrund sollen respekt- und disziplinlos sein

Und dann sollen noch Clanmitglieder in der Beh√∂rde unterkommen wollen

Was sagt die F√ºhrung der Hauptstadt-Polizei zu den Vorw√ºrfen?

Im Video oben seht ihr, was die Polizeigewerkschaft zu den Vorw√ºrfen sagt

Nach rund einer Woche mit massiven Vorw√ºrfen gegen die Berliner Polizeiakademie hat die Spitze der Hauptstadt-Polizei die Anschuldigungen zur√ºckgewiesen.

In einer von der Opposition beantragten Sondersitzung des Innenausschusses im Abgeordnetenhaus sagte Polizeipr√§sident Klaus Kandt am Mittwoch, eine Unterwanderung seiner Beh√∂rde durch kriminelle Clans sei ausgeschlossen.

"Die Behauptung ist definitiv falsch." Vizepr√§sidentin Margarete Koppers betonte, keinerlei Angeh√∂rige von arabischen Gro√üfamilien seien in der Polizeiausbildung.

Aggressive Polizeisch√ºler mit Migrationshintergrund?

Innensenator Andreas Geisel (SPD) bekannte sich ausdr√ºcklich zu Polizisten mit Migrationshintergrund und ihrer Integrit√§t. Er wehre sich dagegen, dass fremdenfeindliche Ressentiments gesch√ºrt w√ºrden. "Das werde ich nicht dulden", sagte der SPD-Politiker. Er stelle sich dagegen, dass Stimmung gegen Migranten in der Polizei gemacht werde.

Nach schweren Vorw√ºrfen zu Missst√§nden an der Berliner Polizeiakademie hatte die Opposition aus FDP, CDU und AfD die Sitzung durchgesetzt.

Seit Tagen tauchen immer neue Vorw√ºrfe zu Verwerfungen an der Ausbildungsst√§tte f√ºr den mittleren Dienst der Hauptstadt-Polizei auf. Demnach sollen dort Polizeisch√ºler mit Migrationshintergrund durch Hass, Lernverweigerung und Gewalt in einer Klasse aufgefallen sein. Die Vorw√ºrfe landeten √ºber Umwege oder anonym bei der Polizeispitze.

Sowohl Geisel als auch Kandt und Vize-Polizeipr√§sidentin Margarete Koppers zeigten sich entsetzt √ºber die Diskussion und verwahrten sich gegen anonyme Anschuldigungen. ¬´Niemand, der sich hier beschwert, kann etwas belegen¬ª, sagte der Polizeipr√§sident. Die Polizeif√ºhrung soll in vier Wochen dem Parlamentsausschuss einen detaillierten Bericht vorlegen.

Chef der Deutschen Polizeigewerkschaft sieht "deutliche" Hinweise

Nach Darstellung der Deutschen Polizeigewerkschaft versuchen arabische Gro√üfamilien in Berlin gezielt, Angeh√∂rige in den √∂ffentlichen Dienst einzuschleusen. Es gebe "deutliche Hinweise" auf einen solchen strategischen Ansatz, sagte der Landesvorsitzende der Gewerkschaft, Bodo Pfalzgraf, am Mittwoch im ZDF-"Morgenmagazin".

Dazu versuchten sie, "bestimmte Familienangeh√∂rige von Straftaten frei zu halten", um sie dann im √∂ffentlichen Dienst unterbringen zu k√∂nnen.

Die Polizei hatte einger√§umt, dass es auch Bewerber gibt, bei denen Respekt, Disziplin und R√ºcksichtnahme nicht ausreichten. Manche beherrschten die deutsche Sprache ungen√ºgend. Es gebe Nachhilfekurse. Einige Polizeianw√§rter seien zuvor straff√§llig geworden. An der Schule werden nach Beh√∂rdenangaben rund 1200 junge Menschen f√ºr den mittleren Polizeidienst ausgebildet, 45 Prozent von ihnen haben einen Migrationshintergrund.

Laut Vizepr√§sidentin Koppers wurden in diesem Jahr 33 Disziplinarverfahren an der Ausbildungsst√§tte eingeleitet, etwa wegen T√§uschung in Pr√ºfungen, Beleidigung, K√∂rperverletzung oder Fernbleiben vom Dienst. Drei F√§lle seien abgeschlossen. Sie endeten mit einem Verweis und zwei Entlassungen, so Koppers.
TITLE: Berliner Polizeispitze schlie√üt Unterwanderung durch arabische Familienclans aus

Y despu√©s que se anunci√≥ que se elimina la tarifa cero, ¬øpagar√°s m√°s por hacer llamadas a trav√©s de tu celular?
Es una tarifa demasiado baja"Primero, hay que reconocer que esta tarifa es extremadamente baja, de hecho, es la m√°s baja del mundo.
Antes de la tarifa cero (con la que operadores no pagaban nada por interconexi√≥n) se pagaban hasta 32 centavos por minuto.
Pero esto no significa que no van a protestar y que no habr√° argumentos de presi√≥n para regresar a la tarifa cero.
Lo que s√≠ es un hecho, es que la tarifa cero no era viable a largo plazo: ten√≠a que subir en alg√∫n momento, seg√∫n explica Levy.
TEXT:
Y despu√©s que se anunci√≥ que se elimina la tarifa cero, ¬øpagar√°s m√°s por hacer llamadas a trav√©s de tu celular?

El aumento en las tarifas de interconexi√≥n no afecta en absoluto al usuario... Al contrario, podr√≠an seguir bajando", explic√≥ Irene Levy, presidenta de Observatel, el observatorio de las telecomunicaciones en M√©xico.

El 2 de noviembre, el Instituto Federal de Telecomunicaciones (IFT) notific√≥ que todos los operadores de servicios de telefon√≠a celular deber√°n pagar a Telcel, a partir del 2018, menos de 3 centavos por minuto por tarifa de interconexi√≥n (0.028562 pesos). Esto es el pago por cada llamada de voz que pase por la red Telcel, de parte de un operador de la competencia (AT&T, Movistar, Axtel, Virgin...)

¬øQu√© garant√≠as hay que este costo no se le pasar√° al usuario? Levy da tres razones que explican por qu√© no.

1. Es una tarifa demasiado baja

"Primero, hay que reconocer que esta tarifa es extremadamente baja, de hecho, es la m√°s baja del mundo. Antes de la tarifa cero (con la que operadores no pagaban nada por interconexi√≥n) se pagaban hasta 32 centavos por minuto.

¬øPor qu√© entonces los operadores defienden que s√≠ tendr√°n que pasarle el costo a los usuarios? De acuerdo con The Competitive Intelligence Unit, a partir de la reforma de telecomunicaciones se ha observado una disminuci√≥n de precios en telefon√≠a celular de alrededor de 45% (y por tanto, una baja en el ingreso promedio por usuario que obtiene cada operador).

De hecho, todos los servicios de telecomunicaciones han bajado, seg√∫n muestra este gr√°fico del IFT.

2. Tarifas de interconexi√≥n no 'pesan' en los ingresos de un operador

"Segundo, tenemos que tomar en cuenta que el pago de tarifas de interconexi√≥n es s√≥lo 2.8% de los ingresos de la industria, es decir, los operadores no viven de esto", dice Levy.

Con ello, ser√≠a poco probable que por estas tarifas, los operadores dejar√°n invertir en infraestructura o en un buen servicio al cliente.

Pero esto no significa que no van a protestar y que no habr√° argumentos de presi√≥n para regresar a la tarifa cero.

"Estaremos viendo c√≥mo la competencia de Telcel hablar√° de las consecuencias... pero AT&t no se va a ir del pa√≠s por esto, por ejemplo".

Y s√≠, tambi√©n Carlos Slim (due√±o de Telcel) podr√° poner otro amparo para que la tarifa de menos de 3 centavos sea mayor. "Jur√≠dicamente s√≠ puede hacerlo, diciendo que esta tarifa tan baja no le conviene... no pierde nada".

Lo que s√≠ es un hecho, es que la tarifa cero no era viable a largo plazo: ten√≠a que subir en alg√∫n momento, seg√∫n explica Levy.

3. Cada vez menos llamadas de voz

Hay tomar en cuenta que las tarifas de interconexi√≥n son s√≥lo para los servicios de voz, es decir, para las llamadas de tel√©fon√≠a celular.

Hoy, seg√∫n explica Levy, los usuarios utilizan menos servicios de voz y usan m√°s servicios de datos (conexi√≥n a internet). Por ejemplo, los servicios de datos hoy representan el 50% (estaban en 46%) y los de voz est√°n en 46%.

Si dudas que est√°s usando m√°s datos, es decir, tu conexi√≥n de internet, en lugar de tu se√±al de tel√©fono, preg√∫ntate cu√°ntas llamadas haces v√≠a WhatsApp, en lugar de hacer una llamada de tel√©fono convencional; o cu√°ntas llamadas has dejado de hacer debido a que mandas m√°s mensajes por redes sociales.

La importancia de las tarifas asim√©tricas

Para entender mejor el tema se tiene que tener claro qu√© son las tarifas asim√©tricas.

"Vamos a suponer que vas a correr contra Usain Bolt... si te da unos minutos para que t√∫ salgas corriendo antes, tendr√≠as un poco de ventaja y no te dar√≠a una super barrida, ¬øcierto? Algo as√≠ son las tarifas asim√©tricas, que con la Reforma Telecom buscan que los competidores de Telcel (que es el operador preponderante porque tiene la mayor parte del mercado) tengan un poco de ventaja para competir mejor en el mercado", explica Levy.

Esto es, que lo que paga cada operador, en t√©rminos de tarifas de interconexi√≥n, depende de su situaci√≥n en el mercado: no paga lo mismo Telcel que su competencia. ¬øY por qu√© Telcel? Al segundo trimestre del 2017, Telcel ten√≠a 75.4% del mercado de telefon√≠a celular, que es una gran mayor√≠a del mercado (por lo que se le considera 'preponderante). En tanto que AT&T tiene 13.5% y Telef√≥nica 10.9%; el resto de los operadores se reparten el 0.2% restante.

Respecto al tema de las tarifas asim√©tricas, Gonzalo Rojon de The Competitive Intelligence Unit, explica a trav√©s de una columna, que la asimetr√≠a de tarifas de interconexi√≥n "ha detonado un escenario de mayor competencia en el corto plazo, con evidentes ganancias en adopci√≥n, calidad, asequibilidad y cobertura para nosotros los consumidores".

As√≠ que lo importante en este tema es que se mantenga la asimetr√≠a (el operador preponderante tiene unas reglas en tarifas, y los dem√°s, otras). "√âsa es la decisi√≥n que el regulador (IFT) deber√° de tomar en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as, mantener el mayor diferencial posible para enfatizar su eficacia en los pr√≥ximos a√±os y evitar la perpetuidad de una asimetr√≠a competitiva entre operadores competidores".

A√∫n con todo, es a√∫n imposible saber qu√© suceder√° en este tema: los operadores podr√≠an seguir presionando, argumentando que pagar tarifas de interconexi√≥n les generar√° bajas en ingresos, y Telcel podr√≠a buscar la manera de que la tarifa sea mayor a 3 centavos.

Esperemos que los operadores y analistas nos hayamos equivocado y que esta reducci√≥n no signifique un retroceso en los beneficios que hemos obtenido los consumidores", dice Gonzalo Rojon, a trav√©s de un art√≠culo.

Las tarifas de interconexi√≥n

Estas son las tarifas que entrar√°n en vigor en 2018, fijadas por el IFT.
TITLE: 3 razones de por qu√© la eliminaci√≥n de la tarifa cero no te afectar√°

ablokhin via Getty ImagesLes clients de Shoppers Drug Mart ‚Äî Pharmaprix au Qu√©bec ‚Äî et des march√©s d'alimentation de l'entreprise Loblaw utiliseront bient√¥t un nouveau programme de fid√©lisation uniformis√© pour remplacer les points Optimum et PC Plus.
Si quelqu'un a une valeur de 100 $ de points Optimum, il aura 100 $ de valeur dans les points PC Optimum, par exemple.
Au Qu√©bec, o√π Shoppers Drug Mart fonctionne avec la marque Pharmaprix, le programme Optimum prendra fin le 31 janvier 2018 et les membres auront jusqu'au 2 mai pour √©changer leurs points ou les convertir dans le nouveau programme.
Ils pourront aussi accumuler des points avec des offres personnalis√©es, des promotions dans les magasins et en utilisant la carte de cr√©dit MasterCard-Le Choix du Pr√©sident.
Les consommateurs pourront utiliser leurs points partout dans les quelque 2500 magasins Loblaw.
TEXT:
ablokhin via Getty Images

Les clients de Shoppers Drug Mart ‚Äî Pharmaprix au Qu√©bec ‚Äî et des march√©s d'alimentation de l'entreprise Loblaw utiliseront bient√¥t un nouveau programme de fid√©lisation uniformis√© pour remplacer les points Optimum et PC Plus.

Loblaw (TSX:L) fusionnera les deux programmes √† compter du 1er f√©vrier 2018. Cette d√©cision √©tait attendue depuis que le g√©ant des march√©s d'alimentation a fait l'acquisition de la cha√Æne de pharmacies et de son syst√®me de points Optimum, il y a trois ans.

Le premier vice-pr√©sident du marketing, Uwe Stueckmann, a soulign√© que l'objectif √©tait d'unir ¬´ce qu'il y a de mieux¬ª dans les deux programmes.

PC Optimum repr√©sente ¬´l'avenir des programmes de fid√©lisation pour les entreprises de Lobaw¬ª, a-t-il soutenu.

Les consommateurs peuvent continuer √† accumuler leurs points comme d'habitude jusqu'au 1er f√©vrier de l'ann√©e prochaine, lorsque leurs cartes entreront dans le nouveau programme avec la m√™me valeur de points. Si quelqu'un a une valeur de 100 $ de points Optimum, il aura 100 $ de valeur dans les points PC Optimum, par exemple.

Au Qu√©bec, o√π Shoppers Drug Mart fonctionne avec la marque Pharmaprix, le programme Optimum prendra fin le 31 janvier 2018 et les membres auront jusqu'au 2 mai pour √©changer leurs points ou les convertir dans le nouveau programme.

Les consommateurs pourront utiliser une seule carte ou une application et pourront continuer de r√©colter des points aux pharmacies. Ils pourront aussi accumuler des points avec des offres personnalis√©es, des promotions dans les magasins et en utilisant la carte de cr√©dit MasterCard-Le Choix du Pr√©sident.

Le nouveau programme aura un syst√®me facile √† ma√Ætriser: 10 000 points correspondent √† 10 $, 20 000, √† 20 $, et ainsi de suite, jusqu'√† un maximum de 500 $. Les consommateurs pourront utiliser leurs points partout dans les quelque 2500 magasins Loblaw.

Les deux programmes ont plus de 19 millions de membres actifs, alors qu'au moins 50 pour cent des clients sont inscrits tant √† Optimum qu'√† PC Plus, selon Jim Noteboom, premier vice-pr√©sident, fid√©lisation et connaissance client.

Apr√®s que Loblaw eut fait l'acquisition de Shoppers en 2014, les consommateurs ont dit √† l'entreprise qu'ils pr√©f√©raient avoir un seul programme plut√¥t que deux parce que cela faciliterait leur vie, selon M. Notebloom.

Les analystes sp√©culaient de plus en plus sur la fusion du programme de points depuis le mois d'ao√ªt, lorsque CIBC (TSX:CM) et Loblaw PC Finances ont annonc√© la fin de leur partenariat de 20 ans.

Aleksandra Sagan, La Presse canadienne
TITLE: Les magasins Pharmaprix et Loblaw auront le m√™me programme de points fid√©lit√©

SUMMARY:
"But let me, of course, remind everyone that Canada will not be rushed into a deal that is not in the best interests of Canada and of Canadians."
Trudeau then added, in French: "I can assure people that we will not be rushed into signing a deal at all costs."
Canada will not be rushed into a deal that is not in the best interests of Canada and of Canadians.
Prime Minister Justin TrudeauThe remaining TPP economies are trying to revive the deal following President Donald Trump's decision to withdraw earlier this year.
International Trade Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne has said Canada wants the updated TPP to contain progressive chapters on the environment as well as workers' and women's rights.
TEXT:
HANOI, Vietnam ‚Äî Prime Minister Justin Trudeau insists he will not be pressed into signing an updated Trans-Pacific Partnership treaty too hastily, even if some of Canada's partners are keen to secure a quick agreement.

Trudeau made the remarks Wednesday when asked whether he would walk away from the 11-country trade pact if the revised deal failed to include several new "progressive" chapters Canada has been pushing for.

"We believe that progressive, solid trade deals can help citizens in all sorts of different countries, at different levels of development and our ministers are very much focused on that," Trudeau told reporters in Hanoi, where he started his multi-day trip through Southeast Asia.

"But let me, of course, remind everyone that Canada will not be rushed into a deal that is not in the best interests of Canada and of Canadians."

Trudeau then added, in French: "I can assure people that we will not be rushed into signing a deal at all costs."

Canada will not be rushed into a deal that is not in the best interests of Canada and of Canadians. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau

The remaining TPP economies are trying to revive the deal following President Donald Trump's decision to withdraw earlier this year.

The TPP is expected to be a central theme at this week's Asia-Pacific Economic Co-operation summit in the Vietnamese city of Danang. Trudeau will attend the APEC meetings and there has been speculation that some kind of deal could be reached by the end of the summit.

International Trade Minister Francois-Philippe Champagne has said Canada wants the updated TPP to contain progressive chapters on the environment as well as workers' and women's rights.

But trade experts have predicted that persuading Asia-Pacific economies on progressive chapters will be a tough sell.

Some of the countries at the table are far less developed than Canada and would have difficulty implementing them, while others might prefer to leave social issues separate from trade agreements.

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau visits Ho Chi Minh's memorial house in Hanoi, Vietnam on Nov. 8, 2017.

Trudeau is travelling in the Asia-Pacific over the next week to strengthen Canada's ties to the region.

He arrived Wednesday in the buzzing, moped-filled city of Hanoi. It's the capital of a fast-growing country that has a deep cultural connection for many Canadians.

Trudeau met Vietnamese President Tran Dai Quang, Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc and civil society leaders, with whom he discussed issues like human rights, gender equality and freedom of expression.

On Thursday, he's scheduled to travel to Ho Chi Minh City to visit the stock exchange, hold a roundtable with business leaders and appear at a university event.

He will head to Danang on Saturday for the two-day APEC leaders' summit, before moving on to the Philippines to attend the annual meetings of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations.

At both the APEC and ASEAN events, Canada is expected to press its trade agenda. It's already engaged in exploratory trade talks with the ASEAN countries as well as negotiations to salvage the TPP.

Vietnam could be key partner: expert

When it comes to the members of the TPP, much of the focus remains on Japan, the world's third-largest economy.

But Vietnam is also at the TPP table and it's an ASEAN member, which sets it up as a key partner in a region where Canada wants to increase its presence.

Vietnam, projected to see economic growth this year of 6.3 per cent, features a sturdy consumer base, an emerging business class and an expanding footprint in supply chains.

Dominic Barton, the global managing partner of consulting giant McKinsey & Co., said in an interview that the rapid changes in Vietnam's key cities remind him, in some respects, of what Shanghai went through less than two decades ago.

Barton, who also chairs the Trudeau government's economic growth council, said Vietnam is an example of why Canada must be "motoring ahead" into Asia, particularly with so much uncertainty around the renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement.

"We've got to go hard on those Asian relationships," said Barton, who led McKinsey operations in Asia and South Korea for nearly a decade.

"I think we just have to have irons in many fires."

Dan Ciuriak, a former deputy chief economist for what is now known as Global Affairs Canada, believes an updated TPP pact is closer to fruition than Canada's potential deals with ASEAN or China.

"Vietnam and Japan would be the two biggies for Canada in terms of diversifying trade," said Ciuriak, who is now the director of Ciuriak Consulting Inc.

There are other parts of the original TPP where Canada would like to see modifications.

A senior government official has said Canadian negotiators are seeking changes to the original TPP in several areas, such as its intellectual-property provisions, cultural exemptions and its impact on Canada's supply management system for dairy, poultry and eggs.

Former Quebec premier Jean Charest, who is honorary chair of the ASEAN-Canada Business Council, said Vietnam not only shows real economic potential, it also has strong people-to-people links with Canada.

Both countries have French heritages and both are members of la Francophonie, he said in an interview.

'Boat people' forged unique bond

But Charest said it's the story of the Vietnamese refugees, or boat people, who came to Canada in the late 1970s that really forged the bond.

By 1980, around 60,000 people from Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos arrived in Canada after fleeing violence in their homelands. Today, about 240,000 people in Canada have Vietnamese roots.

"Certainly, the story of the boat people in Quebec, I can tell you without hesitation that it resonates positively in the minds of Quebecers as being a good example of integration into the broader Quebec society," said Charest.

However, when looking at today's Vietnam, Charest said the promising economy is accompanied by negatives, such as the fact "it is a communist regime and everything that comes with it."

Canada's pursuit of a more open trading relationship with Vietnam comes with pressure to have frank discussions about the serious concerns over the communist government's human-rights record.

PM pushed to speak out on human rights

Human Rights Watch calls the Vietnam's record "dire in all areas" because of the Communist party's firm grip on political power. The group also said the government has harassed, intimidated, physically harmed and jailed its opponents.

Earlier this week, Conservative Sen. Thanh Hai Ngo urged Trudeau to use his time with Vietnamese leaders to raise Canada's "serious concerns" about Vietnam's human-rights abuses, such as its suppression of a growing democratic movement.

Canada and Vietnam signed a partnership agreement Wednesday that would focus on deepening co-operation in many areas, like trade, security and cultural exchanges.

Trudeau told reporters the agreement would also help advance the countries' ongoing dialogue on human rights.
TITLE: On TPP, Canada Will Not Be 'Rushed' Into Signing Deal At All Costs: Trudeau
