TEXT:
J'ai d√©j√† rencontr√© des d√©tracteurs de Donald Trump, de nombreux d√©tracteurs, de ceux qui sautent sur chaque th√©orie du complot et qui refusent de lui accorder le moindre b√©n√©fice du doute. Un an apr√®s l'√©lection du nouveau pr√©sident, les quatre personnes avec qui j'ai r√©cemment pass√© la matin√©e √† la Solly's Tavern de Washington (sans alcool, ne vous inqui√©tez pas) n'√©taient pas des d√©tracteurs de Trump. Il s'agissait, en revanche, de d√©serteurs.

Chacun d'entre eux, √† un moment ou √† un autre au cours des neuf derniers mois, a quitt√© son poste au sein de l'administration actuelle, apr√®s avoir d√©cid√© qu'il pourrait mieux servir son pays √† l'ext√©rieur du gouvernement plut√¥t que de l'int√©rieur. Ils n'√©taient pas non plus ravis de partir. Ils √©taient fonctionnaires et souhaitaient le rester et, √† l'exception de l'un d'entre eux, avaient travaill√© sous des pr√©sidents des deux partis. Pendant leurs ann√©es pass√©es au service du public, il leur √©tait arriv√© d'√™tre en d√©saccord avec leurs sup√©rieurs, de craindre l'arriv√©e de nouvelles r√©glementations et de se m√©fier des nominations politiques, mais ils √©taient rest√©s parce que c'est la nature d'une carri√®re dans le gouvernement. C'√©tait diff√©rent.

Lorsqu'ils se sont retrouv√©s pour cette conversation il y a deux semaines, l'entente fut instantan√©e. L'ambiance √©tait conviviale et famili√®re comme celle d'une r√©union d'anciens √©l√®ves, outre le fait qu'ils √©taient encore de parfaits inconnus cinq minutes plus t√¥t. Ils √©taient originaires de diff√©rents secteurs de la bureaucratie, leurs √¢ges et leurs formations variaient consid√©rablement, mais ils s'√©taient pos√© les m√™mes questions depuis l'√©lection de Trump. Leurs coll√®gues de travail se sentiraient-ils trahis apr√®s leur d√©part ? Leurs rempla√ßants auraient-ils des opinions antith√©tiques aux leurs? Apr√®s avoir pass√© la majeure partie de leur vie dans les services administratifs, se sentaient-ils vraiment pr√™ts √† prendre publiquement position ? Une fois arriv√©s au c≈ìur de l'entretien, qui a √©t√© √©dit√© et r√©sum√© par souci de clart√©, ils se sont montr√©s sinc√®res, dr√¥les et enrag√©s. Ils ne travaillent peut-√™tre plus pour le gouvernement, mais ils se consid√®rent toujours comme des fonctionnaires.

Tr√®s bien. Sharon, vous √™tes partie la premi√®re. Commen√ßons avec le soir des √©lections. √Ä quoi pensiez-vous? Que ressentiez-vous?

Sharon McGowan (ancienne directrice adjointe de la branche des droits civiques du d√©partement de la Justice des √âtats-Unis):J'ai ressenti cette angoisse qui commen√ßait √† s'emparer de moi, de fa√ßon tr√®s physique. Alors le lendemain de l'√©lection, ma femme et moi avons d√©cid√© de rester √† la maison pour se regrouper en famille. En tant que couple homosexuel dans ce pays, nous connaissions exactement les enjeux. Et pendant les premiers jours, j'ai essay√© de garder un √©tat d'esprit positif: ¬´Peut-√™tre que Trump ne pensait pas vraiment ce qu'il a dit, peut-√™tre que c'√©tait seulement pour l'audimat.¬ª Et √ßa a plut√¥t bien fonctionn√©! Au moins jusqu'√† ce que Jeff Sessions ne soit annonc√© comme candidat pour le poste de procureur g√©n√©ral. C'est l√† que j'ai r√©alis√© que mes jours dans le gouvernement √©taient compt√©s.

Vous √©tiez certaine de devoir partir?

McGowan: Non, j'ai vraiment eu des moments de doute. Le jour de ma d√©mission par exemple, Sally Yates (procureure g√©n√©rale √† titre int√©rimaire, ndlr) s'est √©lev√©e et a d√©clar√© qu'elle ne d√©fendrait pas le ¬´Muslim ban¬ª et je me suis dit: ¬´Oh non, peut-√™tre que je me suis tromp√©e. Peut-√™tre que je devrais rester aÃÄ l'int√©rieur.¬ª Et puis bien s√ªr, on est tous revenus apr√®s la pause publicitaire pour d√©couvrir que Yates avait √©t√© vir√©e. Alors j'ai eu l'impression que c'√©tait un signe de l'univers pour me faire comprendre que je n'avais pas abandonn√© le navire trop t√¥t.

Sharon McGowan. Au sein du d√©partement de la Justice, elle a contribu√© √† faire avancer des politiques progressistes, telles que l'√©galit√© en mati√®re de mariage. Elle est d√©sormais directrice de la strat√©gie chez Lambda Legal.

Walt, vous √™tes rest√© jusqu'au mois de juillet. Parlez-moi du moment o√π vous avez r√©alis√© que votre monde avait radicalement chang√©.

Walter Shaub (ancien directeur de l'Office of Government Ethics, le bureau d'√©thique gouvernementale): Mon histoire est diff√©rente dans la mesure o√π je me suis r√©veill√© le lendemain matin de l'√©lection en √©tant assez optimiste quant au travail qui m'attendait avec l'√©quipe de transition. On avait pass√© environ cinq mois √† travailler avec eux avant l'√©lection, et c'√©tait des gens tr√®s s√©rieux qui s'y connaissaient vraiment.

Alors j'ai envoy√© un e-mail de f√©licitations enthousiaste d'un c√¥t√© et un e-mail de condol√©ances de l'autre, et j'ai re√ßu des r√©ponses de chaque √©quipe nous remerciant pour le travail de l'OGE. Les gens de l'√©quipe de Trump ont dit qu'ils √©taient impatients de continuer √† travailler avec nous et qu'ils t√©l√©phoneraient dans l'apr√®s-midi pour convenir d'un rendez-vous. La transition prend environ 73 jours, et vous disposez de cette p√©riode pour mettre en place tout un gouvernement. Vous devez savoir ce que vous faites, et vous devez utiliser chaque seconde judicieusement. C'est une t√¢che monumentale. Mais cet apr√®s-midi-l√†, tous ceux avec qui nous avions travaill√© avaient disparus et puis ce fut le silence radio.

Plus tard, on a lu des bulletins d'informations qui sugg√©raient que Don McGahn (un habitu√© de Washington qui exerce d√©sormais le r√¥le de conseiller juridique de la Maison-Blanche, ndlr) √©tait susceptible d'endosser le r√¥le de conseiller pour la transition, mais nous n'avons pas pu obtenir de rendez-vous avec lui avant longtemps. Et puis lorsque nous y sommes parvenus, il √©tait incroyablement flagrant que les choses lui passaient compl√®tement au-dessus de la t√™te. √Ä un moment il m'a demand√© si j'√©tais la personne charg√©e d'attribuer des habilitations de s√©curit√© ou qui examinait les v√©rifications des ant√©c√©dents des candidats par le FBI. Je lui ai dit: ¬´Non, c'est vous.¬ª Et il m'a r√©pondu: ¬´C'est moi?¬ª

Le moment qui m'a le plus marqu√©, c'est ce week-end o√π personne n'est parvenu √† savoir o√π Don McGahn se trouvait et puis on a lu dans le journal qu'il avait fait un concert avec son groupe de reprises des ann√©es 80 √† Philadelphie.

Walter Shaub, "un homme tellement aust√®re et humble qu'il avait retireÃÅ toutes les d√©corations de son bureau", selon "The Atlantic". Il est d√©sormais le directeur principal du Campaign Legal Center.

Mike, les fonctionnaires de l'Environmental Protection Agency [l'agence am√©ricaine de protection de l'environnement] se battent depuis longtemps avec les nominations politiques. Pourquoi selon-vous la situation est bien pire aujourd'hui?

Mike Cox (ancien conseiller charg√© du changement climatique √† l'EPA): J'ai travaill√© avec six gouvernements, en commen√ßant sous Reagan jusqu'au gouvernement actuel, et nous avons eu des diff√©rences d'opinions, mais je n'ai jamais eu le sentiment que quelqu'un venait d√©manteler l'organisation pour la d√©grader. Mais nous avons eu cette impression lors de la toute premi√®re r√©union de l'ensemble du personnel organis√©e par Scott Pruitt (Le nouveau directeur de l'EPA. Il a poursuivi l'agence en justice √† 14 reprises avant d'en prendre la t√™te, ndlr). C'√©tait clair qu'il nous prenait de haut. L'EPA c'√©tait nous. On √©tait les m√©chants. On √©tait le probl√®me. Mon dieu, je crois que je parle toujours de l'EPA en disant ¬´nous¬ª.

C'est une habitude difficile √† perdre.

Cox: Oui, c'est toujours ¬´nous¬ª. Alors lorsqu'il a commenc√© √† dire qu'on devait travailler avec les √©tats, je me suis dit: ¬´√áa fait trente ans que je travaille ici et chaque jour nous nous effor√ßons de travailler avec les √©tats.¬ª Il a dit qu'on devait respecter la loi, comme si ce n'√©tait pas d√©j√† le cas. J'ai eu la forte impression qu'il ne comprenait pas, ou bien qu'il faisait expr√®s de provoquer le personnel.

Le deuxi√®me fait majeur, c'√©tait les coupes budg√©taires: une feuille de route pour r√©duire de 30% les employ√©s de l'EPA. Et puis l'√©limination de programmes qui concernaient le changement climatique. On a √©t√© nombreux √† se demander: ¬´Comment le directeur de l'EPA peut-il affirmer que le changement climatique ne fait pas partie de notre mission?¬ª On a eu l'impression que le c≈ìur de notre travail √©tait, je n'ose pas utiliser le mot ¬´violeÃÅ¬ª, mais qu'il √©tait discr√©dit√©. Et la derni√®re chose dont je parlerai c'est son choix de faire venir l'ancien chef de cabinet du s√©nateur James Inhofe pour diriger son organisation (Inhofe est l'homme qui a ¬´r√©fut√©¬ª le r√©chauffement climatique en apportant une boule de neige au S√©nat. ¬´Il fait vraiment, vraiment froid dehors. Vraiment inhabituel pour la saison¬ª, avait-il d√©clar√©, ndlr). √áa a vraiment donn√© le ton. On s'est rendu compte que √ßa allait tr√®s mal.

Y a-t-il eu un √©v√©nement d√©clencheur o√π vous vous √™tes dit: ¬´√áa y'est, j'arr√™te laÃÄ, je remets ma lettre de d√©mission.¬ª?

Cox: Je vais √™tre honn√™te avec vous. J'avais pr√©vu de prendre ma retraite en f√©vrier. Je pensais que Clinton allait gagner, que j'allais partir √† la retraite et que tout irait pour le mieux. Et puis Trump a gagn√©, et alors que je me pr√©parais pour partir √† la retraite, les gens autour de moi n'arr√™taient pas de dire: ¬´Mike, tu ne peux pas partir aÃÄ la retraite. Tu ne peux pas te le permettre, parce que ton poste va √™tre √©limin√© et tu es un ardent d√©fenseur. On a besoin de toi.¬ª

Finalement, j'ai d√©cid√© de prendre ma retraite. Et pour √™tre honn√™te, je le regrette. J'aurais pr√©f√©r√© rester parce que m√™me si je ne pense pas que j'aurais eu un impact important, j'ai quand m√™me l'impression que j'aurais pu utiliser ma voix. Et si j'avais √©t√© vir√©, √ßa n'aurait pas √©t√© grave.

Catalu√±a vive una nueva huelga general este mi√©rcoles convocada por sindicatos minoritarios y que no cuenta con el apoyo de CC.OO. de Catalu√±a y UGT de Catalu√±a, que se han desmarcado de esta huelga general y no la secundar√°n, aunque han convocado varias movilizaciones el mismo d√≠a contra "las pol√≠ticas autoritarias" del Gobierno central.

Las dos organizaciones han convocado para este mi√©rcoles concentraciones a las 12 y a las 18 horas en todos los pueblos y ciudades y han manifestado su apoyo a la manifestaci√≥n convocada por ANC, √ímnium y la Taula per la Democr√†cia para el s√°bado en Barcelona.

As√≠ se est√° viviendo este mi√©rcoles en Catalu√±a:

El Metro de Barcelona circula con una frecuencia equivalente al 85% de lo que es habitual en un d√≠a laborable, mientras que los autobuses de la ciudad transitan con normalidad, seg√∫n informa Transports Metropolitans de Barcelona (TMB).

M√°s de 50 carreteras se han cortado, de acuerdo con el Servei Catal√† de Tr√†nsit.

La circulaci√≥n se ha interrumpido al menos en la AP-7 en Santa Perp√®tua de Mogoda (Barcelona) y Vilafant (Girona), en varios puntos de la A-2, la B-20 en varios tramos, la C-16 en Sallent (Barcelona), la C-25 en distintos puntos kilom√©tricos de la Catalunya central, y las carreteras C-31 y C-32 en varios municipios del √°rea de Barcelona.

Tambi√©n la C-37 en Castellfollit del Boix y Manresa (Barcelona), la C-59 en Moi√† (Barcelona), la N-145 en La Seu d'Urgell (Lleida), la N-230 en Vilaller (Lleida), la N-340 en Molins de Rei (Barcelona) y en Amposta (Tarragona), la N-II en Vilassar de Mar (Barcelona) y la N-IIa en Figueres (Girona).

Las mayores retenciones se han producido en la A-2 en Sant Joan Desp√≠ (Barcelona), con 15 kil√≥metros de congesti√≥n, y 11 en la B-23 en Sant Just Desvern (Barcelona).

Vista de la autov√≠a A-2 a la altura de √ídena (Barcelona) que ha sido cortada por un grupo de manifestantes

Un grupo de manifestantes corta la C-31 a la altura de L'Hospitalet

Varios grupos de manifestantes han cortado las v√≠as de trenes de cercan√≠as de Barcelona y, pasadas las 8,30 horas, s√≥lo funcionan en su totalidad las l√≠neas R-2 y R-8.

La R-1 est√° cortada en Blanes (Girona) y Matar√≥ (Barcelona), aunque algunos trenes han salido de manera puntual, la R-4 sigue interrumpida en Montcada Bifurcaci√≥n y Sant Vicens de Castellet (Barcelona), mientras que en Ulldecona (Tarragona) los manifestantes ya han abandonado las v√≠as.

Un grupo de usuarios espera en la entrada de la estaci√≥n de Ferrocarrils de Sant Cugat del Vall√®s cuyas v√≠as han sido ocupadas por un piquete

Un grupo de manifestantes corta la v√≠a f√©rrea en la estaci√≥n de Ferrocarrils de Sant Cugat del Vall√®s

Adem√°s, un grupo de unos 500 personas ha cortado las v√≠as del AVE en Girona sobre las 08.15 horas y ha ocupado las v√≠as, lo que ha obligado a interrumpir la circulaci√≥n de los trenes de alta velocidad entre la ciudad y Figueres-Vilafant.

Video from down on the tracks inside Gerona AVE station. Thousands of protestors sing L'Estaca as they block the trains.

Via @SergiUnanue pic.twitter.com/ExA65Szi01
TITLE: V√≠as de tren, carreteras y v√≠as cortadas por la huelga general de Catalu√±a

SUMMARY:
Non fosse per il fatto che il ministro della Cultura e i deputati a lui vicini stanno conversando fitto fitto con Nico Stumpo.
Ma prima di andarsene a mezza bocca lascia cadere: "La cosa dei ministeri non √® del tutto una battuta".
"Quello che devi capire √® che noi non √® che abbiamo il terrore, abbiamo la certezza che cos√¨ andiamo a sbattere".
A due passi dal cortile di Montecitorio la bizzarra scena di una lunga e animata discussione tra Alfredo D'Attorre e Alessandro Di Battista.
Il dato di fatto √® che senza il premio di maggioranza del Porcellum la quota di deputati Dem che faranno un altro giro di giostra fisiologicamente sar√† minore.
TEXT:
A met√† mattina in Transatlantico si materializza una scena che racconta molto di quel che sta succedendo nel Palazzo. Accanto a un divanetto, a qualche metro dall'ingresso dell'Aula, c'√® Dario Franceschini, attorniato da un pugno dei suoi. Dall'altra parte del largo corridoio depositario di intrecci e chiacchiericci di Montecitorio, Pier Luigi Bersani, mani in tasca, parla con Roberto Speranza. I due sorridono, l'atteggiamento √® rilassato. Tutto nella norma. Non fosse per il fatto che il ministro della Cultura e i deputati a lui vicini stanno conversando fitto fitto con Nico Stumpo. Che oltre a essere uno dei deputati di Mdp pi√π vicini a Bersani, √® anche il cervellone che supervisiona le liste, gli incastri, soppesa i voti potenziali, analizza, indirizza candidature e truppe.

Qualche minuto dopo arriva sornione un alto dirigente di Articolo 1, sorride: "Il Pd ci ha gi√† offerto tre ministeri e quattro cammelli, scrivilo". Si sorride, si scambiano due parole. Ma prima di andarsene a mezza bocca lascia cadere: "La cosa dei ministeri non √® del tutto una battuta". Scene da presepe preelettorale. Riannodiamo il filo. Il Pd va male in Sicilia. Mdp malino, ma con il risultato scarno dei Dem se a livello nazionale si proiettasse una situazione simile, il loro pacchetto di voti risulterebbe determinante in molti collegi uninominali. Tradotto: poltrone in pi√π, poltrone salvate e non perse. In tutta risposta dal giorno dopo Matteo Renzi ricomincia con la sua strategia d'attacco. Partire dalla palese sfida a un largo pezzo del suo partito sui vitalizi. E qui parte il panico.

"Quello che devi capire √® che noi non √® che abbiamo il terrore, abbiamo la certezza che cos√¨ andiamo a sbattere". Un deputato di una delle regioni rosse spiega che tra i suoi colleghi √® iniziata a serpeggiare come mai prima la paura di non essere eletti: "Pi√π Renzi torna protagonista, pi√π il consenso scende". Si rincorrono i capannelli nei corridoi. Gli uomini di Franceschini rimangono molto prudenti, quelli di Orlando ponderano mosse pi√π decise, stasera faranno un punto della situazione. "La verit√† √® che Dario la sua carriera politica l'ha fatta ‚Äì spiega uno degli uomini vicini al ministro della Giustizia ‚Äì Andrea no. Andrea se non d√† un segnale, se si fa fagocitare, politicamente √® finito".

La questione √® assai spinosa. Perch√© un conto √® chiedere un cambio di passo, alzare il tiro per cercare di farlo abbassare a Renzi. Un altro √® superare quella sottile linea rossa che porterebbe Renzi allo strappo finale. Quello che prevede che "il segretario sono io e i posti li stabilisco io".

"Se arriviamo a quel punto ‚Äì spiega un onorevole orlandiano ‚Äì si rompono tutte le cose". E, attenzione, "diventerebbe fisiologico andarsene". Lo spettro di un'altra scissione all'orizzonte. La battaglia per la linea del partito. E, su tutto, il terrore per una poltrona sempre pi√π labile sotto le terga. Un clima da fine impero, dove tutti sono contro tutti e tutti cercano tutti. Ad Agor√†, su RaiTre, la renziana Simona Malpezzi gettava ramoscelli d'ulivo a Nicola Fratoianni: "In fondo abbiamo gli stessi valori". A due passi dal cortile di Montecitorio la bizzarra scena di una lunga e animata discussione tra Alfredo D'Attorre e Alessandro Di Battista. Quest'ultimo minimizza: "Si parlava della situazione generale". Appunto, vi cercano: "Tutti ci cercano". Lapidario. Non √® un mistero che i bersaniani siano guardati con interesse dagli uomini di Grillo. Nel caso non si chiudesse un accordo a sinistra, dai loro voti in Parlamento potrebbe passare la concreta realizzazione di un governo a 5 stelle.

"Perch√© Renzi sta forzando la mano per non dare spazio di manovra a nessuno ‚Äì spiega un deputato della minoranza interna del Pd ‚Äì ma cos√¨ la situazione diventa pericolosa". Il dato di fatto √® che senza il premio di maggioranza del Porcellum la quota di deputati Dem che faranno un altro giro di giostra fisiologicamente sar√† minore. Figuriamoci se le percentuali raggiunte dal Pd saranno deludenti. Cos√¨ il corpaccione del partito lancia battute trasversali agli scissionisti, li blandisce, quasi che una trattativa potesse essere fatta dai peones attorno a una ciotola di mandorle tostate alla buvette. Ma la situazione √® disperata, e le reazioni estemporanee sono all'ordine del giorno. Perch√©, spiega un uomo vicino a Orlando "se non li inglobi in una coalizione nel maggioritario al nord e al sud non hai speranze, ti rimane giusto qualcosa al centro". E' proprio un deputato renziano che mette gi√† le carte: "Noi tra Camera e Senato siamo 400. E' fisiologico che la domanda di questi giorni sia come ritornare qui dentro".

Molti onorevoli del Lazio e della Lombardia stanno valutando di spostarsi alla Pisana o al Pirellone. In primavera si rinnoveranno i consigli regionali, e per chi ha le preferenze potrebbe essere un accettabile piano B, perch√©, spiega un deputato laziale, "qui siamo prigionieri di Renzi, che ha potere su tutte le liste e non si capisce cosa voglia fare, niente √® pi√π sicuro".

Nel clima da fine legislatura, tutto d'un tratto, in parlamento si materializza l'ex ministro aennino Mario Landolfi. Poco pi√π in l√† solca il Transatlantico con passo sicuro il gi√† ministro dell'Udc Mario Baccini, signore delle preferenze a Roma e dintorni. Poi ecco Davide Barbato, l'eccentrico deputato anti-casta dell'Italia dei Valori, prima che tutto cambiasse, prima che il brand lo rilevasse la pattuglia 5 stelle.

Passano quasi inosservati tra i drappelli di deputati che si interrogano sul 2% nel collegio tal dei tali, che insistono che "cos√¨ ci suicidiamo, Matteo se non apre alla coalizione si va a frantumare, e noi con lui", che chiosano laconici: "Siamo incastrati, √® un bordello". Schegge di un mondo che fu, invisibili in una folla che guarda con spavento una sola cosa: il domani.
TITLE: La paura dei peones Pd di perdere il seggio: "Siamo incastrati nel protagonismo di Renzi‚Äù

SUMMARY:
HANOI, Vietnam ‚Äî Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says he's satisfied with the public explanation provided by a top Liberal fundraiser whose name surfaced in leaked documents that provide details on legal, offshore tax havens used by the wealthy.
Speaking to reporters Wednesday in Hanoi, Vietnam, Trudeau said he's accepted assurances by Stephen Bronfman that he has followed all the rules.
The prime minister did not directly answer the question about Bronfman's role in the party, nor would he say his friend's name in his response.
Still, the questions around Bronfman gave political foes fresh ammunition to accuse Trudeau of leading an ethically-challenged government.
The name of former Liberal prime minister Jean Chretien also appeared in the 13.4 million leaked documents, in a register of investors in Madagascar Oil.
TEXT:
HANOI, Vietnam ‚Äî Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says he's satisfied with the public explanation provided by a top Liberal fundraiser whose name surfaced in leaked documents that provide details on legal, offshore tax havens used by the wealthy.

Speaking to reporters Wednesday in Hanoi, Vietnam, Trudeau said he's accepted assurances by Stephen Bronfman that he has followed all the rules.

In a statement this week after the release of the so-called "Paradise Papers," Bronfman said he never funded nor used offshore trusts, and that all his Canadian trusts have paid all federal taxes on their income.

Trudeau's made his comments in response to a question asking why Bronfman, also a close friend of the prime minister, appeared to still be in his position as a key Liberal fundraiser.

The prime minister did not directly answer the question about Bronfman's role in the party, nor would he say his friend's name in his response.

'We are satisfied'

"In regards to the specific case you mentioned, we have received assurances that all rules were followed, indeed the same assurances made in the public statement released by the family, and we are satisfied with those assurances," Trudeau said during a news conference inside Vietnam's presidential palace.

"We have done much in regards to tax avoidance and tax evasion, including working with international partners.

"But we also recognize there is much more to do and you can rest assured that Canada Revenue Agency will take very seriously its responsibility to go after everyone and anyone involved in tax avoidance and tax evasion."

Tax avoidance measures involving offshore trusts are legal, provided that the trust is genuinely managed offshore and that Canadian taxes are paid on any Canadian contributions. And there may be other legitimate reasons for setting up an offshore account, including if you're a contractor doing work in a particular country.

The Liberal Party of Canada's chief fundraiser, Stephen Bronfman, attends the party's caucus retreat in Georgetown, P.E.I. on Aug. 28, 2013.

Still, the questions around Bronfman gave political foes fresh ammunition to accuse Trudeau of leading an ethically-challenged government.

In his statement, Bronfman said he made a single loan to the trust on an arm's-length, fully commercial basis some 25 years ago that was repaid five months later, a transaction that was fully in compliance with Canadian law.

The name of former Liberal prime minister Jean Chretien also appeared in the 13.4 million leaked documents, in a register of investors in Madagascar Oil. It lists Chretien as having received 100,000 stock options.

In a brief statement of his own, Chretien said Madagascar Oil was a client of Heenan Blaikie, a now-defunct Canadian law firm. As a lawyer with the firm, Chretien said he did some work for Madagascar Oil, but all fees were billed by and paid to the law firm itself.

"I never received any share options and I never had a bank account outside Canada," Chretien said.

"Any news report that suggests I have or ever had or was associated in any way with any offshore account is false."
TITLE: Trudeau Says He Accepts Stephen Bronfman's Explanation After 'Paradise Papers' Release

Ritengo da tempo che il tema della Green Economy debba essere al centro dell'azione di governo e dopo aver partecipato agli Stati Generali di Rimini ne sono ancor pi√π convinta.
Negli ultimi cinque anni molte cose sono state fatte, ma l'agenda verde deve ora diventare l'architrave della visione strategica e del profilo identitario del Partito democratico, da realizzarsi attraverso azioni concrete al centro del prossimo programma elettorale.
Fondamentale poi l'idea di puntare sull'economia circolare, superando in tal modo modelli di sviluppo basati sullo sperpero delle risorse e impegnandosi nella prevenzione sulla produzione dei rifiuti.
Per perseguire questi obiettivi √® necessario rafforzare la responsabilit√† estesa dei produttori.
Il dibattito seguito alle recenti elezioni siciliane ha reso evidente quanto la creazione di un campo ampio di centrosinistra sia la strada da percorrere subito per il Partito democratico.
TEXT:
Ritengo da tempo che il tema della Green Economy debba essere al centro dell'azione di governo e dopo aver partecipato agli Stati Generali di Rimini ne sono ancor pi√π convinta. Negli ultimi cinque anni molte cose sono state fatte, ma l'agenda verde deve ora diventare l'architrave della visione strategica e del profilo identitario del Partito democratico, da realizzarsi attraverso azioni concrete al centro del prossimo programma elettorale.

Per questo mi sento di sottoscrivere le 10 proposte avanzate dalla Fondazione sviluppo sostenibile, nella consapevolezza che la loro realizzazione impone scelte politiche e di allocazione di risorse finanziarie conseguenti.

Tra i punti programmatici indicati mi soffermerei in particolare sulla necessit√† di fare della sfida climatica l'occasione per rinnovare il sistema energetico, rilanciando rinnovabili ed efficienza anche attraverso l'istituzione di un fondo nazionale per la transizione energetica, eventualmente alimentato anche da una carbon tax progressiva e da una graduale riallocazione dei sussidi dannosi per l'ambiente.

Fondamentale poi l'idea di puntare sull'economia circolare, superando in tal modo modelli di sviluppo basati sullo sperpero delle risorse e impegnandosi nella prevenzione sulla produzione dei rifiuti. Per perseguire questi obiettivi √® necessario rafforzare la responsabilit√† estesa dei produttori. Ancora: bene l'attivazione di un piano nazionale per la rigenerazione urbana, supportato da strumenti economici e fiscali innovativi; i cambiamenti nella mobilit√† urbana, riducendo il numero di auto private attraverso una accessibilit√† diffusa ai mezzi condivisi e pubblici e anche ricorrendo a misure drastiche quali il divieto di immatricolazione di auto diesel e benzina al 2030.

E infine irrinunciabili l'approvazione della legge sullo stop al consumo di suolo e una riforma della fiscalit√† in chiave green, per accompagnare il mercato verso processi, prodotti e servizi a basse emissioni e ad alta efficienza nell'uso delle risorse, riallocando le agevolazioni dannose per l'ambiente.

Il dibattito seguito alle recenti elezioni siciliane ha reso evidente quanto la creazione di un campo ampio di centrosinistra sia la strada da percorrere subito per il Partito democratico. Sono convinta che sui temi della Green Economy e di un nuovo modello di sviluppo si possa trovare il terreno fertile di confronto con le altre forze di centrosinistra allargando la nostra capacit√† di dialogare al civismo e alle giovani generazioni.Il tempo dei tatticismi √® finito e la strada verde √® quella maestra.
TITLE: La green economy sia architrave del programma Pd

Die t√ºrkische Zeitung "G√ºnes" glaubt, in Deutschland herrsche Panik wegen eines t√ºrkischen AutomobilprojektsTats√§chlich will Pr√§sident Erdogan bis 2021 ein t√ºrkisches Auto auf den Markt bringen"Die Deutschen sind in Panik", glaubt die t√ºrkische Tageszeitung "G√ºnes".
Der Grund: Die Regierung von Pr√§sident Recep Tayyip Erdogan plant, ein in der T√ºrkei produziertes Auto Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen.
Die deutschen Medien h√§tten eine "Schmutzkampagne" gestartet, aus Angst vor dem neuen Konkurrenten auf dem Automobilmarkt, so der Vorwurf der Zeitung.

TEXT:
Die t√ºrkische Zeitung "G√ºnes" glaubt, in Deutschland herrsche Panik wegen eines t√ºrkischen Automobilprojekts

Tats√§chlich will Pr√§sident Erdogan bis 2021 ein t√ºrkisches Auto auf den Markt bringen

"Die Deutschen sind in Panik", glaubt die t√ºrkische Tageszeitung "G√ºnes". Der Grund: Die Regierung von Pr√§sident Recep Tayyip Erdogan plant, ein in der T√ºrkei produziertes Auto Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen. Sp√§testens 2021 sollen f√ºnf heimische Unternehmen im Verbund das Elektroauto auf den Markt bringen.

Die Erdogan-nahe Zeitung "G√ºnes" zeigte in ihrer Sonntagsausgabe Angela Merkel auf der Titelseite. "Schau, wie wir das machen", lautete die gro√üe √úberschrift in schwarzen und roten Lettern. Die deutschen Medien h√§tten eine "Schmutzkampagne" gestartet, aus Angst vor dem neuen Konkurrenten auf dem Automobilmarkt, so der Vorwurf der Zeitung.

Tats√§chlich hatten mehrere deutsche Medien in der vergangenen Woche √ºber Erdogans Auto-Projekt berichtet.

Ferdinand Dudenh√∂ffer, Leiter des Center Automotive Research (CAR) der Universit√§t Duisburg-Essen, sagte der "Welt", das t√ºrkische Projekt sei "Harakiri". Es sei schade um das Geld, mindestens eine halbe Milliarde Euro werde "einfach verbrannt".

Schlechte Chancen f√ºr das Erdo-Car

Das gr√∂√üte Problem an dem Projekt: Im vergangenen Jahr seien in der T√ºrkei lediglich 760.000 Autos verkauft worden. Zum Vergleich: In Deutschland gab es im gleichen Jahr 3,4 Millionen Neuzulassungen. Der heimische Markt alleine bietet somit nur bescheidene Absatzm√∂glichkeiten.

Bislang gibt es wenige Details √ºber das t√ºrkische Auto, dessen Prototyp im Jahr 2019 fertiggestellt werden soll. Offenbar k√∂nnte es auf dem Aufbau des Saab 9-3 basieren, den die t√ºrkische Regierung im Jahr 2015 von der schwedischen Holdinggesellschaft National Electric Vehicle Sweden erworben hat.

Ob das der deutschen Industrie tats√§chlich Sorgen bereitet, bleibt fraglich. Denn keines der f√ºnf t√ºrkischen Unternehmen des Konsortiums verf√ºgt √ºber Erfahrungen beim Autobau.

(mf)
TITLE: "Sie sind in Panik": Erdogan-nahe Zeitung attackiert Deutschland ‚Äì es geht um ein Auto

TEXT:
Este a√±o, Ruby Rose es imagen de Nike. Y no es casualidad: la actividad f√≠sica es parte esencial en la vida de la actriz de Orange Is The New Black.

Tech Pack fue la primera colecci√≥n de Nike que protagoniz√≥ Rose. Ahora regresa con Nocturne, una colecci√≥n de calzado para mujeres.

En las plantas de los tenis est√°n grabados los mantras de la actriz: Become your own hero" (Convi√©rtete en tu propio h√©roe) y "With full force" (Con toda la fuerza).

La colecci√≥n presenta distintas variaciones de piel Port Wine, puntuada por acentos de goma color verde azulado y una entresuela neutra y ligera.

Disponibilidad en M√©xico: La colecci√≥n est√° disponible desde el 27 de octubre en Nike.com y en las tiendas Taf, Lust Masaryk, Lust Roma, Soul, Alive, 99 problems y Barrio Warrior.

Entrevista con Ruby Rose

Entrevistador: ¬øC√≥mo comparas el expresarte creativamente en movimiento y entrenar con la creatividad actoral?

Ruby Rose: Creo que lo f√≠sico ha estado presente en la mayor parte de mi trabajo, incluso Pitch Perfect, todo lo que he hecho ha requerido alg√∫n tipo de entrenamiento f√≠sico. Ha sido un proceso interno y te haces tan vulnerable y te rompes tanto como cuando se trata de actuar. Siempre ha sido parte del objetivo al que me dirijo; ser la m√°s fuerte, o la mejor francotiradora, o la asesina m√°s r√°pida, la peleadora m√°s veloz, una buena cantante, etc√©tera.

Y eso es lo m√°gico de actuar. La sensaci√≥n es divertida y gratificante porque consigues algo que han finalizado. Y despu√©s las cosas que son desafiantes, nuevas y emocionantes implican una lucha por la cual hay que trabajar m√°s duro. Pero terminas con un sentimiento de realizaci√≥n.

E: ¬øQu√© te hace sentir el punto m√°s alto de un buen entrenamiento?

RR: Siento que un buen entrenamiento es como la meditaci√≥n. Te lleva a una zona en tu cabeza. Mis amigos suelen correr, y es el deporte que menos practico. Me encanta correr en intervalos y me encanta presionarme tanto como pueda cuando corro, y despu√©s hago pesas. Correr o caminar durante 3 horas no es necesariamente mi actividad favorita, al menos que sea en exteriores.

Pero lo que me encanta es que empiezas a pensar en tu cabeza, 'Oh, esto duele' o 'no soy capaz', o 'no soy tan capaz como pens√©', o '¬øCu√°nto m√°s? ¬øA√∫n me falta otra hora? Hoy tuve que trabajar hasta tarde. ¬øCom√≠? ¬øDej√© la cafetera prendida?', y ese tipo de cosas. Despu√©s terminas en un estado feliz y meditativo en el que ya no est√°s pensando en nada. Est√°s pensando en tus m√∫sculos y en lo que estuviste haciendo en ese entrenamiento y en tu coordinaci√≥n. Est√°s s√∫per concentrado que es casi como la meditaci√≥n.

E: ¬øC√≥mo te mantienes motivada f√≠sicamente para ti misma y despu√©s para actuar? ¬øQu√© te motiva a seguir super√°ndote?

RR: Creo que es m√°s f√°cil mantenerte motivado cuando se trata del cine. Tengo un objetivo directo -de la misma manera que cuando boxeaba-. Sab√≠a que se acercaba una competencia, ten√≠a mucho m√°s impulso, mucha m√°s determinaci√≥n, m√°s energ√≠a. Me levantaba m√°s temprano. Simplemente viv√≠a y respiraba para eso.

E: ¬øTienes alg√∫n entrenamiento no tradicional que la gente no se imagine? Algo que hagas y consideres no tradicional.

RR: Estoy realmente involucrada con las artes marciales, el box y el Jiu Jitsu. Recientemente aprend√≠ combate con cuchillo. Ese tipo de entrenamiento no es tan tradicional como las clases de aer√≥bic o de spinning.

Todos tienen algo que saca lo mejor de ellos. Ese tipo de entrenamiento siempre ha sido el m√°s divertido para m√≠ y saca lo mejor de m√≠. Me encanta nadar porque soy piscis, nac√≠ en el agua y soy australiana, as√≠ que puedo ir a la playa y surfear o ir a patinar, y son distintos entrenamientos, pero me encantan todos por igual.

Practiqu√© un poco de Pole Dance una vez porque un amigo m√≠o me ret√≥ a hacerlo. Yo dije 'est√° bien, lo har√©. No debe ser tan dif√≠cil'. Fue probablemente la cosa m√°s complicada que he intentado en mi vida.

E: ¬øQu√© papel juegan los entrenadores en tu rutina y qu√© buscas particularmente en un entrenador?

RR: Creo que lo que busco en un entrenador no es tanto la motivaci√≥n para durar cierto tiempo o hacer cierta cantidad de repeticiones. Realmente busco la parte educacional de las cosas. Tengo una mala espalda baja que se puede inflamar cuando boxeo y tambi√©n mis peque√±as mu√±ecas se inflaman con el box. Tengo a alguien que me ayuda a fortalecer mi espalda baja de la manera correcta. Usamos muchas cuerdas, bandas y el mismo peso corporal para hacer ejercicios.

E: ¬øCu√°les son tus cinco siluetas favoritas de Nike?

RR: ¬øSabes cu√°les son los primeros Nike que me compr√©? Los Nike Shox. No crec√≠ con dinero como para comprarme un calzado cool para entrenar, pero despu√©s tuve un trabajo, fui a la tienda y compr√© los Nike Shox. Estaba obsesionada con ellos.

Y siempre me han gustado los Air Max y estaba obsesionada con la c√°psula de aire. Soy fan del Air Force 1 y el nuevo SF Air Force 1. Antes ten√≠a los antiguos Air Force 1 en un par de colores, pero creo que los compr√© en tiendas econ√≥micas. S√© que los compr√© ah√≠ porque recuerdo haber pagado alrededor de 25 d√≥lares. S√≠, una ganga total.
TITLE: Ruby Rose para Nike: "un buen entrenamiento es como la meditaci√≥n"

SUMMARY:
How do you get through the first few months and set the best foundations for your relationship in the future?
For most people in a relationship , finding out that your partner has cheated seems like the worst thing that could possibly happen.
But often the hardest part isn‚Äôt the revelation itself, it is working out what to do next.
Talking while you‚Äôre furious accomplishes little more than saying hurtful things you may regret later.
But in order to get some perspective on your relationship together, it is important to give yourself some space to think things through.
TEXT:
So what happens if you decide to stay together? How do you get through the first few months and set the best foundations for your relationship in the future?

While lots of us like to think we would leave without a second thought, the reality of life and being invested in your partner - marriage, children, a shared home and future plans - means it isn‚Äôt always so black and white.

For most people in a relationship , finding out that your partner has cheated seems like the worst thing that could possibly happen. But often the hardest part isn‚Äôt the revelation itself, it is working out what to do next.

1. Don‚Äôt try to talk until you‚Äôve calmed down.

In the immediate aftermath of your discovery, you are of course going to be angry. And while you shouldn‚Äôt hold back in sharing this anger with your partner, you should also be cautious about saying things in the heat of the moment that you cannot unsay, or you may live to regret when you‚Äôre not seeing red.

Sex and relationship expert Tracey Cox, tells HuffPost UK: ‚ÄúDelay the discussion until you‚Äôve both calmed down. Talking while you‚Äôre furious accomplishes little more than saying hurtful things you may regret later. And work out exactly what you want to say beforehand.‚Äù

2. Give yourself some space.

When your trust in your partner is shattered, and everything you thought you had seems to have dissolved around you, it can be tempting to overcompensate by spending all your time together and not letting them out of your sight.

But in order to get some perspective on your relationship together, it is important to give yourself some space to think things through.

Sarah Ryan, a relationships expert and director of her own matchmaking agency, says: ‚ÄúIf you really want to find a way to make your relationship work you‚Äôll have to give yourself some space to work out what you truly want, what it is that you‚Äôre feeling and healing all the hurts that come with cheating - ensure to really practise the art of letting go to save yourself holding onto animosity.‚Äù

And Vasia Toxavidi, a psychotherapist and counsellor with the British Association for Counselling and Psychotherapy, agrees: ‚ÄúSome controlling may take place by the partner who has been cheated on due to loss of trust, but it is important for that person to focus and take care of themselves.‚Äù

3. Ask yourself if you are capable of total forgiveness.

During this time when you are giving yourself space, the most important question you should be asking yourself is whether you are capable of totally forgiving your partner - this is the only way this is going to work (holding a grudge doesn‚Äôt help anyone).

Cox says: ‚ÄúSome relationship crimes hurt us more than others because of our backgrounds and family history. Cheating is harder to forgive for someone who has a history of partners who‚Äôve been unfaithful or whose parents had a painful split. Forgiveness is the first step, learning to trust again is the next.

‚ÄúHow will you know if they‚Äôve done it again? Did you see the signs the last time? Has something significant changed to ensure they won‚Äôt do it again?‚Äù

And Ryan agrees: ‚ÄúWithout fully forgiving your partner after they have been unfaithful then you run the risk of harbouring negative energy and feelings which will come out in the wash when resistance or minor conflicts naturally occur within a relationship.‚Äù

4. Start by working on a basic friendship.

Expecting your relationship to go back to how it was before is probably naive, so instead of jumping back into your old roles straight away, try having a basic friendship that focuses on trust and respect.

Ryan says: ‚ÄúYou need to rediscover an understanding of each other as friends first and foremost before you can move forward romantically, at the end of the day thats how every relationship develops because you date and become romantically involved with your best friend.

‚ÄúReally understanding when and how you may have stopped being friends can help you interpret when respect may have left your relationship.‚Äù
TITLE: 7 Tips If You‚Äôre Trying To Stay With Your Partner After They Cheated

Il suggerimento arriva dal capo esecutivo di Deutsche Bank, John Cryan, che in un colloquio con il Financial Times prefigura la possibilit√† che il colosso bancario tedesco possa tagliare decine di migliaia di posti di lavoro per portare i costi in linea con i ricavi, che sono in calo.
Nuovi tagli perch√© il piano di ristrutturazione quinquennale, messo in piedi nel 2015, ha gi√† portato a 4mila licenziamenti sui 9mila previsti.
"Abbiamo 97mila impiegati, la maggior parte dei nostri competitor alla pari hanno circa la met√† della nostra forza lavoro", ha dichiarato Cryan.
Perch√© se √® vero che gli utili sono pi√π che raddoppiati nel terzo trimestre di quest'anno, toccando quota 649 milioni di euro, √® altrettanto vero che i ricavi sono calati del 10%, soprattutto a causa del crollo delle attivit√† di investment banking.
E ora il management della banca potrebbe decidere di rendere il piano con i tagli ancora pi√π consistente.
TEXT:
Un suggerimento che prefigura uno scenario dall'impatto imponente. Il suggerimento arriva dal capo esecutivo di Deutsche Bank, John Cryan, che in un colloquio con il Financial Times prefigura la possibilit√† che il colosso bancario tedesco possa tagliare decine di migliaia di posti di lavoro per portare i costi in linea con i ricavi, che sono in calo. Nuovi tagli perch√© il piano di ristrutturazione quinquennale, messo in piedi nel 2015, ha gi√† portato a 4mila licenziamenti sui 9mila previsti.

"Abbiamo 97mila impiegati, la maggior parte dei nostri competitor alla pari hanno circa la met√† della nostra forza lavoro", ha dichiarato Cryan. Secondo il chief executive di Deutsche Bank, i tagli addizionali deriveranno dalla necessit√† di usare pi√π tecnologia, al posto della forza-lavoro tradizionale, per rendere pi√π efficienti i processi bancari. "Siamo troppo manuali, che possono portarci a fare errori e renderci inefficienti", ha sottolineato.

La riflessione di Cryan arriva in un periodo non facile per la banca. Perch√© se √® vero che gli utili sono pi√π che raddoppiati nel terzo trimestre di quest'anno, toccando quota 649 milioni di euro, √® altrettanto vero che i ricavi sono calati del 10%, soprattutto a causa del crollo delle attivit√† di investment banking. Il raddoppio degli utili √® stato determinato fondamentalmente dal taglio dei costi. E ora il management della banca potrebbe decidere di rendere il piano con i tagli ancora pi√π consistente.
TITLE: √à l'et√† dei robot, Deutsche Bank potrebbe licenziare presto decine di migliaia di dipendenti

SUMMARY:
Stefan Rousseau - PA Images via Getty ImagesA single mother will be ¬£2,236 worse off under the government‚Äôs Universal Credit benefit than they would have been if Labour‚Äôs tax credit system had been left in place, research published on Monday has revealed.
According to the Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG), the government‚Äôs flagship benefits reform is a ‚Äúcolossal failure‚Äù that will leave a generation of children ‚Äúscarred‚Äù by austerity.
According to the data, the freezes and cuts to Universal Credit work allowances will leave lone parents worse off by, on average, ¬£710 a year, couples ¬£250 a year.
Theresa May is under pressure from backbench Tory MPs as well as the Labour Party to pause the roll-out of the system - or make significant changes to how Universal Credit operates.
The new benefit system, the brainchild of Iain Duncan Smith, combines six of the main welfare benefits into a single payment.
TEXT:
Stefan Rousseau - PA Images via Getty Images

A single mother will be ¬£2,236 worse off under the government‚Äôs Universal Credit benefit than they would have been if Labour‚Äôs tax credit system had been left in place, research published on Monday has revealed. According to the Child Poverty Action Group (CPAG), the government‚Äôs flagship benefits reform is a ‚Äúcolossal failure‚Äù that will leave a generation of children ‚Äúscarred‚Äù by austerity. The analysis, conducted with the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR), also calculated that one million more children are likely to be in poverty in 2020 as a result of cuts to the new benefit programme. According to the data, the freezes and cuts to Universal Credit work allowances will leave lone parents worse off by, on average, ¬£710 a year, couples ¬£250 a year. And a single parent already working full time on the national living wage would have to work an extra 41 days a year to make up for the losses suffered as a result of the cuts.

Theresa May is under pressure from backbench Tory MPs as well as the Labour Party to pause the roll-out of the system - or make significant changes to how Universal Credit operates. The new benefit system, the brainchild of Iain Duncan Smith, combines six of the main welfare benefits into a single payment. It is designed to both simplify the system and encourage people back into work. David Cameron promised in 2009 in his party conference speech that Duncan Smith was the ‚Äúone person this party can rely on‚Äù to tackle child poverty. But Alison Garnham, the chief executive, of CPAG, said today that pledge ‚Äúhas been broken‚Äù.
TITLE: Universal Credit Leaving Children 'Scarred' By Poverty, Warns Think-Tank

SUMMARY:
Je d√©teste les histoires d'horreur √† propos des mill√©niaux en milieu de travail.
En testant votre patience, les mill√©niaux vous encourageront √† devenir un meilleur gestionnaire.
En testant votre patience, les mill√©niaux vous encourageront √† devenir un meilleur gestionnaire.
Leur attitude consiste √† traiter leurs employ√©s comme des outils, en leur confiant des t√¢ches qui doivent √™tre accomplies telles que prescrites.
La plus grande diff√©rence entre les employ√©s de la G√©n√©ration X et les mill√©niaux a trait √† leurs attentes envers le march√© du travail.
TEXT:
Je d√©teste les histoires d'horreur √† propos des mill√©niaux en milieu de travail. On affirme souvent que ces jeunes narcissiques ont des attentes irr√©alistes, qu'ils consid√®rent que tout leur est d√ª. Peut-√™tre avez-vous entendu dire que leur personnalit√© est difficile √† g√©rer, ou qu'ils ne fournissent pas un effort aussi soutenu que leurs pr√©d√©cesseurs.

En ce moment, la plupart des emplois au bas de l'√©chelle sont occup√©s par des mill√©niaux, et malgr√© ce que vous pouvez avoir lu √† leur sujet, ils peuvent √™tre d'excellents employ√©s. Personnellement, j'ai d√ª recruter, former et cong√©dier des √©quipes compl√®tes au sein de grandes entreprises nationales, et je constate que le meilleur et le pire se retrouvent partout. Autrement dit, certains mill√©niaux sont incomp√©tents, mais la plupart d'entre eux font du bon boulot.

En testant votre patience, les mill√©niaux vous encourageront √† devenir un meilleur gestionnaire.

√âtant n√© entre la G√©n√©ration X et celle du Mill√©naire, je ne corresponds √† aucun de ces groupes. Mais peu importe les noms trouv√©s pour d√©signer ma tranche d'√¢ge, je me consid√®re bien plac√© pour comprendre les deux g√©n√©rations qui m'entourent. Mes coll√®gues de la G√©n√©ration X sont souvent frustr√©s par le comportement de leurs jeunes employ√©s, alors voici mon conseil : au lieu de consid√©rer les mill√©niaux comme des gens narcissiques et suffisants, vous devez les consid√©rer comme des gens motiv√©s qui exigent ce qu'il y a de mieux. Vous devez ensuite tirer profit de ce trait de caract√®re. En testant votre patience, les mill√©niaux vous encourageront √† devenir un meilleur gestionnaire. Il faut envisager cette situation comme un d√©fi et savoir le relever.

Ne soyez pas un mauvais gestionnaire

Les mauvais patrons sont l√©gion. Je ne veux pas dire par l√† qu'ils sont de mauvaises personnes, mais qu'ils ont eux-m√™mes eu de mauvais sup√©rieurs dont ils reproduisent les comportements d√©sagr√©ables. Leur attitude consiste √† traiter leurs employ√©s comme des outils, en leur confiant des t√¢ches qui doivent √™tre accomplies telles que prescrites. Un ordre est un ordre, alors ces jeunes ne devraient-ils pas faire exactement ce qu'on leur dit de faire?

Cette m√©thode bas√©e sur la force brute vous permettra d'atteindre un certain nombre d'objectifs. En revanche, votre √©quipe n'atteindra jamais son plein potentiel. Son moral sera tr√®s bas et le roulement du personnel demeurera √©lev√©.

Vos employ√©s ne sont pas des robots. Vous en tirerez le meilleur s'ils ont une mission leur permettant d'acqu√©rir un sentiment de r√©ussite. Si la vie ne consistait qu'√† donner des ordres, pourquoi les forces arm√©es chercheraient-elles √† remonter le moral des troupes? Pourquoi insisteraient-elles sur le sens du devoir? M√™me dans cette carri√®re o√π d√©sob√©ir aux ordres vous m√®ne en prison, les hauts grad√©s tentent de motiver leurs subalternes, car c'est la meilleure mani√®re d'atteindre de bons r√©sultats.

Faites de votre √©quipe une partie int√©grante de la mission √† accomplir. Vos employ√©s ne tarderont pas √† redoubler d'efforts. Essayez de comprendre ce qui les motive et accompagnez-les dans l'atteinte de leurs objectifs personnels. C'est ainsi que vous pourrez tirer profit de leur ambition et de leur cr√©ativit√© d√©bordante. Et surtout, ne n√©gligez pas l'importance d'une simple d√©gustation de pizza lorsqu'un jalon important est franchi.

La plus grande diff√©rence entre les employ√©s de la G√©n√©ration X et les mill√©niaux a trait √† leurs attentes envers le march√© du travail. L'employ√© de la G√©n√©ration X se satisfait d'un ch√®que de paie r√©gulier dans un monde o√π r√®gne une concurrence f√©roce. Or, les Mill√©niaux rejettent cette notion de stabilit√©. Ils n'ont pas peur d'√™tre sans emploi (ce qui est le cas pour un nombre record d'entre eux). √Ä tort ou √† raison, ils esp√®rent d√©crocher un emploi motivant et assorti de toutes sortes d'avantages sociaux. Voil√† pourquoi les employeurs de la G√©n√©ration X les consid√®rent comme des enfants g√¢t√©s.

Avoir de l'ambition est tout √† fait l√©gitime, alors il faut trouver un moyen de canaliser leur √©nergie.

Or, le comportement des mill√©niaux s'explique en partie par leur frustration de ne pas atteindre leur plein potentiel. Avoir de l'ambition est tout √† fait l√©gitime, alors il faut trouver un moyen de canaliser leur √©nergie. Par cons√©quent, √©tablissez des objectifs nobles, placez la barre haute, et sachez r√©compenser vos jeunes recrues au moment opportun.

Il n'y a rien de mal √† cong√©dier les mill√©niaux

Au fait, y a-t-il des mauvaises √©quipes? Absolument. Vous devez parler √† la personne qui a embauch√© ces incomp√©tents. Et si vous √™tes vous-m√™me responsable du fiasco, apprenez √† recruter, √† g√©rer et √† cong√©dier le personnel ad√©quatement, sans quoi vous m√©riterez encore une fois la palme du pire gestionnaire. Cela dit, l'ambiance au sein d'une √©quipe peut √™tre g√¢ch√©e par une ou deux personnes sp√©cifiques. S'il s'agit de mill√©niaux, vous avez toute l'autorit√© requise pour vous en d√©partir.

Or, pourquoi tant de gestionnaires craignent-ils de cong√©dier des mill√©niaux? Si je me fie aux t√©moignages que j'ai recueillis, le probl√®me est toujours le m√™me : l'employ√© a un talent incroyable, mais il se plaint souvent; il sape l'autorit√© de son sup√©rieur et mine le moral de toute l'√©quipe. Que faire dans un pareil cas?

Le gestionnaire se retrouve dans une position difficile. Si l'employ√© talentueux fait l'objet de r√©primandes ou de sanctions disciplinaires, il risque de d√©missionner. Mais qui le remplacera? Dans un tel cas, je pose la question qu'on m'a pos√©e la premi√®re fois o√π j'ai √©t√© confront√© √† ce dilemme : qu'arrivera-t-il si cet employ√© reste en poste? En ce qui me concerne, je pr√©f√®re un employ√© moins qualifi√© ayant une attitude positive √† un fauteur de troubles bourr√© de talent. De toute mani√®re, une superstar insatisfaite ne donne jamais son plein rendement.

N'essayez pas de retenir les mill√©niaux

N'embauchez jamais un travailleur en pr√©sumant qu'il restera longtemps en fonction. Si la qualit√© de votre √©quipe vous tient √† c≈ìur, vous regretterez votre d√©cision. N'embauchez que les individus ayant un d√©sir authentique de s'am√©liorer et de gravir les √©chelons, puis accompagnez-les sur le chemin de la r√©ussite. La mar√©e montante soul√®ve tous les bateaux, et de tels individus propulseront votre √©quipe vers de nouveaux sommets.

Mes sup√©rieurs les plus talentueux ont toujours fait preuve d'empathie et d'int√©r√™t envers mon avenir. Ils ont fait de grands efforts pour m'aider √† atteindre mes objectifs. En retour, je n'ai jamais h√©sit√© √† foncer et √† donner le meilleur de moi-m√™me. Aujourd'hui, je traite mes propres employ√©s avec les m√™mes √©gards. J'en tire de grands b√©n√©fices et ils le savent. Mais √† titre de patron, ne suis-je pas la personne cens√©e veiller √† mes propres int√©r√™ts? Pour conclure, les mill√©niaux ont besoin d'√™tre encadr√©s et orient√©s. Assumez ces responsabilit√©s et vous serez surpris des r√©sultats.

Ce blogue a d'abord √©t√© publi√© sur le HuffPost Canada et a √©t√© traduit par le HuffPost Qu√©bec.
TITLE: Ce que les patrons de la G√©n√©ration X doivent savoir √† propos des mill√©niaux

SUMMARY:
For the past year, I have struggled to stomach the presence of Johnny Depp.
Heard then donated her entire ¬£7million settlement to charity, giving half to an organisation that works to prevent domestic violence.
While still unacceptable, incidents that result in your estranged wife requesting a temporary restraining order are not the same as the alleged harassment of over 50 women (Weinstein has denied all claims of nonconsensual sex).
Maybe the video would be remembered for longer and the woman‚Äôs words taken more seriously than Heard‚Äôs ever were.
But in this post-Weinstein Hollywood, I‚Äôm finding the celebration of Depp increasingly more difficult to bear.
TEXT:
For the past year, I have struggled to stomach the presence of Johnny Depp.

This started with his split from Amber Heard. When they settled their divorce outside of court, many aspects of the couple‚Äôs parting remained private, but a number of others did not. The video of him, drinking and appearing to throw a bottle in his kitchen is on the internet, as is a photograph of a mirror, stained with the name of a man Depp thought his wife was having an affair with. Heard said that the words on it are written in paint and blood, which had leaked from Depp‚Äôs hand shortly after he accidentally chopped off a chunk of his finger off (Depp claimed he injured the finger during a filming). In a joint statement, the couple labelled their marriage ‚Äúat times volatile, but always bound by love‚Äù. Heard then donated her entire ¬£7million settlement to charity, giving half to an organisation that works to prevent domestic violence.

The months I spent covering this - writing news stories, a piece on the media‚Äôs portrayal of Heard and another on the settlement money - left me with a dislike for Depp, but one that I could put aside when necessary (mainly when I wanted to watch Sweeney Todd or Edward Scissorhands again).

I rolled my eyes when he was announced as the special guest for Glastonbury‚Äôs all-new Cinemageddon area and skipped ‚ÄòFantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them‚Äô when his role in it was revealed, but knew that others still held highly favourable opinions of him and respected their decisions.

Then on Thursday, I watched as fans clamoured for a glimpse of the star at the Murder On The Orient Express premiere, shouting his name and cheering him on. When Depp appeared on the big screen, the people inside the Royal Albert Hall whooped and clapped and suddenly, the indifference I‚Äôd just about managed to just muster up before was gone. Things are different now.

For the past month, the entertainment industry has played host to an unprecedented amount of sexual harassment and abuse allegations, beginning with those against Harvey Weinstein. It‚Äôs being described as a ‚Äúwatershed moment‚Äù for improving the treatment of women in the industry and time will hopefully confirm that this is the case.

But the revelations that have been made in the last month could also have a ripple effect that we did not initially expect. (It‚Äôs hard to know what to call it all, but I refuse to say ‚Äúscandal‚Äù or ‚Äúcontroversy‚Äù and hasten to label the accounts ‚Äúincidents‚Äù)

For me, it appears that I can no longer find excuses to separate a man‚Äôs reported actions from his ‚Äúart‚Äù. It‚Äôs too much of an ask when my average working day now includes hours of reading and writing about crimes powerful men in Hollywood have allegedly committed against women (and in some cases, other men).

Let me be clear: Depp and Weinstein are miles apart. The two are not linked and this is not a comparison of their alleged actions. While still unacceptable, incidents that result in your estranged wife requesting a temporary restraining order are not the same as the alleged harassment of over 50 women (Weinstein has denied all claims of nonconsensual sex). But as we deal with the fallout from the latter, I‚Äôm finding it harder and harder to look past the former.

Depp isn‚Äôt just ‚Äògetting by‚Äô in the industry. The quality of his movies may have flatlined but when it comes to earnings, he‚Äôs going from strength to strength. ‚ÄòPirates Of The Caribbean‚Äô continues to be one of Disney‚Äôs most financially successful franchises and Depp will also take the lead in the forthcoming ‚ÄòFantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them‚Äô films. He occasionally performs with his band, Hollywood Vampires, and fronts a Christian Dior fragrance campaign.

Only time will tell on this, but I wonder what would happen if an actor went through a similar split now, or in a few months time. Would we question them more? Perhaps the actor‚Äôs famous friends would hesitate before publicly defending him so fervently. Maybe the video would be remembered for longer and the woman‚Äôs words taken more seriously than Heard‚Äôs ever were.

The line in the sand has been drawn though, decreeing that Weinstein - who takes the role of a beached whale in this analogy - be left to wilt on the shore as Captain Jack Sparrow sails past untroubled. I‚Äôm not saying Depp should face the same consequences as the ones the producer is and, given that his divorce played out pre-Weinstein, it‚Äôs unlikely he‚Äôll face anything other than continued adulation from legions of fans in the years to come. But in this post-Weinstein Hollywood, I‚Äôm finding the celebration of Depp increasingly more difficult to bear.
TITLE: In Post-Weinstein Hollywood, The Celebration Of Johnny Depp Is Increasingly Hard To Bear

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTBADAUN -- A 27-year-old woman was burnt alive allegedly by her brother-in-law at a village here after she resisted his attempt to rape her, the police said today.
The incident took place last night when Neelam, a widow, was alone at her house in Labhari, they said, adding that she died on the spot.
The police said that the woman's father has lodged a complaint and a search has been launched to arrest the accused, Jitendra.

TEXT:

BADAUN -- A 27-year-old woman was burnt alive allegedly by her brother-in-law at a village here after she resisted his attempt to rape her, the police said today.

The incident took place last night when Neelam, a widow, was alone at her house in Labhari, they said, adding that she died on the spot.

The police said that the woman's father has lodged a complaint and a search has been launched to arrest the accused, Jitendra.

He has been booked under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code, they said.
TITLE: Woman Burnt Alive In UP's Badaun After She Resisted Rape

SUMMARY:
The winner of a pageant for Brazil's best butt used the occasion to come out front and center with her political beliefs.
On Monday, Rosie Oliveira was named Miss Bumbum Brazil, a title given to the woman perceived to have the top bottom in the whole country.
The 28-year-old model and reporter from the state of Amazonas beat out 26 other finalists for the coveted honor, including 15 finalists at Monday's competition in Sao Paulo.
Although the Miss Bumbum is by design focused on physical attributes, Oliveira used the event to make people think about the future of the country.
During her onstage segment, Oliveira came out with a Brazilian flag with the words "Fora Temer" ‚Äï "Get out Temer" ‚Äï written on it.
TEXT:
The winner of a pageant for Brazil's best butt used the occasion to come out front and center with her political beliefs.

On Monday, Rosie Oliveira was named Miss Bumbum Brazil, a title given to the woman perceived to have the top bottom in the whole country.

The 28-year-old model and reporter from the state of Amazonas beat out 26 other finalists for the coveted honor, including 15 finalists at Monday's competition in Sao Paulo.

Although the Miss Bumbum is by design focused on physical attributes, Oliveira used the event to make people think about the future of the country.

During her onstage segment, Oliveira came out with a Brazilian flag with the words "Fora Temer" ‚Äï "Get out Temer" ‚Äï written on it.
TITLE: Newly Crowned Miss Bumbum Brazil Demands President Step Down

SUMMARY:
A mum received the fright of her life when she glanced up from her washing to find her son had a blind cord wrapped around his neckAussie parent Stevie wasn‚Äôt sure whether to share the incident on social media, as she was feared being criticised.
However she decided to do so in the hope it will raise awareness of an often overlooked safety hazard for children.
Stevie was folding laundry less than two metres from her son, when she looked up to discover he had tangled himself in the blind cords, with one wrapped around his neck.
‚ÄúI looked up from the washing pile and [saw] him caught in the cords.
‚ÄúI have been overwhelmed with the response of support,‚Äù Stevie told HuffPost UK.
TEXT:
A mum received the fright of her life when she glanced up from her washing to find her son had a blind cord wrapped around his neck

Aussie parent Stevie wasn‚Äôt sure whether to share the incident on social media, as she was feared being criticised. However she decided to do so in the hope it will raise awareness of an often overlooked safety hazard for children.

Stevie was folding laundry less than two metres from her son, when she looked up to discover he had tangled himself in the blind cords, with one wrapped around his neck.

‚ÄúI looked up from the washing pile and [saw] him caught in the cords. I immediately jump up as fast as I could and untangled him,‚Äù she explained in an Instagram post that has garnered an outpouring of online support.

‚ÄúI have been overwhelmed with the response of support,‚Äù Stevie told HuffPost UK.
TITLE: Mum Issues Warning For Parents After Discovering Her Son With Blind Cord Wrapped Around his Neck

SUMMARY:
Strictly Come Dancing‚Äôs Craig Revel Horwood might have a reputation for being the harshest judge on the BBC dance show, but even he‚Äôs admitted that new head judge Shirley Ballas has been stealing his thunder this year.
Craig has gone as far as to label Shirley the ‚Äúvillain‚Äù of this series, after she dished out some hard to swallow critiques to some of this year‚Äôs celebrity contestants.
BBC Craig (left) has laid into Shirley (right) over her feedback.
Shirley has been particularly technical in her feedback since joining the show this year.
A Strictly source told The Sun: ‚ÄúShirley is a stickler for technique and she‚Äôs proud of her dance knowledge.
TEXT:
Strictly Come Dancing‚Äôs Craig Revel Horwood might have a reputation for being the harshest judge on the BBC dance show, but even he‚Äôs admitted that new head judge Shirley Ballas has been stealing his thunder this year. Craig has gone as far as to label Shirley the ‚Äúvillain‚Äù of this series, after she dished out some hard to swallow critiques to some of this year‚Äôs celebrity contestants.

BBC Craig (left) has laid into Shirley (right) over her feedback.

BBC

Ultimately, she chose to give Aston his marching orders, but viewers were not happy, with many criticising Shirley for sending home a contestant who had been a favourite throughout the contest. Shirley has been particularly technical in her feedback since joining the show this year. Earlier in the series she told ‚ÄòGood Morning Britain‚Äô presenter ‚Äúwe had nine sets of eight before we got started‚Äù, and told TV chef Simon Rimmer ‚Äúyou have to learn what closes, what crosses, what‚Äôs a flat foot, what‚Äôs a toe, and with your soft knees it will help you to glide around the floor.‚Äù But a BBC source insists that show bosses are ‚Äúdelighted‚Äù with how well Shirley is doing on the show. A Strictly source told The Sun: ‚ÄúShirley is a stickler for technique and she‚Äôs proud of her dance knowledge. She‚Äôs trying to ignore social media for a while and not let other people‚Äôs opinions get to her but it does get hard, especially when the abuse is so personal. ‚ÄúShe was hoping Strictly would be a fun experience and wasn‚Äôt banking on a backlash. ‚ÄúBut bosses are delighted with how she‚Äôs getting on and like her detailed critique.‚Äù
TITLE: ‚ÄòStrictly Come Dancing‚Äô: Craig Revel Horwood Labels Shirley Ballas The ‚ÄòVillain‚Äô Of The Show And Blasts Her Feedback For Being ‚ÄòFrighteningly Technical‚Äô

SUMMARY:
It seems odd that a major U.S. government climate report released Nov. 3 didn't receive more media attention.
But then, the most newsworthy thing about the Climate Science Special Report is that it was released at all, apparently without political interference.
Bush in 1989) to report to the public about "climate change and its physical impacts" every four years, the current administration is openly hostile to climate science and scientists.
The government overseeing this report is filled with people who reject climate science.
And yet, the government overseeing this report is filled with people who reject climate science.
TEXT:
It seems odd that a major U.S. government climate report released Nov. 3 didn't receive more media attention. But then, the most newsworthy thing about the Climate Science Special Report is that it was released at all, apparently without political interference.

Although the U.S. government is required by law (enacted by President George H.W. Bush in 1989) to report to the public about "climate change and its physical impacts" every four years, the current administration is openly hostile to climate science and scientists. According to White House sources quoted in the New York Times, President Donald Trump was "barely aware of the report's existence."

U.S. President Donald Trump speaks to world leaders at the 72nd United Nations (UN) General Assembly at UN headquarters in New York on Sept. 19, 2017 in New York City.

The report, released by 13 federal agencies under the direction of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, examines the available science. It was written by dozens of government and non-government scientists, reviewed by the independent National Academy of Sciences and approved by the National Economic Council.

It concludes that we are living in the warmest period in the history of modern civilization, with the last three years being the warmest on record; that we are seeing more "record-breaking, climate-related weather extremes;" and that all the evidence points to human activities, "especially emissions of greenhouse gases," as the main cause. Climate change should be in the headlines every day until everyone takes it seriously, but the report's conclusions are not new.

"Thousands of studies conducted by researchers around the world have documented changes in surface, atmospheric and oceanic temperatures; melting glaciers; diminishing snow cover; shrinking sea ice; rising sea levels; ocean acidification; and increasing atmospheric water vapour," the reports says.

The government overseeing this report is filled with people who reject climate science.

It's hard to imagine anyone could read this report, or read about it, and not be convinced we have an urgent problem and that failing to put everything we can into resolving it puts our survival at risk!

And yet, the government overseeing this report is filled with people who reject climate science. The president himself has called climate science a "hoax." He's appointed climate science deniers to key positions, repealed and weakened environmental laws, had climate change references removed from the Environmental Protection Agency's website and barred EPA scientists from presenting climate change reports. Many delegates at the UN Climate Conference underway in Bonn, Germany, have condemned Trump's decision to pull the U.S. from the Paris Agreement.

The official White House statement on the report was a rehash of tired climate science‚Äìdenial talking points. White House spokesperson Raj Shah said, "The climate has changed and is always changing." He then went on to cast doubt regarding the climate's sensitivity to greenhouse gas emissions.

Scott Pruitt, administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), speaks during an interview in his office at the EPA headquarters in Washington, D.C., on Oct. 25, 2017.

EPA administrator Scott Pruitt has denied the well-known connection between carbon dioxide emissions and global warming, and Energy Secretary Rick Perry has argued the science isn't conclusive.

But the report also shows that, despite country's apparent descent into a post-truth, anti-science dystopia, the United States still maintains sanity in some of its major institutions. Organizations like NASA, NOAA, the EPA and the Department of Defense, along with numerous non-governmental scientific institutions, are continuing to examine the real trends and risks of a planet warming rapidly because of human activity.

It also shows we must do all we can to work toward solutions ‚Äî economic, technological, philosophical and more ‚Äî and to only support politicians who demonstrate the foresight, imagination and courage to take on this crisis with the force and intensity it merits.

That a government elected to serve the people would reject the findings of its own scientists and researchers... is an intergenerational crime.

One frustration of studying and communicating about climate issues is knowing that so many solutions exist and are being developed, but that widespread denial of the problem prevents us from moving beyond outdated technologies and economic systems.

That people who profit from those outdated technologies would do everything they can to sow doubt and confusion is not surprising. That a government elected to serve the people would reject the findings of its own scientists and researchers from around the world to the detriment of human health, the economy and the environment is an intergenerational crime.

Christopher Field, director of the Stanford Woods Institute for the Environment, told the New York Times, "This profoundly affects our ability to be leaders in developing new technologies and understanding how to build successful communities and businesses in the 21st century." It also puts human survival at risk.

Written with contributions from David Suzuki Foundation Senior Editor Ian Hanington.

Learn more at www.davidsuzuki.org.

Follow HuffPost Canada Blogs on Facebook

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: U.S. Climate Report A Glimmer Of Sanity In Anti-Science White House
