SUMMARY:
There‚Äôs no PMQs today (Parliament is on a short recess) and so Theresa May doesn‚Äôt have the time pressure of a High Noon showdown with Jeremy Corbyn to speed her actions on Priti Patel.
At the request of the Prime Minister, Patel is now flying back to the UK from a trip to Uganda.
Almost exactly 16 months after being first promoted to the Cabinet (on May‚Äôs second day in office), Patel‚Äôs political career seems to be in a terminal nose-dive.
There have long been concerns about Patel‚Äôs links to Indian PM Narendra Modi too.
I‚Äôm told the PM wants to personally talk to Patel to hear an explanation of her Israeli links, but the outcome looks clear.
TEXT:
There‚Äôs no PMQs today (Parliament is on a short recess) and so Theresa May doesn‚Äôt have the time pressure of a High Noon showdown with Jeremy Corbyn to speed her actions on Priti Patel. But the PM nevertheless senses the urgency of needing to sack her International Development Secretary after the latest proof that she ‚Äòwent rogue‚Äô with her very own foreign policy.

At the request of the Prime Minister, Patel is now flying back to the UK from a trip to Uganda. While she‚Äôs up the air, her career isn‚Äôt ‚Äì she looks finished. No.10 would not be telling us that May has summoned her minister for her second dressing down in three days, only to then let her off with a slap on the wrist. Almost exactly 16 months after being first promoted to the Cabinet (on May‚Äôs second day in office), Patel‚Äôs political career seems to be in a terminal nose-dive.

The reason for the sacking is yet another example of Patel failing to be straight with the PM over her links to Israeli officials and lobbyists. Last night it emerged she‚Äôd not told No.10 about plans to fund the Israeli Defence Force in the Golan Heights. This morning, it seems two meetings in September were not disclosed, and on top of that her trip colleague Lord Polak now seems to have links to lobbyists (as the Times points out, another breach of the ministerial code). There have long been concerns about Patel‚Äôs links to Indian PM Narendra Modi too. I‚Äôm told the PM wants to personally talk to Patel to hear an explanation of her Israeli links, but the outcome looks clear. Lying to the Guardian about your trip is bad enough. Trying to con the PM is another entirely.

Given we are so close to the Budget, a wide reshuffle looks unlikely and we may get another limited set of changes similar to Fallon‚Äôs demise last week. Will Sir Alan Duncan (ex-DfID, now FCO) get the nod? Will Alastair Burt (as expert on the Middle East complexities as any minister in government) get the promotion many thinks he deserves? Patel was well-liked by many Tory MPs, and was a Brexiteer. Will her replacement have to be a Brexiteer too? May can‚Äôt bodge this one like she did Gavin Williamson‚Äôs promotion last week.

The Sun has a devastating quote from an ally of the PM: ‚ÄúPriti wants to be leader, she‚Äôs made that very clear to all of us. Unfortunately for her, she‚Äôs too stupid and her actions here have proved that.‚Äù But Patel‚Äôs own allies suspect the Foreign Office has been briefing against her. However, few subscribe to the conspiracy theory of Nadhim Zahawi on Newsnight last night: ‚ÄúSome of this stuff is being drummed up because both Priti and the Foreign Secretary are big beasts in the Brexit campaign and some Labour Remoaners and others who think if we take out some of these beasts and derail the government then maybe we can actually do a U-turn on Brexit.‚Äù

May is acting now, despite her earlier prevarication, because she really has no choice. Some of her ministers want her to use this to really stamp her authority on the Government and fire both Boris and Patel at the same time and start a full scale reshuffle. For now, May just be relieved to have enough authority to sack anyone. There are huge questions as to why the PM hadn‚Äôt already referred Patel for ministerial code breaches, and further questions as to the effectiveness of Cabinet office ethics chief Sue Gray and the entire investigations process. But for now, the PM has at least to steady the ship of state. Again.
TITLE: The Waugh Zone Wednesday November 8, 2017

TEXT:

Houria Bouteldja doit s√ªrement trouver que c'est tendance, que c'est cool, que c'est bien, que c'est antiraciste.
Pol√©miqueDerni√®rement, la d√©put√©e La France insoumise Dani√®le Obono a pris la d√©fense de la porte-parole du Parti des indig√®nes de la R√©publique (PIR), Houria Bouteldja, sa "camarade", dit-elle : "Je respecte la militante antiraciste.
C'est ce qu'√©crit ce lundi 6 novembre, sur sa page Facebook, la d√©put√©e France insoumise Dani√®le Obono.
Tant cette photographie est brutale, tant on peut penser que ce serait chouette, que ce serait tendance, fun et ¬´ antiraciste ¬ª d'envoyer les sionistes (les Juifs?)
Dans un texte publi√© sur son mur Facebook, le politologue Laurent Bouvet, tire la sonnette d'alarme : "La libert√©, l'√©galit√©, la fraternit√©, la la√Øcit√©, l'universalisme, l'antiracisme, le rationalisme.
TEXT:
Elle est assise sur une sorte de banc, toute sourire et l√®ve les deux pouces, parce qu'elle semble contente d'elle. Houria Bouteldja, porte-parole des Indig√®nes de la R√©publique, pose et cette photographie est accessible sur le Net. A c√¥t√© d'elle une chaise blanche. Sur le haut du si√®ge est √©crit au marqueur et en grand : "Sionistes au goulag", sur le bas du m√™me si√®ge, l'inscription : "Peace". Houria Bouteldja doit s√ªrement trouver que c'est tendance, que c'est cool, que c'est bien, que c'est antiraciste. Elle sourit, hilare. Bien √©videmment, ce n'est pas l'expression "Peace" qui fait poser Madame Bouteldja. C'est bien l'expression "Sionistes au goulag". "C'est vrai que je suis r√©put√©e √™tre raciste anti-blanc, antis√©mite et homophobe. Je dis sur ce plateau que je me fous compl√®tement de ce qu'on dit de moi", s'√©tait d√©fendue la sulfureuse jeune femme, en mars 2016.

Alors faisons un peu d'histoire

Dans leur ouvrage "Le Goulag", (Editions bouquins 1120 pages) dont Lib√©ration rend compte le 18 octobre 2017, les historiens Luba Jurgenson et Nicolas Werth sont pr√©cis. "Combien √©taient-ils (au goulag) ? 20 millions de femmes dont on a peu parl√©, d'enfants dont-on n'a pas parl√© et d'hommes dont on a parl√© mais pas assez sont pass√©s par les camps de l'Administration principale des camps, la Glavno√Ø√© oupravl√©ni√© lagu√©re√Ø, dont l'acronyme restera : le "Goulag". Combien sont morts ? Probablement 4 millions, entre 1929 et 1954, estime Werth, sans prendre en compte les "lib√©r√©s" de la derni√®re minute, celle qui pr√©c√©dait la mort, et les d√©tenus abattus par un gardien irascible pour une r√©flexion, un geste maladroit ou pour rire."

Nous avons tous en t√™te ce que veut dire le mot "goulag" : cette cohorte ininterrompue de supplici√©s, de damn√©s, ces condamn√©s, les for√ßats et d√©port√©s qui subissaient le joug d'un syst√®me totalitaire et meurtrier, qui avait pour nom le communisme et son avatar monstrueux, le stalinisme. Les condamn√©s √† crever dans la neige et le froid. Des centaines de milliers d'ex√©cutions sommaires, la famine organis√©e tout le temps, toujours, les millions de d√©tenus, les peuples entiers d√©port√©s (comme les Tatars de Crim√©e), des millions de morts, c'est cela le goulag. C'est cela le goulag et rien d'autre, ce ne furent pas des camps de vacances ou le Club Med. Ce cauchemar du goulag, qui avait √©t√© r√©v√©l√© au monde par Alexandre Soljenitsyne dans son fameux "Archipel du goulag", publi√© en d√©cembre 1973.

Pol√©mique

Derni√®rement, la d√©put√©e La France insoumise Dani√®le Obono a pris la d√©fense de la porte-parole du Parti des indig√®nes de la R√©publique (PIR), Houria Bouteldja, sa "camarade", dit-elle : "Je respecte la militante antiraciste. C'est dans le mouvement antiraciste que je l'ai connue, c'est dans ces luttes-l√† que l'on s'est battues", a-t-elle d√©clar√© au micro de Radio J. Contradictoirement et probablement sous la charge m√©diatique, la charge et les moqueries diverses dans les r√©seaux sociaux, notamment dans les r√©seaux sociaux, la d√©put√©e d√©clare ensuite : "Je ne suis pas et n'ai jamais √©t√© membre du PIR [Parti des indig√®nes de la R√©publique, ndlr]. Je suis en profond d√©saccord avec leurs th√®ses." C'est ce qu'√©crit ce lundi 6 novembre, sur sa page Facebook, la d√©put√©e France insoumise Dani√®le Obono. "Mon seul programme est celui de La France Insoumise, l'Avenir en commun. J'en ai coordonn√© les livrets th√©matiques. Je souscris √† l'ensemble du programme sans exclusive. C'est celui sur lequel j'ai √©t√© √©lue d√©put√©e de la 17e circonscription de Paris", √©crit-elle. Il √©tait temps, Madame la d√©put√©e, que vous tentiez de clarifier votre pens√©e.

Quant √† la photographie pr√©sentant la porte-parole du PIR √† c√¥t√© d'une pancarte "Les sionistes au goulag", Dani√®le Obono juge qu'il s'agissait d'une "photo de tr√®s mauvais go√ªt", qui n'√©tait "pas acceptable", rapporte BFMTV, en date du 5 novembre 2017.

Pas acceptable cette photographie?

Voil√† pour le moins, un euph√©misme. On en rirait, si c'√©tait dr√¥le. Tant cette photographie est brutale, tant on peut penser que ce serait chouette, que ce serait tendance, fun et ¬´ antiraciste ¬ª d'envoyer les sionistes (les Juifs?) au goulag, donc √† la mort. Je dis bien, √† la mort.

Par ailleurs, interrog√©e sur le fait de savoir si les propos d'Houria Bouteldja - qui affirmait en mars 2015 que "Les juifs sont les boucliers, les tirailleurs de la politique imp√©rialiste fran√ßaise et de sa politique islamophobe" - √©taient des propos racistes ou antiracistes, la d√©put√©e de Paris a r√©pondu: "Je ne sais pas". Terrifiant. Est-ce l√† l'antiracisme tendance ? Sont-ce l√† des valeurs ? Que de ne pas vouloir voir ou de ne pas comprendre que le pseudo antiracisme √† la mode anti blancs, antijuifs, anti homosexuels ne rel√®vent en aucun cas des valeurs de l'antiracisme et des valeurs de la R√©publique?

Dans un texte publi√© sur son mur Facebook, le politologue Laurent Bouvet, tire la sonnette d'alarme : "La libert√©, l'√©galit√©, la fraternit√©, la la√Øcit√©, l'universalisme, l'antiracisme, le rationalisme. Tout ce qui a fait ce que nous sommes, nous Fran√ßais, est aujourd'hui d√©voy√© et pi√©tin√© par une petite minorit√© de fauteurs de haine et de division qui osent pr√©tendre incarner ¬´ la ¬ª gauche". https://www.facebook.com/notes/laurent-bouvet/%C3%A7a-suffit-/10155971521049309/

C'est bien cela, oui. Le d√©voiement de l'antiracisme est une abjection et il doit √™tre d√©nonc√© avec force, √©galement et surtout par la gauche.
TITLE: Madame la d√©put√©e de la France insoumise et Houria Bouteldja

SUMMARY:
The Duchess of Cambridge met with children who have been supported by a mental health charity, of which she is a patron.
HRH has a continued desire to draw attention to child mental health issues, and the important work that @AFNCCF is doing in this space.
The Duchess of Cambridge arrives at the @AFNCCF Gala Dinner held at the Orangery at Kensington Palace.
The Duchess‚Äô continued desire to draw attention to child mental health issues is evident as her return to public duties has seen her focusing on this topic.
The event was held to recognise the progress, hard work and dedication of those working in the mental health sector across the UK.
TEXT:
The Duchess of Cambridge met with children who have been supported by a mental health charity, of which she is a patron. Kate attended the 2017 Gala Dinner for the Anna Freud National Centre for Children and Families (AFNCCF), held in The Orangery at Kensington Palace on Tuesday 7 November, where she chatted with families.

WPA Pool via Getty Images Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge speaks to Peter Fonagy, chief executive and a tutor at The Anna Freud Centre at the 2017 Gala Dinner for The Anna Freud National Centre for Children and Families (AFNCCF) at Kensington Palace on 7 November 2017.

Delighted to have our patron HRH The Duchess of Cambridge showing her support for our new Centre of Excellencehttps://t.co/s7QEFYY8E8 pic.twitter.com/9IZSjnM9W0 November 7, 2017

The Duchess attended the reception to hear more about the work of the AFNCCF and to meet with some of the charity‚Äôs service users, including families who have benefitted from the work of the organisation.

The Duchess meets key supporters of @AFNCCF at a reception, including families who benefit from the charity. pic.twitter.com/PJQkBGpvSs ‚Äî Kensington Palace (@KensingtonRoyal) November 7, 2017

The AFNCCF has built a new Centre of Excellence which will bring together people and organisations in mental health, education, social care and neuroscience alongside children and families often in vulnerable situations.

HRH has a continued desire to draw attention to child mental health issues, and the important work that @AFNCCF is doing in this space. pic.twitter.com/Z4HjhkRXvs ‚Äî Kensington Palace (@KensingtonRoyal) November 7, 2017

At the heart of this new campus will be The Family School for children aged between five to14 who have been excluded from mainstream education, which will combine mental health care and education.

The Duchess of Cambridge arrives at the @AFNCCF Gala Dinner held at the Orangery at Kensington Palace. pic.twitter.com/6376DXu9oV ‚Äî Kensington Palace (@KensingtonRoyal) November 7, 2017

The Duchess has now resumed royal duties after taking a short break following the announcement on 4 September that she and the Duke of Cambridge were expecting their third child. The announcement came earlier than initially planned as Kate was forced to call off some planned engagements as she was suffering from Hyperemesis Gravidarum. The Duchess‚Äô continued desire to draw attention to child mental health issues is evident as her return to public duties has seen her focusing on this topic. She made her first public appearance following the pregnancy announcement at a Buckingham Palace reception to mark World Mental Health Day on Tuesday 10 October. The event was held to recognise the progress, hard work and dedication of those working in the mental health sector across the UK.

HEATHCLIFF O'MALLEY via Getty Images Prince William, Duke of Cambridge and Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge take part in a reception at Buckingham Palace to celebrate World Mental Health Day in central London on 10 October 2017.
TITLE: Duchess Of Cambridge Discusses Children's Mental Health At Charity Gala

Syria took a break on Tuesday from its gruesome six-year civil war to announce plans to sign the Paris climate agreement, leaving the United States as the only country to reject the emissions-cutting deal.
The announcement came at the 23rd Conference of the Parties in Bonn, Germany, the world's biggest climate conference.
Only war-torn Syria and Nicaragua, which protested the agreement's failure to impose strict demands on major polluters, refused to sign.
But President Donald Trump, who rejects scientists' warnings about climate change, announced plans to withdraw from the pact in June, insisting developing nations received more benefits and the U.S. got none.

TEXT:
Syria took a break on Tuesday from its gruesome six-year civil war to announce plans to sign the Paris climate agreement, leaving the United States as the only country to reject the emissions-cutting deal.

The announcement came at the 23rd Conference of the Parties in Bonn, Germany, the world's biggest climate conference. The non-binding Paris accord, through which signatories pledge to reduce emissions of planet-warming gases over the coming decades, was brokered in 2015, when the annual conference was held in the French capital.

The deal was considered historic because it was the first climate agreement to include the U.S. ‚Äï the world's biggest historic emitter, with by far the largest per-capita carbon footprint ‚Äï and China, which currently produces the most carbon pollution on a national level. The U.S. took a lead role in shaping the deal.

Only war-torn Syria and Nicaragua, which protested the agreement's failure to impose strict demands on major polluters, refused to sign.

But President Donald Trump, who rejects scientists' warnings about climate change, announced plans to withdraw from the pact in June, insisting developing nations received more benefits and the U.S. got none. In his announcement ‚Äï which, under the terms of the deal, fully can't go into effect until November 2020 ‚Äï Trump seemed to conflate the accord with a trade deal, demonstrating what was widely described as a poor understanding of how the Paris agreement actually works.

"Like the playground bully that eventually loses all his friends, Donald Trump has isolated himself on the world stage," Joe Ware, a spokesman for the charity Christian Aid, said in a statement. "When even Syria, with all its problems, can see the sense of a global climate agreement it really shows how ideologically wedded to climate denialism the US Republican Party has become."
TITLE: Syria Vows To Sign Paris Agreement, Leaving U.S. Alone In Climate Denial

TEXT:
UPDATE: 12:40 p.m. ‚Äï Ed Westwick flatly denied having raped actress Kristina Cohen in a message posted to Twitter and Instagram on Tuesday.

‚ÄúI do not know this woman. I have never forced myself in any manner, on any woman. I certainly have never committed rape,‚Äù he wrote.

PREVIOUSLY:

Actress Kristina Cohen said in a lengthy Facebook post shared Monday that ‚ÄúGossip Girl‚Äù star Ed Westwick raped her three years ago.

Cohen, 27, said that she met Westwick, 30, through her boyfriend at the time, a producer who goes unnamed in the post. The incident occurred when the couple went over to actor‚Äôs house one night, she wrote.

Cohen was taken aback when Westwick allegedly suggested ‚Äúwe should all fuck,‚Äù but her boyfriend convinced her to stay for dinner to avoid making their host uncomfortable. At Westwick‚Äôs suggestion, Cohen said she then retired to the guest room for a nap while her boyfriend tried to smooth things over.

‚ÄúSo I went and laid down in the guest room where I eventually fell asleep, I was woken up abruptly by Ed on top of me, his fingers entering my body. I told him to stop, but he was strong,‚Äù Cohen wrote. ‚ÄúI fought him off as hard as I could but he grabbed my face in his hands, shaking me, telling me he wanted to fuck me. I was paralyzed, terrified. I couldn‚Äôt speak, I could no longer move. He held me down and raped me.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt was a nightmare, and the days following weren‚Äôt any better,‚Äù she added.

A representative for Westwick did not immediately return HuffPost‚Äôs request for comment.

David Krieger/Bauer-Griffin via Getty Images Ed Westwick and Leighton Meester film scenes for "Gossip Girl" in 2012.

Cohen said that her boyfriend blamed her for the assault and cautioned against speaking out against Westwick for the sake of her career.

Over the years, she has appeared in a handful of minor roles in projects including ‚ÄúCalifornication‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Middle,‚Äù as well as the web series ‚ÄúLadies Like Us.‚Äù Westwick rose to fame on the hit CW soap playing bad boy Chuck Bass, a character with his own history of sexual assault. He now stars on the BBC Two series ‚ÄúWhite Gold.‚Äù

Cohen said the wave of sexual assault allegations leveled against powerful men in Hollywood pushed her to come forward with her story now. She hopes to change the public perception of men like Westwick and encourage other victims of sexual assault never to blame themselves.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sickened to see men like Ed respected in such a public way. Interviewed by prestigious platforms such as the Oxford Union Society at Oxford University, where he was honored as one of their ‚ÄòPeople who Shape our World,‚Äô‚Äù Cohen wrote. ‚ÄúHow does this end? Men like Ed using fame and power to rape and intimidate but then continue through the world collecting accolades.‚Äù

‚ÄúI hope that my stories and the stories of others help to reset and realign the toxic environments and power imbalances that have created these monsters,‚Äù she concluded.
TITLE: Actress Kristina Cohen Says 'Gossip Girl' Star Ed Westwick Raped Her (UPDATE)

TEXT:
GENRE - Un "troisi√®me sexe" en Allemagne? Le Tribunal constitutionnel f√©d√©ral allemand a demand√© ce mercredi 8 novembre la possibilit√© que soit inscrit sur les documents administratifs une mention autre que "femme" ou "homme". Ce qui devrait faire de l'Allemagne le premier pays en Europe √† le reconna√Ætre officiellement.

Le tribunal constitutionnel allemand a donn√© √† la chambre des d√©put√©s jusqu'√† "fin 2018" pour voter la l√©galisation d'un "troisi√®me sexe" sur les registres de naissance, √† c√¥t√© des mentions "masculin" et "f√©minin", selon la d√©cision de la juridiction consult√©e par l'AFP.

La juridiction bas√©e √† Karlsruhe invite les d√©put√©s √† introduire dans les documents concern√©s une mention telle que "inter", "divers" ou tout autre "d√©signation positive du sexe".

Pour que les personnes intersexes soient enregistr√©es "positivement"

Comme le souligne le S√ºddeutsche Zeitung, cette demande de la cour constitutionnelle allemande est faite pour que les personnes intersexes puissent enregistrer leur identit√© de genre "positivement".

L'intersexualit√© d√©signe une personne √©tant n√©e avec des organes g√©nitaux ou des chromosomes qui ne correspondent pas √† la traditionnelle binarit√© homme/femme. Souvent, les organes g√©nitaux sont difficiles √† identifier et les m√©decins d√©cident d'orienter la personne vers un genre ou un autre.

Jusqu'√† pr√©sent, il √©tait possible en Allemagne depuis mai 2013 de ne pas renseigner le champ relatif au sexe en le laissant vide, les int√©ress√©s pouvant ensuite, au cours de leur vie, soit faire le choix d'un sexe masculin ou f√©minin, soit garder la mention du sexe non renseign√©e.

Mais la Cour f√©d√©rale de justice, une instance inf√©rieure, avait refus√© en ao√ªt 2016 d'aller plus loin et de reconna√Ætre l'existence juridique d'un troisi√®me sexe, jugeant que ce ne serait "pas l√©gal". Elle avait rejet√© une demande d'une personne intersexuelle, n√©e en 1989 et enregistr√©e avec le sexe f√©minin. Cette personne, comme le raconte Die Welt, s'appelle Vanja de Leipzig, et ne se consid√®re ni comme un homme ni comme une femme.

Soutenue par une association de soutien au troisi√®me sexe, cette personne s'est alors tourn√©e vers la plus haute juridiction, la Cour constitutionnelle. La personne plaignante a pr√©sent√© aux juges supr√™mes des analyses chromosomiques mettant en √©vidence qu'il n'√©tait ni un homme ni une femme.

En France, une demande semblable rejet√©e

En France, Ga√´tan Schmitt, 66 ans, a demand√© l'inscription sur son √©tat-civil de la mention "sexe neutre". Dans un arr√™t rendu en mai 2017, la Cour de cassation a rejet√© cette demande. Cette personne est n√©e selon les termes de son m√©decin, avec un "vagin rudimentaire", un "microp√©nis", mais pas de testicules.

[Communiqu√©] Consulter l'arr√™t "sexe neutre et √©tat civil" ainsi que le communiqu√© de presse sur : https://t.co/ss1AdKr8cR pic.twitter.com/9krv15w5hy ‚Äî Cour de cassation (@Courdecassation) 4 mai 2017

√Ä sa naissance, Ga√´tan Schmitt a √©t√© reconnu comme un petit gar√ßon, il a pris conscience de son intersexualit√© √† l'√¢ge de 12 ans. Apr√®s la publication de l'arr√™t de la Cour de cassation, les deux avocats de ce Fran√ßais ont d√©cid√© de porter un recours devant la Cour europ√©enne des droits de l'homme.

Selon des estimations du Conseil d'√©thique, 80.000 personnes intersexu√©es vivent aujourd'hui en Allemagne.

Si les d√©put√©s valident bien la demande des juges constitutionnels, cela ferait de l'Allemagne le premier pays en Europe √† reconna√Ætre officiellement un troisi√®me genre. En mai, la France avait rejet√© la mention "sexe neutre", √©cartant la demande d'une personne n√©e sans p√©nis ni vagin.

√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: La justice allemande demande la l√©galisation d'un "troisi√®me sexe"

TEXT:
Durante una conferencia de prensa en Corea del Sur, Ali Vitali de NBC le pregunt√≥ a Trump si √©l considerar√≠a un "examen exhaustivo" para cualquiera que quisiera comprar un arma.

Despu√©s de describir el control de armas como "una situaci√≥n que probablemente no debiera ser discutida ahora", Trump dijo que una revisi√≥n m√°s estricta de los antecedentes para comprar armas "no hubiera hecho diferencia" en el ataque, en el que 26 personas murieron, incluyendo varios ni√±os.

Trump tambi√©n invoc√≥ a Stephen Willeford, el residente de la localidad de Sutherland Springs que confront√≥ al agresor Devin Kelley. Trump dijo que con una revisi√≥n de antecedentes m√°s estricta, "es posible que no hubieras tenido a esa persona valiente que ten√≠a un arma o un rifle en su camioneta y que sali√≥, le dispar√≥ y lo neutraliz√≥. S√≥lo puedo decir esto: si √©l no hubiera tenido un arma, en lugar de tener 26 muertos, hubieras tenido cientos m√°s".

Trump on civilian who intervened in Texas shooting: "If he didn't have a gun, instead of having 26 dead, you would have had hundreds more." pic.twitter.com/K67H8HpF9J
TITLE: El control de armas hubiera dejado 'cientos de muertos m√°s' en la iglesia de Texas: Trump

Treize grands chefs restaurateurs de Montr√©al se mobilisent √† nouveau pour faire vivre une exp√©rience gastronomique √† 250 personnes sans-abris, lors de Pas d'Radis Fiscaux : l'√âtat d'Urgence, une mobilisation citoyenne et artistique d√©non√ßant les Paradis fiscaux et les ¬´l√©gislations de complaisance¬ª.

√áa se d√©roulera du jeudi 16 au dimanche 19 novembre 2017, sur la Place √âmilie-Gamelin, √† Montr√©al.

Voici les restaurateurs au grand coeur: Au Pied de Cochon, Joe Beef/Vin Papillon, La Colombe, Montr√©al Plaza, L'Or√©gon, Le Pain dans les Voiles, Patrice Patissier, pour le banquet Cochon, Grumman 78, Toqu√©, Bloomfield, Le Mousso, Le Caf√© du Nouveau Monde, Pastaga, Holder et un Festin Malaisien par la communaut√© musulmane de Montr√©al, pour deux repas su soir.

Deux repas par jour offerts aux plus d√©munis

Ces solidarit√©s des grands restaurants montr√©alais permettent √† L'ATSA de poursuivre sa tradition d'inclusion et d'offrir aux personnes de la rue ou en √©tat de pr√©carit√©, deux services de repas par jour durant l'√©v√©nement. ¬´ Ces moments extraordinaires que nous font vivre ces restaurateurs forgent des souvenirs qui donnent du courage dans les moments difficiles √† ceux et celles qui voient no√´l arriver le c≈ìur lourd. ¬ª expliquent Annie Roy et Pierre Allard, co-fondateurs de ATSA, Quand l'art passe √† l'action.

Le retour du banquet cochon anim√© par Christian B√©gin

De 2003 √† 2010, lors des pr√©c√©dentes √©ditions d'√âtat d'urgence de l'ATSA, le chef Martin Picard du restaurant Au Pied de Cochon a pris en charge avec plusieurs restaurateurs, Le Banquet Cochon, un repas cinq services offert sous chapiteau aux personnes seules et itin√©rantes. Ce temps fort a √©t√© plebiscit√© par les personnes de la rue - et Martin Picard a accept√© de renouveler l'exp√©rience, en impliquant sa nouvelle recrue, Michael Picard, responsable de cuisine de son restaurant, ainsi que les chefs des restaurants Joe Beef/Vin Papillon, Le Montr√©al Plaza, La Colombe, L'Oregon, le Pain dans les Voiles et Patrice P√¢tissier !

Cet √©v√©nement interdisciplinaire gratuit est pr√©sent√© par ATSA, Quand l'Art passe √† l'action qui souligne cette ann√©e ses 20 ans d'art en action.

Pour plus d'informations, c'est ici: www.atsa.qc.ca
TITLE: Treize grands chefs restaurateurs de Montr√©al offriront une exp√©rience gastronomique √† 250 sans abris

SUMMARY:
WASHINGTON ‚Äï You may have seen this photo of President Donald Trump‚Äôs motorcade winding down a wooded road last week as a woman on a bicycle pedaled by ‚Äï giving the middle finger to Trump.
Late-night talk show hosts told jokes about the encounter and people on social media began hailing the unidentified woman as a ‚Äúshe-ro,‚Äù using the hashtag #Her2020.
‚ÄúBasically, you cannot have ‚Äòlewd‚Äô or ‚Äòobscene‚Äô things in your social media.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking, DACA recipients are getting kicked out.
I‚Äôm thinking, he‚Äôs at the damn golf course again.‚Äù‚ÄúI flipped off the motorcade a number of times,‚Äù she added.
TEXT:
WASHINGTON ‚Äï You may have seen this photo of President Donald Trump‚Äôs motorcade winding down a wooded road last week as a woman on a bicycle pedaled by ‚Äï giving the middle finger to Trump.

BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI via Getty Images

The picture, snapped by a White House photographer traveling with the president as he left his golf course in Sterling, Va., went viral almost immediately. News outlets picked up the story when it appeared in a White House pool report. Late-night talk show hosts told jokes about the encounter and people on social media began hailing the unidentified woman as a ‚Äúshe-ro,‚Äù using the hashtag #Her2020.

The woman‚Äôs name is Juli Briskman. Her employer, government contractor Akima LLC, wasn‚Äôt so happy about the photo. They fired her over it.

In a Saturday interview with HuffPost, Briskman, a 50-year-old mother of two, said she was stunned that someone had taken a picture of her giving Trump the middle finger.

As the photo circulated online, Briskman decided to tell Akima‚Äôs HR department what was happening when she went to work on Monday. By Tuesday, her bosses called her into a meeting and said she had violated the company‚Äôs social media policy by using the photo as her profile picture on Twitter and Facebook.

‚ÄúThey said, ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre separating from you,‚Äò‚Äù said Briskman. ‚ÄúBasically, you cannot have ‚Äòlewd‚Äô or ‚Äòobscene‚Äô things in your social media. So they were calling flipping him off ‚Äòobscene.‚Äô‚Äù

Briskman, who worked in marketing and communications at Akima for just over six months, said she emphasized to the executives that she wasn‚Äôt on the job when the incident happened and that her social media pages don‚Äôt mention her employer. They told her that because Akima was a government contractor, the photo could hurt their business, she said.

Virginia is an employment-at-will state, meaning employers can fire people anytime and for any reason. But Briskman said what‚Äôs been particularly infuriating is that a male colleague kept his job after recently posting lewd comments on his Facebook page that featured Akima LLC as his cover photo. She said this colleague was reprimanded for calling someone ‚Äúa fucking Libtard asshole‚Äù on Facebook, but was allowed to delete the post and keep his job.

‚ÄúHow is that any less ‚Äòobscene‚Äô than me flipping off the president?‚Äù she asked. ‚ÄúHow is that fair?‚Äù

Akima did not respond to requests for comment via email and phone.

Juli Briskman Someone posted this graphic on Juli Briskman's Facebook page after she flipped off the president's motorcade. Briskman was amused.

Asked what she was thinking when she saw Trump‚Äôs motorcade roll up next to her, Briskman said it was a gut reaction to flip him off.

‚ÄúHe was passing by and my blood just started to boil,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking, DACA recipients are getting kicked out. He pulled ads for open enrollment in Obamacare. Only one-third of Puerto Rico has power. I‚Äôm thinking, he‚Äôs at the damn golf course again.‚Äù

‚ÄúI flipped off the motorcade a number of times,‚Äù she added.

Briskman, a Democrat, said she plans to look for a new job with an advocacy group that she believes in, like Planned Parenthood or PETA.

Despite getting fired, she said she has no regrets about the attention her public show of displeasure with Trump received. In fact, she said she‚Äôs happy to be an image of protest that resonates with many Americans.

‚ÄúIn some ways, I‚Äôm doing better than ever,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm angry about where our country is right now. I am appalled. This was an opportunity for me to say something.‚Äù

UPDATE: 11:54 a.m. Monday ‚Äï Akima‚Äôs website went down later Monday. Here‚Äôs a screenshot.
TITLE: Woman Fired For Flipping Off Donald Trump's Motorcade

SUMMARY:
Uber and NASA have unveiled a partnership that will see the two companies work together to create the software that will power these innovative new vehicles.
UberFor Uber, the focus has been on creating electric aircraft that can travel short distances at high speeds without causing any unwanted noise disturbance to the public below.
Earlier this year the company unveiled Uber Elevate, a project that would be focused on this very design.
UberWhile this partnership might make it sound like Uber is monopolising the industry the simple fact is that it‚Äôs going to have to work with its rivals to get the project off the ground.
With aircraft manufacturers like Airbus planning their own test flights the skies are going to get very crowded and sooner than you might think.
TEXT:
Uber and NASA have unveiled a partnership that will see the two companies work together to create the software that will power these innovative new vehicles. Acting in much the same was as conventional air traffic control systems, it would allow UberAir pilots safe routes throughout what would be very crowded airspace.

Uber

For Uber, the focus has been on creating electric aircraft that can travel short distances at high speeds without causing any unwanted noise disturbance to the public below. Earlier this year the company unveiled Uber Elevate, a project that would be focused on this very design. The company has already started employing ex-NASA engineers to help it create a working prototype and has even claimed that it plans to start high speed test flights over Los Angeles in 2020 alongside Dubai and Fort Worth.

Uber

While this partnership might make it sound like Uber is monopolising the industry the simple fact is that it‚Äôs going to have to work with its rivals to get the project off the ground. With aircraft manufacturers like Airbus planning their own test flights the skies are going to get very crowded and sooner than you might think. Taking this into account the software will need to be universally available or at least compatible with competitors and will need to take into account the already busy airspace that‚Äôs in place.
TITLE: NASA And Uber Announce Flying Taxi Partnership

SUMMARY:
HuffPost Australia understands the option to recall parliament just days before Christmas is now being seriously canvassed by Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.
It is likely the day or days would be used to send referrals for citizenship determination to the High Court.
That's before High Court.
PM Turnbull describes Labor MP's Justine Keay's situation as "a real issue".
Love it or leave it üá¶üá∫üá¶üá∫üá¶üá∫ https://t.co/swSAmc33CX ‚Äî Alice Workman (@workmanalice) November 8, 2017But Shorten said he is not about to take legal advice from the prime minister.
TEXT:
HuffPost Australia understands the option to recall parliament just days before Christmas is now being seriously canvassed by Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.

CANBERRA -- Clarity and clear air are in short supply in Canberra.

As the prime minister and opposition leader meet on Wednesday in an attempt to get an bipartisan deal on the rules and time-frame for citizenship declarations, the whole citizenship debacle has managed to get even messier.

The cases of Labor MPs Justine Keay and Susan Lamb are again under review in the light of the strict reading of the High Court's decision in the citizenship seven case, while the case of Liberal MP John Alexander remains unresolved and he has indicated he may not have to comply until late December.

.@TurnbullMalcolm: I am committed to disclosures being presented to parliament by the end of the year. MORE: https://t.co/xkMjROsmnc pic.twitter.com/K9nQHCCoD2 ‚Äî Sky News Australia (@SkyNewsAust) November 8, 2017

And Turnbull Government minister Josh Frydenberg is still checking out his own personal circumstances.

But there appears to be some room emerging to sort it all out.

After hearing that MPs were being warned that federal parliament may have to sit for an extra week in 2017, HuffPost Australia understands the option to recall parliament just days before Christmas is now being seriously canvassed by Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.

It could be a day, or a week, of pure citizenship resolution if needed and fits in with the PM's current plan to get all federal politicians to publicly declare their citizenship history within 21 days of the individual houses of Parliament passing a resolution on the matter.

It is likely the day or days would be used to send referrals for citizenship determination to the High Court.

Recalling Parliament for one day likely to cost $2 million. That's before High Court. Precedent: taxpayers pick up tab for MPs @SkyNewsAust https://t.co/JNioGEOLER ‚Äî Samantha Maiden (@samanthamaiden) November 8, 2017

Will the PM's declaration plan remain at 21 days for disclosure? Not if Labor leader Bill Shorten has anything to do with it. Labor also wants details of the birth and citizenship of grandparents added to the details of parents in the declaration.

The opposition has stated it is willing to work with the PM on an alternative to a much called for audit, but Labor's senate leader Penny Wong sees the proposed time-frame as a "blatant attempt to skate through this difficult period to next year".

While described by both Turnbull and Shorten as "constructive," there's been no agreement between the prime minister and opposition leader after a two hour meeting in Melbourne on Wednesday.

PM Turnbull describes Labor MP's Justine Keay's situation as "a real issue". #Citizenship Karen Barlow (@KJBar) November 8, 2017

Shorten is proposing a December 1 deadline.

"This crisis, unfortunately, needs to be dealt with immediately," he told reporters.

"The High Court set a higher test of us. Labor is not going to support watering down the High Court decisions to help a few MPs scrape back into parliament."

Turnbull realises the need for urgency, but has not given ground on the time-fram.

"We await some further thoughts from the Leader of the Opposition but I do think it is important to get on with it," Turnbull told reporters after the meeting.

"We are certainly agreed on the need for disclosure and of the kind that I've set out in the resolution and we're also agreed that the matter must be dealt with before the end of the year. By that, I mean that the disclosures should be made before the end of the year and the house and the Senate should have the opportunity, having considered those disclosures, whether any members or senators should be referred to the High Court."

The opposition may have its own problems.

Labor colleagues, including Shorten, have on Wednesday pronounced confidence in the citizenship status of MPs Keay and Lamb but previous statements showing the Labor MPs relying on "reasonable steps" to renounce foreign citizenship which were shown in the October verdicts as not being enough.

The Guardian has reviewed Keay's pronouncement on social media in August to find she admitted her renunciation of British citizenship was not effective until after the 2016 election but insisted she and Lamb are relying on "reasonable steps" to renounce foreign citizenship.

In particular, Keay posted she had applied to renounce British citizenship in May 2016 and had therefore "taken all reasonable steps," thus satisfying the "test set out by the High Court in the landmark case Sykes vs Cleary".

The nomination date for the election was 9 June 2016, but Keay admits the official date of renunciation was 11 July 2016.

Considering the black letter reading of Section 44 (i) of the Constitution, which knocked out the deputy prime minister and four senators (plus Stephen Parry, although his case has not gone to the High Court), the High Court appears to have lifted the bar.

Turnbull described Keay's situation on Wednesday as a "real issue" that's "going to involve some considerable legal debate."

"I think the High Court's been very clear on the matter in the recent decision," he said. "It is a very tough, very literal decision that's been taken. We have to comply with it."

Love it or leave it üá¶üá∫üá¶üá∫üá¶üá∫ https://t.co/swSAmc33CX ‚Äî Alice Workman (@workmanalice) November 8, 2017

But Shorten said he is not about to take legal advice from the prime minister.

"He got it so wrong with his own ministers, his own Deputy Prime Minister and now the President of the Senate, a Liberal appointee," he said. "I am confident Labor has pretty exhaustive vetting procedures and I'm confident steps have been taken, yes."

Lamb states she renounced British citizenship in May 2016, but has refused to answer questions about when her renunciation was confirmed.

Meanwhile Alexander is digging in while attempting to clarify his citizenship status with the British Home Office.

Alexander indicated to Seven News on Tuesday he may not let us all know what his citizenship status is until late December. Essentially he is keen to wait for the 21 days, proposed by the PM, after the House passes a resolution on declarations.

'Protection racket': Labor calls for John Alexander to be sent to High Court https://t.co/U8AZo5g8C5 via @smh ‚Äî Hadda Gutfull (@mavsmum) November 8, 2017

Remember this is a proposal that has not been approved yet, but he said, "what I am doing is going to comply with what the Prime Minister has put forward and we will see what comes from that".

Labor wants him immediately referred to the High Court.

Meanwhile Frydenberg is also seeking further advice on his case.

He states he has paperwork that his Jewish mother, born in Budapest, arrived in Australia in 1950 after the second world war as a stateless refugee, but is now rechecking whether Hungary has belated bestowed citizenship on him as an act of restitution.
TITLE: Malcolm Turnbull's Nuclear Option To Handle The Citizenship Mess: Recall Parliament Before Christmas

SUMMARY:
The annual Global Gender Gap Report from the World Economic Forum, published Thursday, makes for more bleak reading to accompany the sexual abuse and harassment scandals plaguing numerous industries and governments.
The top 10 countries for gender equality are predominantly European, with four northern European nations in the top five.
However, gender equality does appear to promote better economic performance, according to numerous studies.
For the U.S. in particular, the WEF index cites a study that economic parity could add $1.7 trillion to the country‚Äôs GDP.
Despair shouldn‚Äôt be the main takeaway from the index, WEF insisted.
TEXT:
Women will have to wait more than two centuries ‚Äï 217 years ‚Äï to have the same job and wage opportunities as men around the world, new data suggests.

The annual Global Gender Gap Report from the World Economic Forum, published Thursday, makes for more bleak reading to accompany the sexual abuse and harassment scandals plaguing numerous industries and governments.

The survey of 144 countries finds that as a whole, gender equality has worsened globally for the first time since WEF first produced its index in 2006. While income levels are rising, women are not sharing equally in the benefits, even in the most affluent countries.

‚ÄúThere seems to be a slowdown in momentum when it comes to proactive measures being taken to address gender gaps, particularly in the workplace,‚Äù said Vesselina Stefanova Ratcheva, an economist at WEF.

The index measures how opportunities and participation differ for men and women across four key areas: health, education, economy and politics. The most challenging gaps are in economy and politics, according to the report.

The U.S. saw its ranking drop from 45th last year to 49th this year, mostly due to a lack of women in U.S. politics. Men hold nearly 81 percent of the seats in Congress and make up the majority of mayors and governors.

The top 10 countries for gender equality are predominantly European, with four northern European nations in the top five. Iceland is in the top position for the ninth year in a row, followed by Norway and Finland.

World Economic Forum

But it‚Äôs not just European countries that scored highly; the top 10 also included Rwanda and Nicaragua. These economies are ‚Äúputting in place more gender-equal opportunities regardless of their level of economic development,‚Äù said Stefanova Ratcheva.

None of the big powerhouse economies of the G-20 made it into the top 10, ‚Äúshowing that economic power is not necessarily a recipe for better equality between the sexes,‚Äù according to WEF.

However, gender equality does appear to promote better economic performance, according to numerous studies. A McKinsey Global Institute analysis estimated that more equality between the sexes would boost the global economy by $28 trillion. For the U.S. in particular, the WEF index cites a study that economic parity could add $1.7 trillion to the country‚Äôs GDP.

Despair shouldn‚Äôt be the main takeaway from the index, WEF insisted. ‚ÄúIt is important to note that while the global picture is bleak in 2017, there have been some clear signs of progress in the past decade,‚Äù said Stefanova Ratcheva.

The gender gap in education could be closed within the next 13 years, says WEF. And there are some standout countries that have made rapid improvements ‚Äï including Canada, which climbed 19 places for women‚Äôs progress in politics and wages.

‚ÄúWhat is needed is new energy and commitment at the leader level ‚Äï in business as well as political leadership ‚Äï to put these into effect,‚Äù said Stefanova Ratcheva.

As Paul Polman, CEO of consumer goods giant Unilever, wrote for HuffPost, ‚ÄúIt is our moral responsibility as today‚Äôs leaders ... to further advance the lives of women and girls everywhere, and reverse the widening gap.‚Äù
TITLE: Bleak New Data Show Just How Long Women Around The World Will Be Waiting For Equal Pay

SUMMARY:
There's now an excuse to get extra silly this silly season and it comes in the form of a gin advent calendar.
Yes, you read that correctly -- an advent calendar that has ousted chocolate and brought in the gin.
The Advent Season Traditionally, advent is the season before Christmas during which Christians prepare for the coming of Christ.
Of course, the Advent season is celebrated by many people, religious or not.
The Australian Gin Advent Calendar is available for purchase via the Gintonica website, however they can only be shipped to locations within Australia.
TEXT:
There's now an excuse to get extra silly this silly season and it comes in the form of a gin advent calendar.

Yes, you read that correctly -- an advent calendar that has ousted chocolate and brought in the gin.

The people at Gintonica created the calendar which includes 24 different types of Australian craft gin ready to try each day of December. The various gins come from five different Australian states and represent 21 distillers. The bottles are 50 millilitres in size.

The calendar also includes serving suggestions and tasting notes from the distillers and a few gin cocktail recipes.

The Advent Season Traditionally, advent is the season before Christmas during which Christians prepare for the coming of Christ. The name 'Advent' itself comes from the Latin word 'adventus' which means 'arrival'. The season includes the four Sundays before Christmas and is observed using a wreath with four candles -- one candle for each week in the season. Each Sunday, a new candle is lit as Christmas approaches. Of course, the Advent season is celebrated by many people, religious or not. Advent calendars are often the highlight of this time for children, as they can eat a little chocolate each day. All over the world, Christmas markets pop-up in town squares and main streets, decorations appear and trees go up. In the warmer weather, many Aussies choose to check out the light displays in their local areas, or to travel a little further afield and visit some of the more extravagant houses. For most of us, Advent is a time to catch up with family and friends and attend Christmas parties among the mad dash from store to store to get that Christmas shopping done.

The Australian Gin Advent Calendar is available for purchase via the Gintonica website, however they can only be shipped to locations within Australia. Orders will be shipped before December 1, so you won't need to play catch up once the final month of 2017 ticks around.

Chocolate, step aside.

The calendar retails for $295 and over 70 percent of the stock has already been sold.
TITLE: This Gin Advent Calendar Is The Perfect Tonic For Anyone Sick Of Chocolate

Wegen ihrer gescheiterten Klimapolitik vergleicht ‚ÄúDie Zeit‚Äù Merkel gar mit Donald Trump. ‚ÄúMerkel betreibt eine klimafeindliche Politik‚Äù, urteilt die Wochenzeitung.

Aber im Gegensatz zur Kanzlerin sei der US-Pr√§sident wenigstens ehrlich und zeige offen, dass ihm das Klima egal ist.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: "Deutschland hat ein schmutziges Geheimnis": TV-Sender CNN macht Merkel schwere Vorw√ºrfe

Gr√ºnde f√ºr Deutschlands Versagen beim Klimaschutz gibt es viele: Die schleppende Verkehrswende, das gedrosselte Tempo beim Ausbau der erneuerbaren Energien, die Stagnation beim Umbau der W√§rmeversorgung.

Aber das Scheitern der Kanzlerin wird nirgendwo deutlicher als im Bereich der Kohleenergie.

Zum Hintergrund:

‚ñ∫ In Deutschland stehen die schmutzigsten Kohlemeiler Europas.

‚ñ∫ Fast die H√§lfte des klimasch√§dlichen CO2-Aussto√ües in Deutschland geht auf das Konto des Energiesektors.

‚ñ∫ Im Energiesektor verursachen Kohlekraftwerke wiederum den Gro√üteil der Klimagase.

‚ñ∫ Deutschland f√∂rdert mehr der besonders schmutzigen Braunkohle als jede andere Land der Welt (China und Indien f√∂rdern vor allem Steinkohle).

Angela Merkel kennt all diese Zahlen. Und als Physikerin wei√ü sie zu gut, was Kohlekraftwerke mit dem Klima anrichten. Aber ebenso wie schmutzige Dieselautos stellt die Kanzlerin die Kohle unter Artenschutz.

Die Frage ist: Warum? Die wahrscheinlichste Antwort lautet: Weil sich daraus bisher politisch kein Kapital schlagen l√§sst.

Kohleausstieg wird in einer Jamaika-Koalition kaum zu machen sein

Im Jahr 2010 blockierte Merkel ein fr√ºhzeitiges Ende der Subventionen f√ºr deutsche Kohlekraftwerke, die die EU durchsetzen wollte.

2013 hie√ü es im Koalitionsvertrag noch, dass die Kohleverbrennung ‚Äúauf absehbare Zeit unverzichtbar‚Äù sei. Dann versuchte Merkel sich an einer Kohlewende - die sie aber nie durchzog.

Im Fr√ºhjahr 2015 hatte die Kanzlerin noch Zustimmung f√ºr einen langsamen Kohleausstieg in Deutschland signalisiert - organisieren wollte ihn ihr damaliger Wirtschaftsminister Sigmar Gabriel (SPD).

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Klimaschutz: Wer nicht mitmacht, den bestraft das Leben

Doch nachdem sich die Ministerpr√§sidenten von Sachsen, Brandenburg und Sachsen-Anhalt und ranghohe Parteimitglieder gegen den Plan aussprachen, beerdigte Merkel die Idee.

Zwar hatte die Kanzlerin auch im Wahlkampf vorsichtige Zustimmung zu einem Ausstieg aus der Braunkohle signalisiert. Im Sommerinterview hatte sie erkl√§rt, man k√∂nne einen Braunkohleausstieg ‚Äúins Auge fassen‚Äù, wenn es Pl√§ne f√ºr die Zukunft der Besch√§ftigten in der Kohleindustrie gebe.

Doch f√ºr einen Kohleausstieg k√§mpfen nun die Gr√ºnen in den Jamaika-Verhandlungen allein. Von einer Unterst√ºtzung der Kanzlerin f√ºr ihre Pl√§ne ist bisher nichts an die √ñffentlichkeit gedrungen. An der Frage des Klimaschutzes drohen nun sogar die Verhandlungen f√ºr eine Jamaika-Koalition zu scheitern.

Dabei dr√§ngt die Zeit. Denn je l√§nger die schmutzigen Kohlekraftwerke am Netz sind, desto schwieriger wird es f√ºr Deutschland, seine Klimaziele zu erreichen.

Sogar China verabschiedet sich von der Kohle

Und w√§hrend Deutschland noch z√∂gert, gehen andere L√§nder voran.

Unter anderem haben Norwegen und Gro√übritannien den vollst√§ndigen Kohleausstieg beschlossen. Selbst Kohlegro√üverbraucher wie Indien und China haben zuletzt die Kraftwerks√∂fen gedrosselt.

China schickt sich an, bei der Kohlepolitik sogar zum Vorbild zu werden: 1,3 Millionen Jobs sollen in dem Sektor in den kommenden Jahren laut der Regierung wegfallen. Neue Arbeitspl√§tze sollen daf√ºr im Bereich der erneuerbaren Energien entstehen. Schon jetzt arbeiten rund 2,5 Millionen Menschen in der chinesischen Solarindustrie.

In Deutschland gehen Arbeitspl√§tze bei den Erneuerbaren verloren

In Deutschland verl√§uft die Entwicklung genau umgekehrt. 2015 waren rund 330.000 Menschen direkt oder indirekt durch den Ausbau der erneuerbaren Energien besch√§ftigt. Die Zahl sank aber zuletzt deutlich.

Im Vergleich dazu sind die Besch√§ftigtenzahlen in der Kohleindustrie gering. Je nachdem auf welche Statistik man blickt, besch√§ftigt die Braunkohleindustrie in Deutschland direkt und indirekt zwischen 20.000 und 50.000 Menschen. Im Bereich der Steinkohle sind in Deutschland gerade einmal noch rund 7500 Menschen besch√§ftigt.

Sicher ist: Die Kohleenergie muss fr√ºher oder sp√§ter ohnehin aus dem Energiemix verschwinden. Warum dann nicht mit dem Ausstieg jetzt schon beginnen und Angestellte langsam umschulen und in anderen Bereich unterbringen?

Deutsche sind mehrheitlich f√ºr Kohleausstieg

Merkels Z√∂gern beim Kohleausstieg ist inzwischen sogar zu einem Hemmnis f√ºr die Energiewende an sich geworden, einst ein Vorzeigeprojekt Deutschlands: Es macht die Energiewende komplizierter und teurer als n√∂tig.

Denn Kohlekraftwerke und vergleichsweise saubere Energielieferanten vertragen sich schlecht. Vereinfacht gesagt: Kohlekraftwerke produzieren kontinuierlich Strom. Das klingt erst einmal gut. Aber damit blockiert die Kohle die Netze f√ºr Wind- und Solarstrom, denn Kohlekraftwerke k√∂nnen die Produktion nur langsam drosseln.

Geeigneter um im Verbund mit Wind und Sonne Strom zu liefern sind dynamische Gaskraftwerke.

Die Folge: Solange viele Kohlekraftwerke am Netz sind, muss der Umbau des Energiesystems zu einer sauberen Versorgung gedrosselt werden. Deutschland verspielt damit die Chance wenigstens nach 2020 seine Klimaziele zu erreichen.

Und noch ein weiteres Argument der Kohlebef√ºrworter z√§hlt nicht: Der Preis. Inzwischen ist Strom aus Windr√§dern √§hnlich g√ºnstig wie Strom aus Kohlekraftwerken. In den kommenden Jahren wird Windstrom sogar billiger als schmutziger Kohlestrom.

Ein Plan f√ºr den Ausstieg aus der Kohle ist also aus mehreren Gr√ºnden l√§ngst √ºberf√§llig. Das findet auch eine Mehrheit der Deutschen. Nach einer Emnid-Umfrage f√ºr die ‚ÄúBild am Sonntag‚Äù sind 59 Prozent der Deutschen daf√ºr, dass die n√§chste Bundesregierung den Kohleausstieg beschlie√üt, und 31 Prozent dagegen.

Eigentlich ist Angela Merkel bekannt daf√ºr ihre Entscheidungen stark an Umfragen zu orientieren. Beim Kohleausstieg ist davon allerdings noch nichts zu merken.

(lp)
TITLE: Rabenschwarze Bilanz: Wie Angela Merkel beim Klimaschutz versagt hat

SUMMARY:
If you‚Äôre a mum-to-be soon to give birth or are tired of brushing off questions from your kids about the whole shebang, this video could be just what you need.
Liz Chalmers, a childbirth educator from Seattle, US, has shared a simple yet accurate demonstration of how birth works using just a balloon and a ball.
Chalmers, who said she learned the idea from a class she went to, was filming it for her niece, Charlotte, who was also about to become a childbirth educator.
She explains exactly what happens when a baby is born, all while making it really easy to understand with the two simple props.

SUMMARY:
Da una parte un pontefice anziano che non festeggia, semmai ripudia il matrimonio centenario tra Chiesa e democrazie cristiane.
Dall'altra il prototipo di un principe azzurro che invece le corteggia, le conquista e fa sue in una sera d'autunno.
E attendere fiduciosi che il Signore faccia il resto.
Il Papa del resto parlava di fronte a un'assemblea di separati in casa, pastori di una Chiesa divisa e percorsa, essa stessa, da una frattura.
Frontiera di una Brexit profonda, interiore, tra l'Est e l'Ovest dell'Europa.
TEXT:
Valzer viennese o tango argentino? Danubio blu o Rio de La Plata, in quale direzione danza e scorre il futuro dell'Europa? Tra Jorge Bergoglio, classe 1936, e il leader dei popolari austriaci Sebastian Kurz, classe 1986 e prossimo a diventare il pi√π giovane capo di governo al mondo, passano mezzo secolo anagrafico e un intero pianeta geopolitico.

Da una parte un pontefice anziano che non festeggia, semmai ripudia il matrimonio centenario tra Chiesa e democrazie cristiane. Dall'altra il prototipo di un principe azzurro che invece le corteggia, le conquista e fa sue in una sera d'autunno. Aitante e andante, ma non troppo. Adagio e rassicurante quanto basta per non sembrare banalmente, brutalmente populista. Distanziandosi dal magiaro Victor Orb√°n e al tempo stesso avvicinandosi a lui, a occupare l'altro lato del trattino che compone, anzi ricompone l'Austria ‚Äì Ungheria, nel centenario della sua dissoluzione. Operando una mutazione genetica e spostando a destra in modo soft, ineffabile ma ineluttabile, Dna e centri gravitazionali del cattolicesimo sociale. Snaturandolo dolcemente ma irreversibilmente, a ritmo di valzer appunto. Attirando le pubbliche opinioni alla stregua di vergini evangeliche, frementi ed incuranti che alle lampade manchi l'olio, al bivio della notte che incombe sul continente, tra ritorno del Novecento e alba della globalit√†.

Ci sono date che saldano pezzi di storia e storie a pezzi.

Da un lato le nuove Dc, viso d'angelo e mano energica, nel format modaiolo e fascinante dell'asburgico Kurz o liturgico e penitenziale della polacca Beata Szyd≈Ço, che aggiornano e agitano vessilli e allori, sull'onda montante dei sondaggi a favore. Dall'altro la barca di Pietro che in una mattina di giugno ammaina e archivia di converso lo scudo crociato. Pronunziando il verbo inaudito e buttando a fiume letteralmente, mediante parole che pesano come macigni, non solo i partiti, ma le "istituzioni cattoliche" tout azimut, "banche, cooperative, circoli, sindacati, scuole", passate in rassegna e bollate di "attivismo separatista" dal Pontefice: "... senza volerlo, si costruiscono barriere che rischiano di diventare insormontabili all'emergere della domanda di fede. Si tende ad affermare ci√≤ che divide rispetto a quello che unisce. √à un metodo che non facilita l'evangelizzazione, chiude porte e genera diffidenza".

Cos√¨, sulla sponda dell'Oglio, dal guado padano di Don Mazzolari, al culmine di un viaggio apparentemente italiano, ma in realt√† internazionale, Bergoglio ha tratto il dado e mollato gli ormeggi del potere temporale, con i suoi approdi sicuri, per inoltrarsi nel mare aperto della globalizzazione: un oceano che ai Vicari di Cristo non offre porti e punti di riferimento, ma promette in cambio un lasciapassare per la Cina, sogno proibito di ogni Papa, dove si giocano i destini del XXI secolo. A condizione per√≤ di spogliarsi e sciogliersi a mo' di lievito, senza pretese identitarie. E attendere fiduciosi che il Signore faccia il resto.

Se non fosse tuttavia che a difesa dell'identit√† e dei suoi confini stavano nella ricorrenza di Lepanto un milione di rosari, schierati dal Baltico alla Vistola e per nulla intenzionati a levare l'ancora. Un muro spirituale o diga d'anime che emerge e si erge tra due cristianesimi, opposti e inconciliabili.

E se il Pontefice, determinato nel suo strappo, tira dritto e non mostra misericordia nei riguardi delle democrazie cristiane, queste ultime non la praticano, a loro volta, nei confronti dei "profughi" di ogni genere, dai migranti a Puigdemont, ignorando l'insegnamento del Papa e mettendo a dura prova l'impianto e gli ammortizzatori dell'edificio comunitario.

Seppure in contesti assai diversi, dall'astro in declino di Mariano Rajoy a quello nascente di Sebastian Kurz, l'assenza di "misericordia" √® il dato che accomuna i governi austriaco e ispanico, un d√¨ riconducibili sotto un unico scettro, e marca un ulteriore slittamento a destra dei popolari europei, estraniandoli viepi√π dal sentire di Bergoglio, vistosamente orientato in altra direzione.

Una deriva che non risparmia nemmeno la corazzata Cdu di Angela Merkel, ammiraglia della flotta, con la sua stazza elettorale, dopo i siluri euroscettici e lo squarcio nello scafo delle legislative di settembre, con la perdita dell'8 per cento dei consensi.

Sicch√©, adesso pi√π che mai, l'Europa costituisce il rompicapo di Francesco. Il puzzle che in luogo di completarsi si disgrega, nell'orizzonte degli anni che avanzano. Lo spazio che si prende la rivincita sul tempo e smentisce, rovesciandolo, l'intero assunto della sua geopolitica. E lo fa in modo beffardo, nella staffetta tra il 2017 e il 2018: saltando bruscamente dal cinquantesimo dei Trattati di Roma, celebrato in sordina e gi√† derubricato nella memoria, direttamente al centenario della fine della Grande Guerra, sonoramente amplificato al contrario e autenticato dalla storia, in un big bang di nostalgie e geografie.

Se il primo non √® riuscito a scaldare i cuori, l'altro gela sin d'ora i pensieri, mentre a Ovest tramontano le nazioni - Spagna oggi, Gran Bretagna domani - e ad Est rinascono gli imperi, russo e austro-ungarico, nelle sembianze del Gruppo di Visegrad, allargato e arroccato a Vienna.

√à questo l'incubo del Papa perito chimico, di fronte alla miscela esplosiva di referendum e ultimatum, pronunciamenti e commissariamenti, ordinanze e latitanze.

Motivo che in cerca di una improbabile quanto improrogabile risurrezione lo ha indotto dal 27 al 29 ottobre a riunire a Roma, per tre giorni canonici, tra un Venerd√¨ a Domenica, ecclesiastici e laici, accademici e politici dei ventotto paesi Ue. Tracciando nel suo intervento un excursus di alto profilo, da San Benedetto ai nostri giorni, ma omettendo di scendere al suolo dei problemi che scottano, sul tema scivoloso e impellente della Catalogna. Finendo per consegnare alle cronache, suo malgrado, l'immagine silente della Sede Apostolica, toccata e contagiata dalla sindrome immobilista di Bruxelles.

Il Papa del resto parlava di fronte a un'assemblea di separati in casa, pastori di una Chiesa divisa e percorsa, essa stessa, da una frattura.

In forma di geometria unificante, Bergoglio ha provato a esibire un classico e costruire l'incontro sull'asse Germania - Inghilterra, affidandosi a un presule britannico e a un cardinale teutonico. Un mix delle due vocazioni centripeta e centrifuga, conflittuali e sempre attuali del continente. Il ministro degli esteri vaticano Paul Richard Gallagher, nativo di Liverpool e conterraneo dei Beatles, con trascorsi a Strasburgo e un pedigree anti-Brexit. E l'arcivescovo di Monaco di Baviera Reinhard Marx, figlio di un sindacalista e presidente del Comece, l'organismo che raccorda le conferenze episcopali dell'Unione. Socialdemocrazia e pop, verrebbe da dire, con i loro sapori d'annata e linguaggi elaborati, nell'era del rap e degli odierni guru, barbari e digitali, che semplificano i messaggi e cavalcano leggiadri l'umore degli elettori, a colpi di slogan e giaculatorie.

Poich√© la scossa questa volta non viene dalla Manica, bens√¨ dalle rive del Danubio: linea di faglia tra i due cristianesimi, egalitario e identitario. Frontiera di una Brexit profonda, interiore, tra l'Est e l'Ovest dell'Europa. Una trincea dell'anima che appare in prospettiva pi√π deleteria, incisiva e seria del muro di Berlino: e al cui cospetto le diatribe fra Londra e Bruxelles vengono declassate a beghe da cortile.

Ne consegue uno scisma strisciante di tipo culturale, non dottrinale. Politico non dogmatico. Nessuna eresia, quindi, ma piuttosto una epidemia che ha ormai raggiunto il Brennero e all'indomani del voto austro-tedesco rende la "penisola" ultima spiaggia del Pontefice argentino, per non rimanere "isolato".

Cornice paradossale in cui l'Italia eternamente democristiana, nelle diverse, variegate metamorfosi, berlusconiane o bertinottiane, renziane o pentastellate del suo imprinting, diventa il retroterra strategico del Papa postdemocristiano. Presidio e zona franca di un pontificato proteso con successo verso il Sud e l'Oriente, ma sempre pi√π distante in compenso dal Nord e l'Occidente.

Una "addizionale vaticana" che la classe dirigente di per s√© non appare in grado di sostenere, sulla carta, forse neppure di comprendere, ma che la storia inesorabile mette in conto, caricando le elezioni di primavera di una valenza geopolitica che le sprovincializza e le universalizza, tra proiezioni e profezie, alleanze divine e coalizioni terrene, successori di Pietro e convitati di pietra.
TITLE: Il divorzio tra Papa Francesco e le democrazie cristiane d‚ÄôEuropa, da Rajoy a Kurz

SUMMARY:
Don't let the warm weather this fall fool you ‚Äî flu season is arriving right on time.
With that in mind, here are five things you should know about the 2017-2018 flu season :1.
Australia was hit hard by the flu this yearEach year, experts look to Australia's flu season (which occurs during their winter, between May and October) to get an idea of what our flu season might be like.
So, even if you got a flu shot last year, it won't be effective against the flu strains circulating this year.
It's important to note, though, that it takes two weeks for the flu shot to work.
TEXT:
Written by Sybil Millar, Communications Advisor for the Ross Tilley Burn Centre, Critical Care and Infectious Diseases programs at Sunnybrook.

Don't let the warm weather this fall fool you ‚Äî flu season is arriving right on time. In fact, it arrived a bit earlier than usual this year.

"While flu season can happen anytime between October and April, it seemed to start earlier in Ontario this year," says Dr. Andy Simor, head, department of microbiology and infectious diseases consultant at Sunnybrook.

With that in mind, here are five things you should know about the 2017-2018 flu season :

1. Australia was hit hard by the flu this year

Each year, experts look to Australia's flu season (which occurs during their winter, between May and October) to get an idea of what our flu season might be like. While the influenza (flu) vaccine match was good this year in Australia, the country saw a much higher number of cases than usual, resulting in an increased number of hospitalizations and deaths.

"If the experience of southern hemisphere is predictive, we're in for a more difficult flu season than usual," says Dr. Simor.

2. There's more than one flu strain circulating

There are usually several strains of the flu circulating each year. As a result, the flu vaccine is trivalent, which means the shot protects against three different strains. This year, those three strains are influenza A (H1N1), H3N2 (the prevalent strain that was seen in Australia) and B.

The World Health Organization (WHO) determines which strains to include in the flu vaccine every year. With input from experts around the world, the WHO tries to predict which virus will be the most dominant. As a result, the flu shot protects against different strains every year. So, even if you got a flu shot last year, it won't be effective against the flu strains circulating this year.

3. Getting the flu shot is safe and effective

The flu vaccine is safe and effective, particularly in preventing serious complications that may occur from the flu (such as pneumonia, which can become deadly for some people).

"The flu can cause severe illness, especially in the very young and the elderly. The most effective thing we can do to protect ourselves and others against the flu is to get the vaccine," says Dr. Simor.

4. You can't get sick from the flu vaccine

"The flu vaccine is made entirely of killed virus and cannot cause you to get sick," says Dr. Simor. Studies have found that symptoms occur just as often in people who get a placebo shot versus the real thing. However, you can definitely still get a sore arm!

It's important to note, though, that it takes two weeks for the flu shot to work. "If you get sick in those first two weeks, it's because you had already been infected or you weren't yet fully protected," says Dr. Simor.

5. Clean your hands to prevent the flu from spreading

While the flu vaccine is safe and effective, it's not perfect, and it doesn't provide a 100 per cent guarantee that you'll avoid getting sick.

This is why it's so important to take steps to prevent the spread of the flu, like cleaning your hands often. If you do get sick, don't go to work and try to stay away from crowded places so you don't pass the flu virus on to someone else.

"If you get the flu, you'll feel sick for five to seven days, and you're contagious for the first four days. It's important to limit your contact with other people during that time," says Dr. Simor.

Follow HuffPost Canada Blogs on Facebook

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Flu Season's Come Early This Year. Here's What You Need To Know

SUMMARY:
The Texas church shooter who killed dozens of people on Sunday once escaped from a behavioral health facility and made death threats to military officials, adding to a growing list of questions about why he was able to purchase a gun.
His mother-in-law sometimes attended the Sutherland Springs church, and one of the people he killed was his wife's grandmother.
Kelley was court-martialed in 2012 for assaulting his wife and stepson while serving at Holloman Air Force base in New Mexico.
He had been labeled a "danger to himself" and had "already been caught sneaking firearms onto Holloman Air Force base," the report continues.
(Research has shown that people who live with mental health issues are more likely to be a victim of a violent crime than to commit one.)
TEXT:
The Texas church shooter who killed dozens of people on Sunday once escaped from a behavioral health facility and made death threats to military officials, adding to a growing list of questions about why he was able to purchase a gun.

Devin Kelley, 26, killed 26 people and wounded 20 more when he stormed into First Baptist Church in Sutherland Springs with a semi-automatic Ruger AR-556, emptying 15 magazines that held upward of 30 rounds each, investigators said Tuesday.

Authorities have yet to determine a motive behind the massacre, but said they knew Kelley had been fighting with his current wife's family.

"He had expressed anger toward his mother-in-law," Freeman Martin, the regional director of the Texas Department of Public Safety, said on Monday. His mother-in-law sometimes attended the Sutherland Springs church, and one of the people he killed was his wife's grandmother.

Kelley was court-martialed in 2012 for assaulting his wife and stepson while serving at Holloman Air Force base in New Mexico. He also pointed a loaded gun at his then-wife, officials said. He was sentenced that November to 12 months' confinement and given the duty title of "prisoner," according to the New York Times.

Five months before his sentencing, Kelley escaped from Peak Behavioral Health Services in the state, where he had been placed for a "mental disorder," according to an El Paso police report first obtained by Click 2 Houston.

During the June 2012 incident, a ‚Ä≥[witness] advised officers that [Kelley] suffered from mental disorders and had plans to run from [the facility]," the report says. He had been labeled a "danger to himself" and had "already been caught sneaking firearms onto Holloman Air Force base," the report continues. It also says Kelley made death threats to military officials.

Kelley was found at a bus terminal, where he was released into the custody of Sunland Park Police. The Sunland Park police told local station WFAA that they did not have an arrest report or booking photo for Kelly at the time of his apprehension.

(Research has shown that people who live with mental health issues are more likely to be a victim of a violent crime than to commit one.)

The new revelation adds to the warning signs Kelley displayed before purchasing a firearm to carry out his deadly assault. Under the Lautenberg amendment, individuals who are convicted of a domestic violence misdemeanor are prohibited from owning or buying guns. But it appears the Air Force never entered Kelley's domestic violence offense into the federal database that gun sellers use to check the criminal history of potential buyers.

Academy Sports + Outdoors confirmed to HuffPost that Kelley purchased two firearms from the store after being approved by the National Instant Criminal Background Check System.

The gunman was found dead after Sunday's attack as he tried to flee in his car. An investigation into the shooting is ongoing.
TITLE: Texas Church Shooter Escaped From Behavioral Health Facility In 2012

SUMMARY:

Wie konnte das nur passieren?

Vor einem Jahr wurde Donald Trump zum US-Pr√§sidenten gew√§hlt

Der Religionswissenschaftler Reza Aslan hat nun eine ebenso ungew√∂hnliche wie √ºberzeugende Erkl√§rung: Trump handelte wie eine Sektenf√ºhrer

US-Pr√§sident Donald Trump. Am 7. November 2016 hielten das die meisten Experten und US-B√ºrger f√ºr ausgeschlossen. Einen Tag sp√§ter wurden sie eines Besseren belehrt.

Trumps Beliebtheitswerte sind seitdem auf ein historisch niedriges Niveau abgest√ºrzt, seine Politik wirkt nicht selten chaotisch, er selbst scheint oft politisch umherzuirren. Zudem steht der Vorwurf der L√ºge jeden Tag aufs Neue im Raum und auch die Russland-Aff√§re h√§ngt wie ein Damoklesschwert √ºber Trumps Pr√§sidentschaft.

Doch egal was Trump sagt, tweetet oder tut. Die Anh√§nger des Republikaners scheinen in einer anderen Welt zu leben. Was andere als Makel sehen, sehen sie beim 74-J√§hrigen als St√§rke. Er ist der Deal-Maker, seine Unberechenbarkeit gilt als sein gr√∂√ütes Ass. Trump sitzt bei seinen Fans ganz fest auf seinem Thron.

Der bekannte iranisch-amerikanische Religionswissenschaftler Reza Aslan hat f√ºr diese paradoxe Sicht eine ungew√∂hnliche wie √ºberzeugende Erkl√§rung: Trump ist der Guru, seine Anh√§nger Teil einer Sekte, die ihm schon zum Wahlsieg verhalf.

Wahlkampf wie ein Massengottesdienst

In einem Artikel f√ºr die "Los Angeles Times" begr√ºndet Aslan seine Behauptung:

"W√§hrend des Wahlkampfes und danach in pers√∂nlichen Auftritten nutzte Trump die Art von emotionaler Intensit√§t zu seinen Anh√§ngern, die eher typisch f√ºr einen religi√∂sen Massengottesdienst, als f√ºr eine politische Versammlung ist."

So habe es bei Trump ebenso "ritualisierte Ges√§nge" gegeben. Dazu z√§hlt der US-Forscher die fortw√§hrenden gegen die demokratische Rivalin Hillary Clinton gerichteten Sprechch√∂re "Lock her up!" ("Sperrt sie weg!").

Ausgewachsener Trump-Kult

Angesichts der wenig schmeichelhaften Bilanz und etlicher nicht eingel√∂ster Wahlversprechen ein Jahr nach der Wahl ist f√ºr Aslan klar: "Der Eifer einiger seiner Anh√§nger scheint immer mehr einem ausgewachsenen Kult zu √§hneln."

Wohlgemerkt: Aslan verwendet das Wort mit einer negativen Konnotation, bei der eine engstirnige soziale Gruppe sich einem "charismatischen F√ºhrer" in extremster Weise hingibt.

Denn Trump-Anh√§nger weisen einige gemeinsame Merkmale mit religi√∂sen Hardlinern auf:

‚ñ∫ Die Gruppe bildet sich um eine Person, der ein prophetischer und fast g√∂ttlicher Status zugeschrieben wird. "Trump war spektakul√§r erfolgreich seine Unterst√ºtzer dazu zu bewegen, seinen Liebkosungen und nicht ihren eigenen Augen zu glauben", schreibt Aslan.

Auch einige f√ºhrende christliche Unterst√ºtzer wiesen Trump besondere F√§higkeiten zu. So soll er im direkten Kontakt mit Gott stehen.

‚ñ∫ Des Weiteren n√§hren sich die Kompetenzen eines Sektenf√ºhrers davon, dass er sich als einzig wahre Informationsquelle geriert. Aslan bemerkt mit Blick auf Trump: Konkurrierende Ideen und Fakten werden nicht nur als falsch dargestellt, "sie sind d√§monisch".

Der US-Pr√§sident attackiert in regelm√§√üigen Abst√§nden unliebsame und kritische Medienh√§user, bezichtigt sie der Verbreitung von "Fake News".

With all of the Fake News coming out of NBC and the Networks, at what point is it appropriate to challenge their License? Bad for country! ‚Äî Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) 11. Oktober 2017

Journalisten sind f√ºr Trump "L√ºgner" und "kranke Leute", die "uns unsere Geschichte und unser Erbe wegnehmen wollen".

Eine gemeinsame Umfrage der US-HuffPost und des Umfrageinstitutes YouGov-Umfrage zeigte, dass auch Trumps Anh√§nger √§hnlich denken: 60 Prozent bezeichneten die Medien als "Feind".

Nur Trump k√∂nne das Land retten

‚ñ∫ Zugleich scheint den Trump-Anh√§ngern egal, welche Beschuldigungen ihn treffen. Anders als beim Missbrauchsskandal um Hollywood-Produzent Harvey Weinstein, halten mehr als die H√§lfte der Unterst√ºtzer des US-Pr√§sidenten √§hnliche Vorw√ºrfe gegen Trump f√ºr "nicht glaubhaft".

"Einer der Wege, wie ein Sektenf√ºhrer seine unbestrittene Autorit√§t beh√§lt, ist, eine Belagerungsmentalit√§t unter seinen Anh√§ngern zu schaffen und sich als Gegenpol zu pr√§sentieren", erkl√§rt Aslan.

Denn glaubt man Trump, dann sei die USA ein dahinsichendes Land, in dem Islamisten und Migranten das Gewaltmonopol des Staates l√§ngst √ºbernommen h√§tten. Jeder Gewaltakt, wie j√ºngst in New York, scheint das Weltbild zu best√§tigen. Rassistische Ausf√§lle wie in Charlottesville werden dagegen umgedeutet.

Mantraartig wiederholte Trump deshalb schon w√§hrend des Wahlkampfes: "Ich alleine kann es reparieren."

"Ich k√∂nnte jemanden erschie√üen - und w√ºrde keine W√§hler verlieren"

Aslan zeichnet in seinem Beitrag ein d√ºsteres Bild. "Kultmitglieder neigen dazu zu glauben, dass sie an einer kosmischen Leistung teilnehmen, dass sie an einem Kampf zwischen Gut und B√∂se teilnehmen."

Egal was passiert, es scheint, dass eine fast zwei jahre alte Prophezeiung Trumps Wirklichkeit geworden ist. Der jetzige US-Pr√§sident erkl√§rte im Januar 2016:

"Ich k√∂nnte mitten auf der 5th Avenue (im Zentrum Manhattans) stehen und jemanden erschie√üen - und w√ºrde trotzdem keine W√§hler verlieren."

Das Problem: Wenn der "gute" Trump nicht gewinnt und das L√ºgen- und Phantasiegebilde des Sektenf√ºhres tats√§chlich zusammenbrechen droht, k√∂nnten die Anh√§nger gewaltt√§tig werden.

So erkl√§rte Trump-Berater Roger Stone im August: Jeder Versuch, den Pr√§sidenten aus dem Amt zu entfernen, w√ºrde in "diesem Land in einen Gewaltkrampf, einen Aufstand, enden, wie Sie ihn noch nie gesehen haben".

Das US-Magazin "Newsdesk" ist sich sicher: Bereits Aslans Theorie wird "Zorn provozieren".
TITLE: "Der Sektenf√ºhrer": US-Religionsforscher erkl√§rt, wie Trump Pr√§sident werden konnte - und warum er noch immer regiert
