SUMMARY:
Health and well-being is not only about having health care services available, but is about ensuring that all people lead a socially and economically productive life.
Policy debates in the past have often revolved around the supply side of health care, and the availability of health care facilities.
For example, this is reflected in the emphasis of international efforts on increasing the number of health care facilities, along with a focus on childbirth at the facilities.
"Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels" SDG 16 target 16.7Citizens can identify the root causes of health problems and barriers to health care access.
She is currently working as a Program Management Officer with the International Development Research Centre's Think Tank Initiatives.
TEXT:
Written by Sunisha Neupane

Article originally published on September 21, 2017 at Think Tank Initiative

Bringing the perspectives of citizens, including the most marginalized, into health policy processes remains a challenge. Doing so requires great effort and patience, and it can be a long and difficult road, but one that will lead to transformative change as well as bring health for all.

First of all, what is health for all? In simple words, it means to bring health and well-being to everyone regardless of where they live, and which ethnicity, group, caste or social status they belong to. Health and well-being is not only about having health care services available, but is about ensuring that all people lead a socially and economically productive life. Health for all is an aspiration.

Policy debates in the past have often revolved around the supply side of health care, and the availability of health care facilities. For example, this is reflected in the emphasis of international efforts on increasing the number of health care facilities, along with a focus on childbirth at the facilities. While this has certainly improved health outcomes (such as higher immunization coverage and reduced child and maternal mortality), there has been relatively less focus, and as a result less progress worldwide, on improvements to access and quality of health care. This is particularly true for the marginalized.

I have seen this firsthand. With the IDRC's research award, I spent four months in a rural community of Nepal studying needs of women. One of the questions I had planned to ask pregnant women I would interview was: why don't you go the health facility for prenatal care during pregnancy, since the service is available? During the fieldwork however, after hiking for 3 hours to get to a community, I could no longer ask this question to a 17-year-old in her third trimester. How could I expect her to walk 6 hours, up and down the hill, to access the health facility? During my stay in the community, it became clear to me that not all the knowledge on local context (such as how community members access health care, and their experience with and expectations of the quality of these services) is known to those of us, researchers, who do not live there. Such knowledge can be understood and shared by engaging those community members. A three year study done in Nepal, for example, found that the maternal mortality ratio decreased significantly and women were more likely to have prenatal care where citizens were engaged in the project planning and intervention processes.

"The people have the right and duty to participate individually and collectively in the planning and implementation of their health care" The Alma Ata Declaration 1978

Citizen engagement & community empowerment

The importance of citizen engagement and community empowerment in policy processes and development projects has been widely discussed by academics. Educators, economists, scholars and activists such as Paulo Freire, Amartya Sen, Gita Sen, Robert Chambers, Lawrence W Green have argued for many years that development and health policies thrive with community-driven approaches and local empowerment. Along with the theoretical work, there is ample evidence to suggest that engaging citizens in decision-making processes improve population health. Involving citizens in discussing root causes of health issues and deriving solutions that speak to them and their social determinants is essential, and it works.

Given the extensive evidence and experience now available, I believe it is now time to listen, reflect, act, and turn development on its head to construct development from the bottom up. The aid world, which plays a pivotal role in achieving health for all,needs to stop working for the poor and marginalized and work with them. The processes must provide space for citizens to lead and not take over their lives and their ability to make decisions.

The global goals to achieve health for all

A study undertaken by the Participate Initiative, with evidence from 84 participatory studies on progress toward meeting the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), finds that the most marginalized are often not reached by development projects. With the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) at hand, the opportunity is ripe to build structures that ensure inclusive decision-making processes and move forward with community engagement. The SDGs, which embraced an inclusive process of goal setting, present an opportunity to radically transform conventional public policy processes. Such transformations can provide space for citizens to exercise their power to shape the decisions that affect their health and well-being.

"Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels" SDG 16 target 16.7

Citizens can identify the root causes of health problems and barriers to health care access. When they participate in research and discussions and contribute in generating evidence and solutions, this leads us closer to attaining health for all, and in understanding the mechanisms for how to get there.

Sunisha is a PhD student at the Universit√© de Montr√©al. She is currently working as a Program Management Officer with the International Development Research Centre's Think Tank Initiatives. She is a public health graduate with a BSc double major in Chemistry and International Development Studies. Her doctorate work is looking at access to maternal health care in rural Nepal, and her interests are health systems research, participatory research and health equity. She has worked in the public health arena in Nepal, Canada and South Africa.
TITLE: Community Engagement In The SDG Era: Why?

SUMMARY:
Myanmar State Counselor Aung San Suu Kyi smiles as she walks from a military helicopter after arriving at Sittwe airport on November 2, 2017, following a visit to Maungdaw in Myanmar's Rakhine State.
Suu Kyi, a Nobel Peace Prize winner, has faced heavy international criticism for not taking a higher profile in responding to what U.N. officials have called "ethnic cleansing" by the army.
Suu Kyi met a group of Muslim religious leaders, said Chris Lewa, of the Arakan Project monitoring group, citing Rohingya sources.
Myanmar?s Immigration Minister has expressed support for a controversial two-child limit on a Muslim minority group that opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi and the United Nations call discriminatory and a violation of human rights.
More than 4,000 crossed at different points on the river on Wednesday, Major Mohammed Iqbal, a Bangladesh security official in the southern district of Cox's Bazar, told Reuters.
TEXT:
Myanmar State Counselor Aung San Suu Kyi smiles as she walks from a military helicopter after arriving at Sittwe airport on November 2, 2017, following a visit to Maungdaw in Myanmar's Rakhine State.

ADVERTISEMENT

SITTWE, Myanmar - Myanmar's de facto leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, on Thursday urged people "not to quarrel" as she visited Rakhine State for the first time since a military crackdown that drove more than 600,000 Rohingya Muslims to flee the country.

Suu Kyi, a Nobel Peace Prize winner, has faced heavy international criticism for not taking a higher profile in responding to what U.N. officials have called "ethnic cleansing" by the army.

Myanmar has rejected the accusations of ethnic cleansing, saying its security forces launched a counter-insurgency operation after Rohingya militants attacked 30 security posts in northern Rakhine on Aug. 25.

On Thursday, amid heightened security, Suu Kyi boarded a military helicopter at Sittwe, the capital of Rakhine State, to be taken to Maungdaw, one of the districts worst hit by the violence.

Suu Kyi met a group of Muslim religious leaders, said Chris Lewa, of the Arakan Project monitoring group, citing Rohingya sources.

"She only said three things to the people - they should live peacefully, the government is there to help them, and they should not quarrel among each other."

"She only said three things to the people - they should live peacefully, the government is there to help them, and they should not quarrel among each other," Lewa said, quoting information from a religious leader who was present.

Rohingya began fleeing predominantly Buddhist Myanmar for neighbouring Bangladesh in late August to escape violence in the wake of a military counter-insurgency operation launched after Rohingya militants attacked security posts in Rakhine State.

Muslim children are seen at a refugee camp outside of Sittwe May 16, 2013. Myanmar?s Immigration Minister has expressed support for a controversial two-child limit on a Muslim minority group that opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi and the United Nations call discriminatory and a violation of human rights. Picture taken May 16, 2013. To match Interview MYANMAR ROHINGYA/ REUTERS/Soe Zeya Tun (MYANMAR - Tags: SOCIETY POLITICS)

A U.S. State Department delegation will be in Bangladesh on Friday and Saturday to discuss the humanitarian crisis and human rights concerns stemming from the crisis in Rakhine state.

The delegation will be led by Simon Henshaw, acting assistant secretary of state for the Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration, the department said in a statement.

On Wednesday, Reuters photographers saw thousands of desperate Rohingya wade through shallows and narrow creeks between islands of the Naf river to reach neighbouring Bangladesh as the exodus begun two months ago was far from over.

Some had small boats or pulled makeshift rafts to get to Bangladesh on the river's western bank, but most walked, children cradled in their arms and the elderly carried on their backs, with sacks of belongings tied to staves on their shoulders.

Reaching the far side, some women and older people had to be pulled through the mud to reach dry land atop steep banks.

More than 4,000 crossed at different points on the river on Wednesday, Major Mohammed Iqbal, a Bangladesh security official in the southern district of Cox's Bazar, told Reuters.
TITLE: Aung San Suu Kyi Visits Rahkine For First Time Since Exodus Of 60,000 Rohingya Muslims

Each year a hideous crime is committed at Christmas parties across the UK: double dipping food.
Then you will have vomiting, diarrhoea and an abscessed tooth.‚ÄùBut the real grossness kicks in when you start double dipping food with a communal sauce that‚Äôll be used by others.
You should take a portion of dip onto your plate to eat it instead.‚ÄùProfessor Schaffner added that double dipping shared food could ‚Äúpotentially‚Äù be harmful to health.

TEXT:
Dunking your canap√© into a shared sauce after taking a bite might go against party etiquette, but is it also a risk to health ? We asked the experts to find out.

The controversial habit is so commonplace that it even appears in one of Lidl‚Äôs new Christmas adverts, which poke fun at stereotypical festive partygoers.

Each year a hideous crime is committed at Christmas parties across the UK: double dipping food.

A Foods Standards Agency (FSA) spokesperson said double dipping food if you‚Äôre the only person eating it is not the biggest crime, but is ‚Äúnot recommended‚Äù, especially if you‚Äôre putting leftovers in the fridge to save for later.

‚ÄúWhile double dipping if you are the only person using the jar is fine in theory - as you are the only person being exposed to any bacterial/viral cross contamination between your mouth and the jar contents - it is poor hygienic practice,‚Äù they told HuffPost UK.

‚ÄúYour own saliva contains enzymes that could affect the food over time in the fridge.‚Äù

Professor Donald Schaffner, a specialist in food science at Rutgers University, agreed that double dipping your own food is ‚Äúprobably not‚Äù a problem if you‚Äôre not sharing with others.

‚ÄúThere is a chance that if you have an infection, i.e. an abscessed tooth, the infection from the tooth can spread to the food,‚Äù he told HuffPost UK.

‚ÄúIf the bacteria can multiply in the food to high levels they can make a toxin that will make you sick. Then you will have vomiting, diarrhoea and an abscessed tooth.‚Äù

But the real grossness kicks in when you start double dipping food with a communal sauce that‚Äôll be used by others.

The FSA spokesperson said: ‚ÄúWe do not recommend this. Bacteria in your mouth could cross-contaminate the food and spread a variety of illnesses, such as colds and flu. You should take a portion of dip onto your plate to eat it instead.‚Äù

Professor Schaffner added that double dipping shared food could ‚Äúpotentially‚Äù be harmful to health.

‚ÄúIf you are sick with norovirus and you vomit, you might have the virus in your mouth. Double dipping would spread the virus to the food and make someone else sick,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúEven if it‚Äôs low risk, it‚Äôs gross. I don‚Äôt want to eat your mouth bacteria.‚Äù

Meanwhile Dr Clare Morrison, the GP for online doctor MedExpress, said you should consider the type of food you‚Äôre eating before thinking about double dipping.

‚ÄúDouble dipping is pretty yukky, but the extent to which it is actually unhealthy varies depending on the food,‚Äù she told HuffPost UK.

‚ÄúFor example, researchers have discovered that while all sauces contain more bacteria when a chip has been double dipped, salsa got the worst deal - with more than five times the bacteria in comparison to other two sauces.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs believed that this is because salsa is watery, so contaminated parts are likely to fall back into the bowl after dipping.‚Äù

Dr Morrison also joked that you should ‚Äúhave a close look at the person who‚Äôs double dipping‚Äù before using a communal sauce. If they look ill, avoid that sauce like the plague.

Consider yourselves warned.
TITLE: Lidl's Christmas Ad Features Double Dipping Food, But Is It Really That Bad For Health?

TEXT:
Everyone knows that your principles and values are only as good as the clothes that literally have them written down.

That‚Äôs where this ‚ÄúAnarchy Jacket‚Äù comes in, from apparel company Alpha Industries, currently being sold on the website of high-end retailer Barneys.

It‚Äôs your high school notebook come to life!

Barneys

You can‚Äôt fight an oppressive system if you‚Äôre not dressed in what might as well be an Abbie Hoffman Halloween costume. The jacket comes loaded with rebellious sayings written on it, including ‚ÄúDisobey.‚Äù And ‚Äúdisobey‚Äù is underlined twice, because they‚Äôre serious, you guys!

And you certainly can‚Äôt fight capitalism if your pockets are full of money, which is why the jacket comes at a cost of $375!

The makers of the jacket, Alpha Industries, told The Daily Dot that they ‚Äúdeveloped the Barneys M65 anarchy jacket to encompass the artistic and graphic expressions of individuality.‚Äù

However, Twitter wasn‚Äôt having any of that very nonsensical explanation, and the response was swift and savage.

√âgide Royer, professeur √† la Facult√© de sciences de l'√©ducation √† l'Universit√© Laval, √©tudie la r√©ussite scolaire depuis des d√©cennies.

TEXT:
QU√âBEC ‚Äì Le ¬´Lab-√âcole¬ª tel qu'imagin√© par les hommes d'affaires Ricardo Larriv√©e, Pierre Thibault et Pierre Lavoie n'est pas mis sur pied, qu'il essuie d√©j√† des critiques des partis d'opposition, des experts et des syndicats.

Les trois hommes parcourent le Qu√©bec √† l'heure actuelle pour s'inspirer des meilleures pratiques dans leurs champs d'expertise ‚Äì l'alimentation, l'architecture et les saines habitudes de vie, respectivement ‚Äì et ensuite proposer leur vision de l'¬´√©cole-mod√®le¬ª.

Le fruit de leur labeur ne verra le jour qu'en 2021. Ils estiment pouvoir r√©nover et am√©liorer cinq ou six √©tablissements √† ce moment-l√† qui correspondront √† leur vision pour aider √† l'apprentissage et la r√©ussite des √©l√®ves dans leur ¬´milieu de vie¬ª qu'est l'√©cole.

Pierre Lavoie, √† droite, promoteur des saines habitudes de vie et co-fondateur du projet Lab-√âcole pr√©sente le projet aux √©tudiants et aux m√©dias, lors d"une conference de presse, mardi, 7 novembre 2017.

√âgide Royer, professeur √† la Facult√© de sciences de l'√©ducation √† l'Universit√© Laval, √©tudie la r√©ussite scolaire depuis des d√©cennies. Il maintient que les meilleures pratiques d'apprentissage sont connues, mais qu'elles ne peuvent pas √™tre implant√©es en raison d'un manque criant de ressources.

¬´Je peux vous apporter une brouette de recherches qui dit que l'activit√© physique est bonne pour les enfants et bien se nourrir, c'est tr√®s bon pour les enfants aussi. Il n'y a pas de trouble l√†-dessus. Tant mieux si √ßa met le projecteur sur ces dimensions-l√†, mais ce ne sont pas les leviers les plus importants pour la r√©ussite scolaire.¬ª

M. Royer a tout de m√™me salu√© les ¬´bonnes intentions¬ª des instigateurs du ¬´Lab-√âcole¬ª, mais lance qu'il est ¬´na√Øf¬ª de croire qu'ils pourront r√©inventer la roue. ¬´Il y a un noyau de connaissances important qui existe d√©j√† et il y a d√©j√† de tr√®s belles √©coles qui ont √©t√© b√¢ties par les communaut√©s scolaires.¬ª

Louise Chabot, pr√©sidente de la Centrale des syndicats du Qu√©bec, critique le fait que le ¬´Lab-√âcole¬ª ait √©t√© mis sur pied par trois personnes √† l'ext√©rieur du monde de l'√©ducation, sans consulter ¬´ceux qui font l'√©cole au quotidien¬ª au pr√©alable.

¬´Le ministre [de l'√âducation, S√©bastien Proulx,] a fait le choix de mettre des sommes d'argent confi√©es √† trois hommes d'affaires pour parcourir le Qu√©bec et de nous expliquer en quoi [l'√©cole] serait mieux¬ª, tranche-t-elle.

Environ 1,5 million de dollars par ann√©e seront d√©di√©s √† MM. Larriv√©e, Thibault et Lavoie pour r√©aliser leur projet.

¬´Inclusion¬ª, mot tabou?

√Ä l'Assembl√©e nationale, Alexandre Cloutier du Parti qu√©b√©cois et Gabriel Nadeau-Dubois de Qu√©bec solidaire ont uni leurs voix pour d√©noncer la ¬´s√©gr√©gation scolaire¬ª - qui √©cr√®me le r√©seau d'√©ducation public des meilleurs √©l√®ves et des √©l√®ves plus fortun√©s en les envoyant dans le syst√®me priv√© ou dans des programmes sp√©cialis√©s.

¬´On est ici pour rappeler au ministre Proulx que c'est bien beau, parler d'architecture et du menu de la caf√©t√©ria, mais que la question fondamentale pour l'√©cole qu√©b√©coise du 21e si√®cle, c'est celle de l'√©galit√© des chances¬ª, a lanc√© M. Nadeau-Dubois, en marge du lancement du ¬´Lab-√âcole¬ª qu'il a qualifi√© de ¬´bling-bling¬ª.

M. Royer explique que le Qu√©bec a en effet les √©coles ¬´parmi les moins √©quitables¬ª au Canada, puisque les meilleurs √©l√®ves quittent les classes ¬´ordinaires¬ª. Il regrette que le mot ¬´inclusion¬ª n'ait pas √©t√© mentionn√© lors du lancement du projet ¬´Lab-√âcole¬ª.

¬´La journ√©e o√π on cesse de concentrer nos √©l√®ves en difficult√© uniquement dans des √©coles ordinaires publiques, apr√®s que les √©coles publiques √† projets particuliers et les √©coles priv√©es ont fait la s√©lection, √ßa aussi c'est un levier important.¬ª

Le ministre Proulx a d√©fendu l'offre √©ducative multiple, comme les programmes de sports-√©tudes, qui offrent ¬´des occasions multiples de r√©ussir¬ª. Il convient toutefois qu'il faut rester vigilants pour ne pas discriminer des √©l√®ves.

¬´On ne veut pas d'une √©cole unique pour tout le monde, a-t-il dit. Je voudrais avoir plusieurs projets, des centaines de projets pour accrocher et pour int√©resser les jeunes. Ce que je veux, c'est qu'il y ait de l'accessibilit√© et de l'√©galit√© √† l'int√©rieur de ces projets.¬ª
TITLE: ¬´Lab-√âcole¬ª: des bonnes intentions, mais de la na√Øvet√©

TEXT:
S√§nger Peter Kraus (78) geht es nach seinem Unfall vor f√ºnf Wochen in der TV-Sendung "Spiel f√ºr dein Land" (Das Erste) k√∂rperlich zwar wieder besser. Die psychischen Blessuren sind aber l√§ngst noch nicht verheilt: "Ich habe nur noch Horror-N√§chte, an Schlaf ist nicht zu denken. Sobald ich das Licht ausmache, bekomme ich Panikattacken, Schwei√üausbr√ºche und Angstzust√§nde", beschreibt er seine aktuelle Gem√ºtslage der "Bild"-Zeitung.

"Ich kann nicht mehr atmen und f√ºrchte zu ersticken. Dann mache ich schnell das Licht wieder an und rei√üe das Fenster auf, um frische Luft zu kriegen", so Kraus weiter. Sein Arzt habe ihm Tabletten gegen die Angstzust√§nde verschrieben. Diese seien die Reaktion seiner Psyche auf den Unfall, so dessen Expertise.

"Sugar, Sugar Baby!" - das Album von Peter Kraus k√∂nnen Sie hier bestellen, streamen oder downloaden

"Ohne meine Musik w√ºrde ich das alles nicht aushalten"

Neben der Reha, die seine Schulterverletzung weiter heilen soll, versucht Peter Kraus, sich mit seiner gro√üen Leidenschaft abzulenken: Er macht weiter Musik. "Ohne meine Musik w√ºrde ich das alles nicht aushalten", so der gebeutelte K√ºnstler.

Der Unfall ereignete sich in der von J√∂rg Pilawa (52) moderierten Show bei einem Fangspiel. "Tatort"-Star Axel Prahl (57) krachte dabei zuerst gegen Peter Kraus, dann fiel auch noch Marcel Reif (67) auf den am Boden liegenden S√§nger.
TITLE: Panikattacken, Schwei√üausbr√ºche, Angstzust√§nde: So schlecht geht es Peter Kraus nach seinem Unfall

The pillows, by interiors brand Jonathan Adler, come in three styles: Xanax (sometimes prescribed for anxiety), Prozax (a common antidepressant) and Quaalude (an illegal sedative).
A range of cushions replicating medication used to treat depression and anxiety have divided mental health campaigners.

TEXT:
While some campaigners believe the pillows ‚Äúturn a serious issue into a gimmick‚Äù, others claim they could help mental ill health become ‚Äúan accepted part of everyone‚Äôs life‚Äù.

The pillows, by interiors brand Jonathan Adler, come in three styles: Xanax (sometimes prescribed for anxiety), Prozax (a common antidepressant) and Quaalude (an illegal sedative).

A range of cushions replicating medication used to treat depression and anxiety have divided mental health campaigners.

The pillows reportedly first sparked a backlash on Instagram after a photo of them was shared by the official Jonathan Adler account.

According to Metro.co.uk, some commenting claimed the cushions were made in ‚Äúpoor taste‚Äù while others thought they were ‚Äúfunny and irreverent‚Äù.

The Instagram post has since been deleted, but the cushions remain available to purchase online.

‚ÄúPerk up your sofa with the right pharmaceuticals,‚Äù the product description reads.

‚ÄúOur Prozac Needlepoint Pillow brings our affair with all things medicinal to your pillowscape. Take just one, or follow our professional recommendation to mix the whole assortment.‚Äù

Commenting on the mixed reception the products have received, Marjorie Wallace, chief executive of the mental health charity SANE, said the pillows could normalise mental ill health.

‚ÄúWhile some people may take offence at these cushions, we do not wish to criticise Jonathan Adler, or to demand their withdrawal from sale,‚Äù she told HuffPost UK.

‚ÄúIf there is no intention to cause offence we don‚Äôt think it is helpful to be too prescriptive, as it risks creating a climate in which people may be frightened from talking about mental health at all.

‚ÄúAnd if we are constantly treading on egg-shells, how can we make mental health an accepted part of everyone‚Äôs life?‚Äù

But Craig Butler, a mental health campaigner who has previously written about his own experiences of depression, disagrees.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a big fan of these,‚Äù he told HuffPost UK.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm all for trying to making light of serious issues as it‚Äôs important, but this is at a point where society is just establishing mental health as a credible and major issue and my personal opinion is that this jeopardises that.

‚ÄúI think things like this just turn a serious issue into a gimmick - it feels cheap to me and I don‚Äôt think turning mental health into a novelty is helpful.‚Äù

It seems the jury is well and truly out on this one. What do you think of the pillows? Tweet us at @huffpolifestyle to tell us your thoughts.

HuffPost UK has contacted Jonathan Adler for comment and is awaiting response.

Useful websites and helplines:
TITLE: These Antidepressant Pillows Have Divided Mental Health Campaigners

TEXT:
INTERSEXE - Un "troisi√®me sexe" en Allemagne? Le Tribunal constitutionnel f√©d√©ral allemand a demand√© ce mercredi 8 novembre la possibilit√© que soit inscrite dans le registre des naissances une mention autre que "femme" ou "homme".

En France, Ga√´tan Schmitt, 66 ans, a demand√© l'inscription sur son √©tat-civil de la mention "sexe neutre". Dans un arr√™t rendu en mai 2017, la Cour de cassation a rejet√© cette demande.

[Communiqu√©] Consulter l'arr√™t "sexe neutre et √©tat civil" ainsi que le communiqu√© de presse sur : https://t.co/ss1AdKr8cR pic.twitter.com/9krv15w5hy ‚Äî Cour de cassation (@Courdecassation) 4 mai 2017

Cette personne est n√©e selon les termes de son m√©decin, avec un "vagin rudimentaire", un "microp√©nis", mais pas de testicules. √Ä sa naissance, Ga√´tan Schmitt a √©t√© reconnu comme un petit gar√ßon puis a pris conscience de son intersexualit√© √† l'√¢ge de 12 ans. Apr√®s la publication de l'arr√™t de la Cour de cassation, les deux avocats de ce Fran√ßais ont d√©cid√© de porter un recours devant la Cour europ√©enne des droits de l'homme.

Na√Ætre intersexe

Environ un b√©b√© sur 2000 na√Æt intersexe. Mais qu'est-ce que l'intersexualit√©? "La meilleure mani√®re de l'expliquer est quelqu'un qui est n√© avec une anatomie sexuelle atypique", explique au HuffPost am√©ricain Elizabeth Reis, professeure en √©tudes de genre. "Leurs appareils g√©nitaux peuvent avoir l'air diff√©rent, ou pas -parfois ils ressemblent √† ceux de n'importe quel gar√ßon ou fille. Ils peuvent ne pas d√©couvrir qu'ils sont intersexes avant la pubert√© parce que c'est leur anatomie reproductive interne qui est atypique."

Ga√´tan, lui, est n√© sans gonades, testicules ni ovaires. En janvier, la mannequin Hanne Gaby Odiele, qui a pos√© pour Chanel, Dior ou encore Alexander Wang, r√©v√©lait √™tre intersexe. Son cas est diff√©rent: elle √©tait n√© "gar√ßon" (avec un chromosome X et un Y) mais son corps √©tait r√©sistant aux androg√®nes, des hormones m√¢les. C'est pourquoi elle ressemblait plus √† une "fille".

Comme l'explique Elizabeth Reis, il existe de nombreuses formes d'intersexualit√©, chaque personne intersexe pouvant avoir des caract√©ristiques diff√©rentes.

Souvent confondues avec les "hermaphrodites", les personnes intersexes n'ont pas deux sexes en √©tat de fonctionnement. Elles peuvent √©galement √™tre confondues avec les personnes trans, qui ne se sentent pas en accord avec leur genre de naissance. "Les trans sont en demande d'op√©ration ou de changement de perception sociale de leur genre", explique √† L'Obs Vincent Guillot, fondateur de l'Organisation internationale des intersexes (OII). "Nous, on veut juste qu'on laisse nos corps tranquilles: on ne touche √† rien tant que la personne n'est pas en capacit√© de s'autod√©terminer", poursuit-il.

Des enfants souvent "mutil√©s"

En effet, bien souvent, les m√©decins d√©cident d'orienter le nourrisson vers un genre ou l'autre. Et cette orientation passe par une op√©ration chirurgicale que, bien s√ªr, l'enfant ne d√©cide pas.

C'est le cas de Hanne Gaby Odiele. A 10 ans, elle a en effet subi plusieurs op√©rations pour retirer ses testicules. Les m√©decins auraient dit √† ses parents qu'elle pourrait "d√©velopper un cancer et que je ne deviendrais pas une fille normale. Plus tard, apr√®s l'op√©ration, j'ai su que je ne pourrais pas avoir d'enfants car je n'avais pas mes r√®gles. J'ai su que quelque chose n'allait pas", confiait-elle en janvier 2017.

Vincent Guillot, lui, d√©nonce m√™me des "mutilations". A 52 ans, faute d'avoir pu lire l'int√©gralit√© de son dossier m√©dical, il ne sait pas exactement quel type d'op√©ration il a subi enfant. Mais ce dont il est s√ªr, c'est que ces chirurgies l'ont fait souffrir psychologiquement parlant pendant des ann√©es. Il a d√ª prendre des antid√©presseurs. "On n'attente pas √† un corps en bonne sant√©, sans urgence vitale. Sinon, on autorise aussi l'excision", regrette-t-il aupr√®s de l'AFP.

Prise de conscience

La France a √©t√© condamn√©e √† trois reprises en 2016 par l'ONU pour ces op√©rations faites sur des enfants afin de leur attribuer un sexe masculin ou f√©minin.

D√©but mars 2017, des s√©nateurs rendaient public un rapport demandant √† ce que soient reconnues et indemnis√©es les souffrances des personnes intersexes. "Pour certains, les traitements chirurgicaux et/ou hormonaux ont √©t√© v√©cus comme des tortures", soulignait la s√©natrice √©cologiste Corinne Bouchoux, corapporteuse de ce rapport intitul√© "Variations du d√©veloppement sexuel: lever un tabou, lutter contre la stigmatisation et les exclusions".

Quelques jours plus tard, lors d'une c√©r√©monie √† l'Elys√©e, Fran√ßois Hollande estimait que "l'interdiction des op√©rations chirurgicales subies par des enfants intersexes, de plus en plus largement consid√©r√©es comme des mutilations", √©tait un "combat √† mener".

√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Ce que cela signifie d'√™tre une personne intersexe

SUMMARY:
"Trump, usually a fan of walls, may come up against one he won‚Äôt like in China -- the 'Great Firewall'."
Trump, usually a fan of walls, may come up against one he won't like in China -- the 'Great Firewall' of online censorship that blocks websites like Twitter, Facebook and Google.
Her own Weibo account gained a huge following before she disabled it in 2014 (her posts are still archived here).
Even as President, many Chinese Weibo users have expressed their admiration for his disdain for so-called 'political-correctness' and have cheered on his contempt for liberal values.
Perhaps Mr. Trump won't be signing up to Weibo after all.
TEXT:
"Trump, usually a fan of walls, may come up against one he won‚Äôt like in China -- the 'Great Firewall'."

When U.S. President Donald Trump's Twitter account was deactivated by a rogue Twitter employee on their last day of work last week, his detractors breathed a sigh of relief.

The reprieve lasted only 11 minutes until the account was reinstated. But after the Twitterer-In-Chief flies from Seoul to Beijing today, his critics may have two whole days to enjoy his absence from the platform while he's in the middle kingdom.

Trump, usually a fan of walls, may come up against one he won't like in China -- the 'Great Firewall' of online censorship that blocks websites like Twitter, Facebook and Google.

If Trump does manage to keep up his Twitter habit, it will most likely be through the use of a Virtual Private Network (VPN). For ordinary Chinese citizens, getting access to VPNs has become harder. Beijing has been ramping up efforts this year to shut down VPNs, even pressuring American tech giant Apple to remove them from its app store in China.

Asked whether the U.S. President will be able to tweet while on Chinese soil, Vice Minister of Foreign Affairs Zheng Zeguang told reporters: "How President Trump communicates with the outside is not something you need to worry about".

But it might be something the Chinese authorities need to worry about. After all, if the U.S. President can't get his Twitter fix, he might be tempted to open a Weibo account. Many users of the Twitter-like Chinese micro-blogging service are certainly clamoring for him to sign up. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi joined ahead of his China visit in spring 2015 and now boasts more than 185 thousand followers on the platform.

Trump needs only to ask his daughter Ivanka about how to use the service. Her own Weibo account gained a huge following before she disabled it in 2014 (her posts are still archived here). Even without a continued personal presence on the platform, Ivanka's jewelry store remains on the site, though it hasn't posted since early 2015. Ivanka still has a sizable following on the platform where her admirers have set up an account called 'Goddess Ivanka Trump' to honour her.

Despite his seemingly strong anti-China positions (on trade issues, in particular) the U.S. President enjoys a great deal of support on the platform. Many Chinese people preferred candidate Trump over his Democratic opponent Hillary Clinton who was seen as particularly hawkish, and in favour of a pivot to China which they saw as an attempt to contain their country.

Even as President, many Chinese Weibo users have expressed their admiration for his disdain for so-called 'political-correctness' and have cheered on his contempt for liberal values.

Trump's denunciation of NFL players for kneeling during the national anthem went viral on Weibo in October, with the vast majority of upvoted comments on the video in support of his stance.

"The biggest appeal of Trump is his frankness", read the top comment on a post about the video.

"For those who refuse to stand during the national anthem, who are contemptuous of the state, they deserve to be fired, even put into prison", read the second most-liked comment.

Weibo was for a brief period (from around 2009 to 2011) filled with vibrant debate, but its most prominent liberal voices have now largely been brought to heel by government censors.

A recent study by Berlin-based think tank MERICS showed that while there is a plurality of views to be found online in China, the party-state has "taken drastic measures to suppress ideas it considers hostile".

Among those new measures are new regulations that crack down harshly on group chats, putting the onus on group admins to police their friends' conversations or face punishment.

Just last week, China's cyberspace authority said it will create a database of online news practitioners, a blacklist of 'fake news' platforms and a mechanism for users to report fake articles.

Perhaps Mr. Trump won't be signing up to Weibo after all.
TITLE: Will Trump Be Able To Tweet From Behind The Great Firewall Of China?

SUMMARY:
A team of researchers at the University of Colorado Cancer Centre found they were able to switch off a specific gene in human DNA that starves cancer cells of glucose, and avoid damaging normal cells in the process.
In the fight against cancer , one of the most important things scientists can understand is how the disease moves so they can stop it in its tracks before it spreads.
CDK8 has long been linked to the development of many cancers including colorectal cancer, melanoma, and breast cancer, where it regulates pathways that drive the growth and survival of cancer cells.
When cancer cells start to grow quickly, they strip the blood supply of oxygen, and then force the body to enter a hypoxic condition, and move on to consuming glucose instead.
The team found when they switched off CDK8 activity in colorectal cancer cells, the cells failed to activate glycolysis genes and took up much less glucose.
TEXT:
A team of researchers at the University of Colorado Cancer Centre found they were able to switch off a specific gene in human DNA that starves cancer cells of glucose, and avoid damaging normal cells in the process.

Now a new study has uncovered one of the most important elements of fighting cancer - how to cut off the supply of food that allows the cells to grow at such a rapid rate and develop new tumours.

In the fight against cancer , one of the most important things scientists can understand is how the disease moves so they can stop it in its tracks before it spreads.

Cancer cells consume exorbitant amounts of glucose when they are taking hold, in fact they require so much of this sugar, that doctors use glucose isotopes to pinpoint the exact location of a tumor and its metastases within the human body.

Where there are abnormally high levels of glucose being used, chances are there is a cancerous growth.

As a result, inhibiting glucose uptake has long been suggested as a logical therapeutic strategy, but the ability to do this has been missing.

Now the team have finally identified a way to do this by stopping a gene CDK8.

CDK8 has long been linked to the development of many cancers including colorectal cancer, melanoma, and breast cancer, where it regulates pathways that drive the growth and survival of cancer cells.

When cancer cells start to grow quickly, they strip the blood supply of oxygen, and then force the body to enter a hypoxic condition, and move on to consuming glucose instead.

Consequently, many cancers are heavily dependent on glucose metabolism for their growth and survival.

CDK8 comes into the picture, because it is the switch that turns on the body‚Äôs ability to produce more glucose.

The team found when they switched off CDK8 activity in colorectal cancer cells, the cells failed to activate glycolysis genes and took up much less glucose.
TITLE: Scientists Have Found A Way To Starve Cancer

SUMMARY:
Face √† Trump, le plan de la Chine pour r√©tablir la route de la soie et en finir avec le dollarPOOL New / ReutersINTERNATIONAL - La premi√®re tourn√©e du pr√©sident Trump en Asie est forc√©ment un √©v√©nement, surtout quand on conna√Æt sa propension √† la boulette diplomatique.
P√©kin s'appr√™te √† l'accueillir en tr√®s grande pompe, et √† lui offrir plus de c√©r√©monial que d'ordinaire.
Pour David Dollar, sp√©cialiste de la Chine √† Brookings, il est peu vraisemblable malgr√© le tapis rouge d√©roul√© que P√©kin fasse beaucoup de concessions.
Vladimir Poutine, Recep Erdogan pour la Turquie, Alexis Tsipras pour la Gr√®ce ou encore la pr√©sidente du FMI et le secr√©taire g√©n√©ral de l'ONU.
Comme pour le FMI, elle compte de nombreux pays actionnaires, 57 au total pour le lancement en 2015.
TEXT:
Face √† Trump, le plan de la Chine pour r√©tablir la route de la soie et en finir avec le dollar

POOL New / Reuters

INTERNATIONAL - La premi√®re tourn√©e du pr√©sident Trump en Asie est forc√©ment un √©v√©nement, surtout quand on conna√Æt sa propension √† la boulette diplomatique. Apr√®s avoir quitt√© les Etats-Unis le 3 novembre et avoir visit√© le Japon et la Cor√©e du Sud, il est attendu en Chine mercredi 8 novembre par le pr√©sident Xi Jinping.

P√©kin s'appr√™te √† l'accueillir en tr√®s grande pompe, et √† lui offrir plus de c√©r√©monial que d'ordinaire. Garde militaire d'honneur, banquet officiel et des milliards de dollars d'accords commerciaux, la Chine veut en imposer.

Un protocole tr√®s √©labor√© qui arrive dans un contexte de tensions sur toute une s√©rie de sujets, du vaste d√©ficit commercial am√©ricain √† la gestion par P√©kin de la Cor√©e du Nord, son impr√©visible voisin.

"C'est un homme puissant", a dit Donald Trump r√©cemment du pr√©sident chinois. "Il se trouve que je pense que c'est un type tr√®s bien", a-t-il ajout√©. Pour David Dollar, sp√©cialiste de la Chine √† Brookings, il est peu vraisemblable malgr√© le tapis rouge d√©roul√© que P√©kin fasse beaucoup de concessions.

Et pour cause. La Chine voit bien au-del√† du d√©ficit commercial am√©ricain. Xi Jinping est surtout connu depuis plusieurs ann√©es pour son plan √† long terme qui vise √† remettre en cause l'h√©g√©monie am√©ricaine, √©conomique et militaire, au moins en Asie.

Voici comment.

La r√©ouverture des routes de la soie

La route de la soie d√©signe les anciens itin√©raires de commerce entre l'Asie et l'Europe. Par voie de terre et de mer, ces routes auraient √©t√© pratiqu√©es d√®s 2000 avant notre √®re, avant d'√™tre progressivement d√©sert√©es √† partir du XVe si√®cle, puis d√©finitivement apr√®s l'ouverture du canal de Suez (1867).

Le grand projet de Xi Jinping est tout simplement de les ressusciter. Le 21 avril 2016, un premier convoi ferr√© a ainsi ralli√© Wuhan √† Lyon en 15 jours, apr√®s un p√©riple de 11.000 kilom√®tres. Le 23 f√©vrier, Bernard Cazeneuve, alors Premier ministre de passage en Chine, a assist√© √† l'arriv√©e en sens inverse d'un train charg√© de bouteilles de Bordeaux et de pi√®ces d√©tach√©es en provenance des usines PSA.

La Chine a aussi l'intention de financer la construction d'un chapelet de ports, ces anciens comptoirs, qui rallient l'Europe en passant par l'oc√©an indien et la mer m√©diterran√©e. Ce n'est pas un hasard si la Chine a rachet√© le port du Pir√©e, √† Ath√®nes, en janvier 2016. Le groupe Cosco s'est engag√© √† investir 350 millions d'euros dans ce qui sera son terminus europ√©en.

"Ce qui est nouveau, c'est que le sens des routes de la soie s'est invers√©", analyse Jean-Fran√ßois Di Meglio, pr√©sident du think tank Asia Centre, interrog√© par Europe1. "La premi√®re route de la soie marchait avant tout dans l'int√©r√™t de l'Occident. Cette fois, c'est la Chine qui prend l'initiative et compte en profiter."

Mi mai, lors du sommet √† P√©kin sur "Obor" (One belt, one road), Xi Jinping a rassembl√© un "G20 r√©appropri√©", selon les termes de Jean-Fran√ßois Di Meglio, pr√©sent pour l'occasion. Vladimir Poutine, Recep Erdogan pour la Turquie, Alexis Tsipras pour la Gr√®ce ou encore la pr√©sidente du FMI et le secr√©taire g√©n√©ral de l'ONU.

En revanche, les Etats-Unis ont d√©clin√© l'invitation, tout comme les dirigeants europ√©ens du G7, √† l'exception de l'italien Paolo Gentiloni. Comme un boycott de la concurrence?

La nouvelle banque chinoise qui bouscule le FMI

C'est le bras arm√© financier de la nouvelle route de la soie. Face au monopole des Etats-Unis sur les grandes institutions financi√®res internationales que sont le FMI et la Banque mondiale, la Chine a lanc√© en 2015 la Banque asiatique d'investissement pour les infrastructures (BAII).

Comme pour le FMI, elle compte de nombreux pays actionnaires, 57 au total pour le lancement en 2015. Malgr√© les r√©ticences et les mises en garde des Etats-Unis, la France, l'Allemagne, le Royaume-Uni, ou l'Italie en font partie, tandis que les Etats-Unis, et le Japon et l'Inde, les deux grands rivaux r√©gionaux, ont d√©clin√© l'offre.

Normal, son but est justement de s'affranchir de la tutelle am√©ricaine pour d√©cider du financement de grands projets d'infrastructure. Au Pakistan, ce sont des dizaines de milliards de dollars qui financent un v√©ritable "plan Marschall" pour cr√©er une route des cols de l'Himalaya au port de Gwadar.

En Afrique, le port de Djibouti s'est aussi mis au chinois sous l'impulsion de grands travaux, tandis qu'une ligne de chemin de fer a √©t√© construite pour le relier √† la capitale √©thiopienne Addis-Abeba. En tout, des dizaines de ports doivent √™tre d√©velopp√©s et des milliers de kilom√®tres de voies ferr√©es construits.

Imposer le yuan en Asie √† la place du dollar

Cela peut sembler tr√®s technique, le sujet est pourtant crucial √† long terme. La Chine a pour ambition d'imposer la yuan comme monnaie de r√©f√©rence, et, surtout, comme monnaie de change sur les march√©s internationaux √† la place du dollar.

K√©zako? Aujourd'hui, l'√©crasante majorit√© du commerce international est factur√© en dollar, y compris celui de la dette publique. Demain, la Chine r√™ve que le yuan occupe le m√™me r√¥le. "Elle se dit que comme premier exportateur mondial, elle pourrait se d√©livrer des risques de change avec le dollar, √©viter la d√©pendance √† l'√©conomie am√©ricaine", analyse Philippe Crevel, pr√©sident du Cercle de l'√©pargne.

Il en va ni plus ni moins de la stabilit√© √©conomique de l'Asie. En 1998, c'est la remont√©e des taux d'int√©r√™ts am√©ricains par la Fed qui est √† l'origine de la crise asiatique. Le changement des taux a provoqu√© une d√©pr√©ciation des monnaies asiatiques, plongeant dans le rouge certains pays dont la dette devait √™tre rembours√©e en dollars.

Accessoirement, l'influence de la Chine sur ces pays serait grandement accrue...

TITLE: Face √† Trump, le plan de la Chine pour r√©tablir la route de la soie et en finir avec le dollar

We‚Äôve compiled nine helpful reads that outline the most common financial mistakes and tell you how to get around them.
10 Dumb Money Mistakes People Make In Their 30sPeopleImages via Getty ImagesWith so much going on with work and life, it‚Äôs easy to focus on the here-and-now and put aside your bigger financial goals.
6 Money Mistakes Everyone MakesPeopleImages via Getty ImagesYou know that going to your doctor for regular checkups is important for your physical health, but have you run tests lately on your financial health?
A ‚Äúgood‚Äù credit score is generally considered something in the low 700s or above.
The 8 Biggest Financial Mistakes Newlyweds Makepixdeluxe via Getty ImagesHow each partner feels about finances is often shaped by their experiences with money growing up.
TEXT:
Whether you‚Äôre living paycheck to paycheck or managing a healthy nest egg, there are certain classic money blunders you‚Äôll want to avoid. Between hidden fees, budgeting mishaps and poor communication around finances, it‚Äôs almost too easy to throw money away. We‚Äôve compiled nine helpful reads that outline the most common financial mistakes and tell you how to get around them. With this advice in hand, you‚Äôll be well prepared to navigate any rocky financial waters ahead. 1. The Unnecessary Risk Too Many Women Take With Their Money

IRATXE LOPEZ DE MUNAIN

Are you worried about getting swindled out of your savings or losing everything in a crash? Alice Finn, the author of Smart Women Love Money, explains the simple ways to avoid those catastrophes ‚Äî and warns us about a threat to our earnings one never seems to consider. 2. 4 Money Myths That Are Hurting Your Savings

triloks via Getty Images

We sometimes cling to myths that can set us up for financial failure because of our complicated emotions surrounding money, from overexcitement to anxiety or fear. Here are some of the most persistent untruths ‚Äî and tips for banishing them once and for all. 3. 10 Dumb Money Mistakes People Make In Their 30s

PeopleImages via Getty Images

With so much going on with work and life, it‚Äôs easy to focus on the here-and-now and put aside your bigger financial goals. However, this will leave you scrambling later in life. Think of this article as a map to help you bypass those monetary gaffes. 4. 6 Money Mistakes Everyone Makes

PeopleImages via Getty Images

You know that going to your doctor for regular checkups is important for your physical health, but have you run tests lately on your financial health? You don‚Äôt want to wait until you‚Äôre having money troubles to seek help. In fact, there may be things you‚Äôre doing now that seem like no big deal but could seriously derail your finances. 5. 6 Things You Should Know About Your Credit Score

kizilkayaphotos via Getty Images

Lenders look at your credit score, also known as your FICO score, to gauge how likely you are to pay back the money they lend you for a mortgage, auto loan or credit card. Credit scores range from 300 on the low end to 850 on the high end. A ‚Äúgood‚Äù credit score is generally considered something in the low 700s or above. Once you get down below 600, it‚Äôs hard to get anyone to lend to you at all. 6. You Should Basically Never Check Your 401(k) Statement

Tassii via Getty Images

The best thing to do with your 401(k) is set it and forget it. Here‚Äôs what you need to know to make that possible. 7. Thinking of Taking an Early 401(k) Withdrawal? Consider the Ultimate Cost.

shironosov via Getty Images

The balance in your 401(k) can be a tempting source of cash when times are tough and you have no other options. And, yes, it‚Äôs possible to take an early distribution without having to pay it back, depending on your personal situation and your specific plan. But possible doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean practical in terms of your financial future. 8. The 8 Biggest Financial Mistakes Newlyweds Make

pixdeluxe via Getty Images

How each partner feels about finances is often shaped by their experiences with money growing up. And knowing what that history is can give you a greater understanding of your significant other‚Äôs attitudes toward money ‚Äî and help clue you in to sore spots. 9. The 5 Biggest Money Mistakes People Make

BernardaSv via Getty Images

It doesn‚Äôt matter what you think you deserve; it doesn‚Äôt matter what you think you need; it doesn‚Äôt matter what you think is the bare bones to fit in with your friends or neighbors. If you don‚Äôt have the money, then you can‚Äôt incur the responsibilities, the debt and the obligation.
TITLE: The Most Common Financial Mistakes To Avoid

TEXT:
L'intervista a Matteo Renzi a diMarted√¨, programma condotto da Giovanni Floris, fa ottenere a La7 un picco di ascolti: il programma ha registrato il 9.14% di share, con 2.123.033 spettatori. Addirittura triplicata la concorrenza di Bianca Berlinguer che con il suo Cartabianca su Rai3 ha ottenuto il 3.17% di share con 747.755 spettatori. Originariamente su La7 sarebbe dovuto andare in onda il confronto tv con il candidato premier M5S Luigi Di Maio, che ha poi deciso di annullare l'appuntamento.

"Di Maio? Come il compagno di scuola che ti d√† l'appuntamento ma poi non si presenta"

L'ex segretario, alle prese con il suo tour ferroviario, si √® detto "contento per il record di ascolti a diMarted√¨". A corredo di una foto pubblicata su Instagram, ha scritto: "Spero un giorno di poter parlare di pi√π di misure concrete. Di ci√≤ che abbiamo fatto in questi anni: dopo di noi, terzo settore, omicidio stradale, posti di lavoro, cooperazione, diritti, Expo, infrastrutture. Ma soprattutto di ci√≤ che vogliamo fare: sostegno alle famiglie, abbassamento delle tasse, investimenti per la crescita e lotta alla povert√†. Mettiamo da parte le polemiche della politica politicante: l'Italia merita di meglio per il proprio futuro. Andiamo avanti, #avanti insieme".

A commentare con soddisfazione gli ascolti di La7 √® anche il deputato del Partito democratico Michele Anzaldi, segretario della commissione di Vigilanza Rai. "Con Matteo Renzi la trasmissione DiMarted√¨ su La7 raggiunge il record storico [...]. Il talk di Floris su La7 non era mai arrivato a un livello cos√¨ alto di telespettatori, in questi anni di concorrenza con Raitre. Nella fascia di prime time (20.30-22.30) La7 √® terza rete in assoluto, battuta solo dalle ammiraglie Rai1 e Canale 5: supera tutte le altre reti. Battuto anche l'innovativo show di Mika su Raidue, una delle pi√π pregiate scommesse dei palinsesti Rai. Triplicati gli ascolti di Cartabianca su Raitre", esulta il dem su Facebook.
TITLE: Renzi traina La7 oltre il 9%. La sua intervista a diMarted√¨ triplica gli ascolti di Rai3

SUMMARY:
Last year Synapse Energy, a consultancy based in Massachusetts, carried out the first-ever audit of the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority (PREPA) and found that the power lines were ‚Äúcracking, corroding and collapsing‚Äù.
‚ÄúPREPA‚Äôs system appears to be running on fumes.‚ÄùThe story of PREPA is the story of Puerto Rico.
By offering stable, well-paid jobs to electrical workers, PREPA helped create a Puerto Rican middle class, says Jos√© Caraballo Cueto, an economist at the University of Puerto Rico.
Puerto Rico has hired a tiny Montana-based contracting company called Whitefish Energy to oversee grid restoration.
‚ÄúBut Puerto Rico never said ‚ÄòHey, we need crews‚Äô,‚Äù says Mike Hyland of the American Public Power Association (APPA), which represents 1,100 utilities.
TEXT:
IN A room beneath the smokestacks of the Aguirre steam plant in south-eastern Puerto Rico, an engineer points to a colourful poster entitled ‚ÄúHow Electricity Arrives at Your Home‚Äù. In normal circumstances, explains Alexis Torres, burning oil turns water to steam, which spins mechanical turbines and sends energy out through power lines that criss-cross the island territory. Hurricane Maria made landfall 30 miles from the Aguirre steam plant. The south-east, where coal and oil plants generate much of the island‚Äôs electricity, suffered the worst damage.

A month later, 82% of Puerto Ricans still lack power. The island operates a centralised electricity grid: the plants in the south-east provide power to beach resorts in the north-west and metropolitan San Juan; 80% of the power lines were destroyed by the storm. Restoring them is a finicky process. By October 10th 16% of the island‚Äôs power had been restored. Later that day it dropped back down to 8% when a plant partially shut down, leaving the airport, police headquarters and several hospitals in the dark. ‚ÄúI was in the middle of open-heart surgery,‚Äù one surgeon said. A back-up generator saved his patient. Thousands of the diesel-fuelled contraptions are powering food refrigeration, water purification and other vital needs. But closed schools and shuttered businesses are the new norm. Tens of thousands of Puerto Ricans have left the island.

Maria‚Äôs fury would have battered any grid, but the scope of the damage, the sluggish pace of repairs and the suffering from weeks without power have almost as much to do with mismanagement as they do with wind and rain. Last year Synapse Energy, a consultancy based in Massachusetts, carried out the first-ever audit of the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority (PREPA) and found that the power lines were ‚Äúcracking, corroding and collapsing‚Äù. The utility had been operating for decades without regulation or oversight. Imprudent spending was accelerating a decade-old debt crisis. ‚ÄúThe results are grim,‚Äù the authors wrote. ‚ÄúPREPA‚Äôs system appears to be running on fumes.‚Äù

The story of PREPA is the story of Puerto Rico. The utility, created by a New Deal governor in 1941, powered rapid industrialisation in the 1970s as American pharmaceutical and other firms flocked to the island to take advantage of federal tax benefits. By offering stable, well-paid jobs to electrical workers, PREPA helped create a Puerto Rican middle class, says Jos√© Caraballo Cueto, an economist at the University of Puerto Rico. The boom was short-lived. When the federal government peeled back the tax perks in 1996, factories started leaving and PREPA began losing customers.

Declining revenues were exacerbated by political patronage, corruption and inefficiency. Municipalities and government agencies do not pay for electricity in Puerto Rico. Successive governments spent tens of millions of dollars evaluating solar and natural-gas projects in order to wean PREPA off its dependence on oil, but did next to nothing. Less than 3% of the island‚Äôs energy came from renewables.

PREPA is responsible for $9bn of Puerto Rico‚Äôs $73bn of debt. As PREPA and other agencies borrowed billions of dollars from international creditors (and from each other, a practice some have compared to a Ponzi scheme), the utility started skimping on maintenance. In 2014 an austerity law prompted hundreds of experienced employees to retire and claim their pensions before cuts took effect. They were never replaced. The result, according to Synapse‚Äôs report, was generator failures, blackout rates four times higher than other American utilities, rising consumer costs, environmental violations and an increasing numbers of worker injuries and fatalities. A three-day blackout in 2016 caused by a fire at the Aguirre plant foreshadowed the darkness and economic standstill Hurricane Maria would bring. ‚ÄúWe took the risk and we are paying the price,‚Äù says Mr Torres, peering at his poster.

In the aftermath of the hurricane, debate is swirling about how to fix the electrical system and who should pay. ‚ÄúWe must rebuild better,‚Äù Governor Ricardo Rossell√≥ has said, voicing enthusiasm for a proposal from Elon Musk, founder of Tesla, to deploy solar panels and batteries throughout the island to decrease dependence on the weak grid. This is a fine idea, but also an expensive one. Besides, federal emergency aid‚Äîthe House of Representatives approved a $36.5bn package on October 12th, though only a fraction will go to Puerto Rico‚Äîcan typically be used only to reconstruct what existed before the disaster.

The reconstruction has begun in an unusual fashion. Puerto Rico has hired a tiny Montana-based contracting company called Whitefish Energy to oversee grid restoration. Normally, states and municipalities contact a ‚Äúmutual aid network‚Äù that can quickly mobilise thousands of repairmen. ‚ÄúBut Puerto Rico never said ‚ÄòHey, we need crews‚Äô,‚Äù says Mike Hyland of the American Public Power Association (APPA), which represents 1,100 utilities. Mr Rossell√≥ originally claimed he could not get in touch with the APPA, and then later explained that he began negotiating with Whitefish before Hurricane Maria. The company had responded to a request for repair work after Hurricane Irma, and it appeared to be Puerto Rico‚Äôs cheapest option. Jos√© Roman of the Puerto Rican Energy Commission, an independent body created in 2014 to regulate and monitor PREPA, confirmed that no official bidding process took place. ‚ÄúThe government was in emergency mode,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt like all the big guys were jumping up and down to go to a bankrupt island,‚Äù said Ken Luce, a spokesman hired by Whitefish a week ago. The company, which has two full-time employees, began as a joint-venture in 2015 with a Brazilian company called Comtrafo to build a transformer plant in Montana, a project that has since sputtered out. The Puerto Rican government declined to provide details on the contract, but Mr Luce said that Whitefish demanded only a $2m deposit for supplies and crews. It has 220 men on the island, though it plans to increase these to around 1,000 in order to meet the government‚Äôs goal of 95% power restoration by Christmas. Until several days ago, Whitefish‚Äôs website consisted of a single page with a photo of a helicopter and the contact information for a spokesman.

Puerto Rico‚Äôs ability to get the lights back on‚Äîand get them to stay on‚Äîmay determine the island‚Äôs future. People will not wait indefinitely for schools without electricity to reopen if they can afford flights to mainland America. Yarimar Bonilla, a Puerto Rican anthropologist at Rutgers University, asked thousands of residents how they felt about Puerto Rico‚Äôs territorial status. They told her that, historically, reliable government services like electricity, water and communications made them feel superior to their non-American neighbours like Dominicans and Cubans. The blackouts made people wonder.
TITLE: The story of Puerto Rico‚Äôs power grid is the story of Puerto Rico

TEXT:
Moderator und Spa√ümacher Joko Winterscheidt (38) hat nach dem Aus von "Circus HalliGalli" einen neuen Job an der ProSieben-Entertainment-Front. Winterscheidt wird gemeinsam mit "GNTM"-Gewinnerin und "The Voice"-Moderatorin Lena Gercke (29) und REWE-Einkaufschef Hans-J√ºrgen Moog in der Jury von "Das Ding des Jahres" sitzen. Die Show basiert auf einer Idee von Stefan Raab (51, "TV total"), der als Executive Producer fungieren wird. Janin Ullmann (35) soll moderieren.

In der f√ºr das erste Halbjahr 2018 geplanten Show dreht sich alles um kuriose und praktische Erfindungen. Das Jury-Trio soll die vorgestellten Ideen beurteilen und einsch√§tzen, bevor das Studiopublikum entscheiden kann, welche Erfindung weiterkommt. In einem gro√üen Live-Finale sollen schlie√ülich die Fernsehzuschauer urteilen, was f√ºr sie "Das Ding des Jahres" ist.

Hier bekommen Sie "Joko gegen Klaas - Das Duell um die Welt" und weitere Shows mit Joko Winterscheidt auf DVD

Er freut sich wie ein Kind

Schon jetzt zeigt Winterscheidt seine Begeisterung f√ºr die Show. "Es gibt so viele Menschen, die in ihrer Freizeit die tollsten Sachen erfinden, aber niemand wei√ü etwas davon", so das Jury-Mitglied. "Ich habe keine Ahnung, was wir alles zu sehen bekommen, aber ich freue mich darauf wie ein Kind aufs Geschenke auspacken." Und auch Gercke ist √ºberzeugt: "Es wird unglaublich spannend sein mitzuerleben, was f√ºr tolle und au√üergew√∂hnliche Dinge die Erfinder in unserer Show pr√§sentieren."
TITLE: "Das Ding des Jahres": Das steckt hinter der neuer Show von Stephan Raab

TEXT:
"Bauer sucht Frau" ist zu einer Peep-Show f√ºr die Bessergestellten geworden

Denn in der RTl-Sendung werden Menschen aus der Provinz blo√ügestellt - mit fatalen Folgen

Katastrophen fangen oft ganz harmlos an. So auch die neue Folge von ‚ÄûBauer sucht Frau‚Äú, jener scheinbar putzigen und doch so giftigen Reality-Soap auf RTL.

Kameraschwenk √ºber die th√ºringische Provinz. Hintergrundmusik: 70er-Jahre-Getr√§ller. Rosi sitzt am Fr√ºhst√ºckstisch eines Bauernhofs vor zwei dr√∂gen Scheiben Brot. Der Hausherr hat ein Milchtrauma aus der Jugend und kann keinen K√§se riechen. Daf√ºr hat er sie mit einem Pfund Butter √ºberrascht.

Doch die Dame stellt ihn auf die Probe und drapiert den eigens mitgebrachten Edamer auf den Tisch.

Weibliche Stimme aus dem Off: ‚ÄûAuch Rosi erbringt einen Liebesbeweis, sie versteckt den K√§se unter Marmelade.‚Äú Der Bauer muss vor die T√ºr. ‚ÄûNur die frische Landluft kann dem 66-J√§hrigen jetzt helfen. Rosi bleibt ratlos zur√ºck. Muss sie sich vom K√§se verabschieden, wenn sie bei G√ºnter bleiben m√∂chte?‚Äú, sagt die Sprecherin.

Nahaufnahme. Hintergrundmusik: italienisches Liebesgeschnulze.

Offenbarungseid der Sonderlichkeiten

Die ersten Minuten, die ersten Lacher. Das Muster bei ‚ÄûBauer sucht Frau‚Äú ist ewig gleich: Die ganze Sendung ist ein Spott auf die Mittelm√§√üigkeit der Provinz. Auf die Sorgen der Menschen. Auf deren Ausdrucksweise, Marotten und Schrullen. Das ist infam, und auch gef√§hrlich.

Am gr√∂√üten ist die Freude bei dem Produzenten, wenn die ganzen, normalerweise aus verst√§ndlichen Gr√ºnden unbeleuchteten Peinlichkeiten des Kennenlernens mit der Lupe seziert werden.

Dann h√§lt die Kamera drauf, als ginge es darum, den Mord an John F. Kennedy aufzukl√§ren. Und ab und zu grinst Moderatorin Inka Bause in die Kamera.

Die kleinen und gro√üen Fehlkommunikationen, die Missverst√§ndnisse. Das Offenbaren der eigenen Sonderlichkeiten, in der Hoffnung, der andere m√∂ge sie annehmen. Die Schwierigkeiten, sich ins Leben des anderen einzuf√ºhlen. All das ist hier ein gro√üer Witz f√ºrs Millionenpublikum.

Peep-Show f√ºr die Bessergestellten

So wird das Landleben zur Peep-Show f√ºr die Bessergestellten und f√ºr jene, die es werden wollen. Da k√∂nnen sich Lasse und Laura aus Prenzlauer Berg genauso wie Jupp und Jutta aus Krefeld in dem wohligen Gef√ºhl ins Fernsehkissen dr√ºcken, dass sie in der besseren von zwei m√∂glichen Welten an diesem Abend leben.

Nageldesignerin Christa darf die vollgeschissenen K√§lber-Iglus abk√§rchern. In gl√§nzenden Turnsch√ºhchen. Haha.

Der ‚Äûwaschechte Westerw√§lder‚Äú Uwe trennt sich beim erzwungenen K√ºchenputzen schweren Herzens von einem, nach eigener Aussage, ‚Äûjahrzehntealten‚Äú Topflappen. Igitt, hihi.

Eine grantig schauende Bauernmama isst ein Gericht, das ihr die Schwiegertochter in spe zubereitet hat. Hintergrundmusik: ‚ÄûSpiel mir das Lied vom Tod‚Äú. Und, oh Wunder: Die √§ltere Dame ist eigentlich eine ganz liebe Person, bedankt sich, freut sich, macht ein paar ziemlich trockene, gute Witze. Hintergrundmusik: ‚ÄûHere Comes the Sun‚Äú. Hoho.

Die ganze Niedertracht der RTL-Fernsehmacher

√úberhaupt: Am nervt√∂tendsten ist der Soundtrack.

Mit schmalzigen Liebesliedern, die sich selbst der hei√ügelaufendste Kuchelrock-Ultra nicht in einer √ñffentlichkeit zu spielen trauen w√ºrde, die gr√∂√üer ist als die eigene, demente Hauskatze; schunkeltauglichen Unterhaltungsschlagern aus der Wirtschaftswunderzeit mit dem Cool-Faktor von Schnarchpflastern; und amerikanischen Gro√üe-Welt-Songs, die einen ironischen Kontrast zu den Misthaufen der deutschen Provinz herstellen.

Hier wird die ganze Niedertracht der Fernsehmacher von RTL offensichtlich. Was f√ºr Eltern muss man haben, um anderen Menschen so eine sp√∂ttische Inszenierung anzutun?

Als Zuschauer kann solche Fernsehsendungen wegkonsumieren wie eine Tafel Milchschokolade, daf√ºr sind sie ja gemacht.

Doch am Ende bleiben die Kalorien auf der Seele: Ist es wirklich richtig, dabei zuzusehen, wie ganz normale, bisweilen ziemlich liebenswert wirkende Menschen zum Bel√§chelt- und Belachtwerden preisgegeben werden? Sollten wir wirklich dabei zuschauen, wie die deutsche Provinz als Hort der Unzul√§nglichkeiten dargestellt wird?

Eine b√∂sartige Sendung

Nein, verdammt. ‚ÄûBauer sucht Frau‚Äú ist eine b√∂sartige Sendung. Sie sorgt daf√ºr, dass ganze Gesellschaftsschichten in Deutschland gegeneinander ausgespielt werden, nur damit RTL und der Bertelsmann-Konzern ihre Gewinnmarge steigern k√∂nnen.

Wenn wir √ºber die Bruchlinien in unserer Gesellschaft sprechen, die derzeit zu immensen politischen Verwerfungen in Deutschland f√ºhren, dann f√§ngt die Diagnose an einem beliebigen Abend bei Sendern wie RTL an. Wir haben verlernt, uns gegenseitig zu respektieren. Und das hat auch mit dem √∂ffentlichen Bild zu tun, das von Milieus und Regionen medial produziert wird.

‚ÄûBauer sucht Frau‚Äú ist Wahlwerbung f√ºr die AfD. Hier wird der Graben ausgeschaufelt, der Menschen in Deutschland trennt, und hinter dem jene Barrikaden errichtet werden, an denen derzeit gek√§mpft wird. Man kann RTL daf√ºr nicht oft genug kritisieren.



(mf)
TITLE: Warum "Bauer sucht Frau" die beste Wahlwerbung f√ºr die AfD ist
Das ist der wohl gef√§hrlichste Pool der Welt - ihr solltet nur in Begleitung hinein

Die Paradise Papers zeigen einen weiteren Steuertrick von US-Megakonzern AppleSo waren ab 2015 zwei Apple-Sitze auf der Insel Jersey registriertDort liegt der Steuersatz f√ºr Unternehmen bei null ProzentDie Paradise Papers zeigen Apples neuen Steuertrick.
Der US-Konzern wollte sich im Fr√ºhjahr 2014 zusichern lassen, auf der Steueroase Jersey keinerlei Steuern zahlen zu m√ºssen.
", lie√ü Apple √ºber eine amerikanische Anwaltskanzlei bei dem Offshore-Dienstleister Appleby nachfragen, bevor Tochterfirmen Gesch√§ftssitze auf die Insel verlagerten.
Danach f√ºhrte Appleby laut den Dokumenten zwei irische Apple-Firmen mit Gesch√§ftssitz auf der √Ñrmelkanal-Insel Jersey, zeigen die Paradise Papers, die der "S√ºddeutschen Zeitung" zugespielt wurden.
Der Sportartikelhersteller gr√ºndete zuerst zahlreiche Offshore-Firmen auf den Bermudas, um dort die Lizenzrechte der Firma zu halten - etwa f√ºr das Firmenlogo, den weltber√ºhmten "Swoosh".
TEXT:
Die Paradise Papers zeigen einen weiteren Steuertrick von US-Megakonzern Apple

So waren ab 2015 zwei Apple-Sitze auf der Insel Jersey registriert

Dort liegt der Steuersatz f√ºr Unternehmen bei null Prozent

Die Paradise Papers zeigen Apples neuen Steuertrick. Der US-Konzern wollte sich im Fr√ºhjahr 2014 zusichern lassen, auf der Steueroase Jersey keinerlei Steuern zahlen zu m√ºssen.

"Ist es m√∂glich, eine offizielle Best√§tigung der Steuerbefreiung zu bekommen, und kostet das etwas?", lie√ü Apple √ºber eine amerikanische Anwaltskanzlei bei dem Offshore-Dienstleister Appleby nachfragen, bevor Tochterfirmen Gesch√§ftssitze auf die Insel verlagerten.

Irland-Gesellschaften von Apple nutzten eine L√ºcke im irischen Steuerrecht. Diese erm√∂glichte es ihnen, in keinem Land der Welt Steuern zahlen zu m√ºssen. Die L√ºcke wurde 2015 auf internationalen Druck hin geschlossen.

Danach f√ºhrte Appleby laut den Dokumenten zwei irische Apple-Firmen mit Gesch√§ftssitz auf der √Ñrmelkanal-Insel Jersey, zeigen die Paradise Papers, die der "S√ºddeutschen Zeitung" zugespielt wurden. Auf Jersey liegt der Steuersatz f√ºr Unternehmen bei null Prozent. Auf diese Weise dr√ºckte der Konzern seine Steuerquote bei Gewinnen au√üerhalb der USA weiter auf nur drei bis sieben Prozent.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Liebe Eliten, wundert euch nicht, wenn die Menschen AfD w√§hlen, es liegt auch an eurem Verhalten

Apple betonte, sich an alle Gesetze zu halten. "Wir sind der gr√∂√üte Steuerzahler der Welt", sagte ein Sprecher.

Auch Nike arbeitet mit Offshore-Firmen

Auch der Sportartikelkonzern Nike nutzt ein Steuerschlupfloch. Der Sportartikelhersteller gr√ºndete zuerst zahlreiche Offshore-Firmen auf den Bermudas, um dort die Lizenzrechte der Firma zu halten - etwa f√ºr das Firmenlogo, den weltber√ºhmten "Swoosh".

An diese Briefkastenfirmen mussten Nike-Niederlassungen Hunderte Millionen Euro bezahlen, um die Markenrechte nutzen zu d√ºrfen.

Durch die hohen Lizenzzahlungen wurden die weltweiten Gewinne drastisch gedr√ºckt und damit die Steuerlast. Nike verlagerte laut den Paradise Papers 2014 diese Praxis in die europ√§ische Steueroase Niederlande - und dr√ºckte seine globale Steuerrate damit von 35 Prozent um das Jahr 2002 auf nur mehr rund 13 Prozent. So konnte Nike in Steueroasen Gewinne in H√∂he von mehr als zw√∂lf Milliarden Dollar anh√§ufen, die kaum besteuert wurden.

Auch mehrere Deutsche tauchen in den Dokumenten auf. Darunter Altkanzler Gerhard Schr√∂der und Gl√ºcksspiel-Unternehmer Paul Gauselmann.
TITLE: "Kostet das etwas?" Paradise Papers decken auf, wie dreist Apple bei den Steuern trickst

SUMMARY:
South Africa and Zimbabwe behave like conjoined twins: hard to live together, painful to separate, and conscious of the fact that a separation might result in one survivor.
Does it follow that South Africa has to follow the same downward trajectory, or that there is no rescuing Zimbabwe from complete collapse?
Eerily, South Africa's ruling party fortunes are beginning to show similar symptoms of degenerate behaviour.
South Africa as the most powerful neighbour seems divided over strategy.
Unfortunately, South Africa finds itself under similar pressure -- trying to avoid falling over the socio-economic, political and fiscal cliff.
TEXT:
South Africa and Zimbabwe behave like conjoined twins: hard to live together, painful to separate, and conscious of the fact that a separation might result in one survivor. Indeed, these two have much in common: a painful colonial history, a moment of glory as the post-colonial ruling elite made the nation proud, followed by a rather disappointing and depressing end to the relevance of liberation movement politics.

Does it follow that South Africa has to follow the same downward trajectory, or that there is no rescuing Zimbabwe from complete collapse? Not necessarily. It is worth noting that a range of factors conspire against positive and peaceful outcomes. One relates to leadership weaknesses -- ruling and opposition parties alike.

Despite the dangers of predicting the "demise of Mugabe" (by now a legendary tale of how to get it wrong, a bit like predicting the end of the Cold War), it is becoming clear that even as Mr Mugabe nears the end of his reign, he manages to disrupt the succession race -- using his motley crew of supporters to remove any and all challengers to the throne.

A supporter of the ruling party Zanu PF holds a poster outside the party headquarters to show support for President Robert Mugabe following a wave of anti-governement protests over the last two weeks in Harare, Zimbabwe July 20, 2016.

One after the other, they end up joining the equally bleak opposition landscape. Could it be that Grace Mugabe has a chance to take control of the presidency? Under these conditions, conspiracy theories and speculation swirl and clog the social media.

Eerily, South Africa's ruling party fortunes are beginning to show similar symptoms of degenerate behaviour. There is no telling the outcome of the December elective conference and whether the Zuma or Ramaphosa block will take control of the party (and it is another question what to expect at the forthcoming national elections in 2019).

South Africa's President Jacob Zuma (R) jokes with his party's newly appointed Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa (L).

Accompanying this trend -- the failure of liberation movement politics -- is the growth of complex and multilayered criminal networks that benefit from state fragility. Its dynamics have variously been described as "state capture", or the "shadow or mafia state" at work.

Viewed together with the established phenomenon of the rule of the big man -- patrimonialism -- it is hard not to conclude that both Zimbabwe and South Africa are inescapably degenerating into violent state failure.

South Africa as the most powerful neighbour seems divided over strategy. A range of civil society organisations demand action.

Several initiatives are at hand to intervene, arrest, and recover the slide. In Zimbabwe, the most recent big intervention -- SADC mediation under the leadership of Mr Mbeki resulting in a government of national unity -- brought temporary relief, but arguably allowed criminal networks to spring even deeper roots.

South Africa as the most powerful neighbour seems divided over strategy. A range of civil society organisations demand action. Political interests at home and abroad attempt to blow new life in the governing ZANU-PF or the fractured opposition.

The private sector appears disinterested, passively awaiting the inevitable. What is to be done? Unfortunately, South Africa finds itself under similar pressure -- trying to avoid falling over the socio-economic, political and fiscal cliff.

Under these conditions, it is everyone for him and herself, and the prospects for the twins look bleak indeed.

Anthoni van Nieuwkerk is a professor at the Wits School of Governance.
TITLE: Zimbabwe At A Crossroads -- And South Africa‚Äôs Inability To Intervene

Es una tarifa demasiado baja"Primero, hay que reconocer que esta tarifa es extremadamente baja, de hecho, es la m√°s baja del mundo.

TEXT:
Y despu√©s que se anunci√≥ que se elimina la tarifa cero, ¬øpagar√°s m√°s por hacer llamadas a trav√©s de tu celular?

El aumento en las tarifas de interconexi√≥n no afecta en absoluto al usuario... Al contrario, podr√≠an seguir bajando", explic√≥ Irene Levy, presidenta de Observatel, el observatorio de las telecomunicaciones en M√©xico.

El 2 de noviembre, el Instituto Federal de Telecomunicaciones (IFT) notific√≥ que todos los operadores de servicios de telefon√≠a celular deber√°n pagar a Telcel, a partir del 2018, menos de 3 centavos por minuto por tarifa de interconexi√≥n (0.028562 pesos). Esto es el pago por cada llamada de voz que pase por la red Telcel, de parte de un operador de la competencia (AT&T, Movistar, Axtel, Virgin...)

¬øQu√© garant√≠as hay que este costo no se le pasar√° al usuario? Levy da tres razones que explican por qu√© no.

1. Es una tarifa demasiado baja

"Primero, hay que reconocer que esta tarifa es extremadamente baja, de hecho, es la m√°s baja del mundo. Antes de la tarifa cero (con la que operadores no pagaban nada por interconexi√≥n) se pagaban hasta 32 centavos por minuto.

¬øPor qu√© entonces los operadores defienden que s√≠ tendr√°n que pasarle el costo a los usuarios? De acuerdo con The Competitive Intelligence Unit, a partir de la reforma de telecomunicaciones se ha observado una disminuci√≥n de precios en telefon√≠a celular de alrededor de 45% (y por tanto, una baja en el ingreso promedio por usuario que obtiene cada operador).

De hecho, todos los servicios de telecomunicaciones han bajado, seg√∫n muestra este gr√°fico del IFT.

2. Tarifas de interconexi√≥n no 'pesan' en los ingresos de un operador

"Segundo, tenemos que tomar en cuenta que el pago de tarifas de interconexi√≥n es s√≥lo 2.8% de los ingresos de la industria, es decir, los operadores no viven de esto", dice Levy.

Con ello, ser√≠a poco probable que por estas tarifas, los operadores dejar√°n invertir en infraestructura o en un buen servicio al cliente.

Pero esto no significa que no van a protestar y que no habr√° argumentos de presi√≥n para regresar a la tarifa cero.

"Estaremos viendo c√≥mo la competencia de Telcel hablar√° de las consecuencias... pero AT&t no se va a ir del pa√≠s por esto, por ejemplo".

Y s√≠, tambi√©n Carlos Slim (due√±o de Telcel) podr√° poner otro amparo para que la tarifa de menos de 3 centavos sea mayor. "Jur√≠dicamente s√≠ puede hacerlo, diciendo que esta tarifa tan baja no le conviene... no pierde nada".

Lo que s√≠ es un hecho, es que la tarifa cero no era viable a largo plazo: ten√≠a que subir en alg√∫n momento, seg√∫n explica Levy.

3. Cada vez menos llamadas de voz

Hay tomar en cuenta que las tarifas de interconexi√≥n son s√≥lo para los servicios de voz, es decir, para las llamadas de tel√©fon√≠a celular.

Hoy, seg√∫n explica Levy, los usuarios utilizan menos servicios de voz y usan m√°s servicios de datos (conexi√≥n a internet). Por ejemplo, los servicios de datos hoy representan el 50% (estaban en 46%) y los de voz est√°n en 46%.

Si dudas que est√°s usando m√°s datos, es decir, tu conexi√≥n de internet, en lugar de tu se√±al de tel√©fono, preg√∫ntate cu√°ntas llamadas haces v√≠a WhatsApp, en lugar de hacer una llamada de tel√©fono convencional; o cu√°ntas llamadas has dejado de hacer debido a que mandas m√°s mensajes por redes sociales.

La importancia de las tarifas asim√©tricas

Para entender mejor el tema se tiene que tener claro qu√© son las tarifas asim√©tricas.

"Vamos a suponer que vas a correr contra Usain Bolt... si te da unos minutos para que t√∫ salgas corriendo antes, tendr√≠as un poco de ventaja y no te dar√≠a una super barrida, ¬øcierto? Algo as√≠ son las tarifas asim√©tricas, que con la Reforma Telecom buscan que los competidores de Telcel (que es el operador preponderante porque tiene la mayor parte del mercado) tengan un poco de ventaja para competir mejor en el mercado", explica Levy.

Esto es, que lo que paga cada operador, en t√©rminos de tarifas de interconexi√≥n, depende de su situaci√≥n en el mercado: no paga lo mismo Telcel que su competencia. ¬øY por qu√© Telcel? Al segundo trimestre del 2017, Telcel ten√≠a 75.4% del mercado de telefon√≠a celular, que es una gran mayor√≠a del mercado (por lo que se le considera 'preponderante). En tanto que AT&T tiene 13.5% y Telef√≥nica 10.9%; el resto de los operadores se reparten el 0.2% restante.

Respecto al tema de las tarifas asim√©tricas, Gonzalo Rojon de The Competitive Intelligence Unit, explica a trav√©s de una columna, que la asimetr√≠a de tarifas de interconexi√≥n "ha detonado un escenario de mayor competencia en el corto plazo, con evidentes ganancias en adopci√≥n, calidad, asequibilidad y cobertura para nosotros los consumidores".

As√≠ que lo importante en este tema es que se mantenga la asimetr√≠a (el operador preponderante tiene unas reglas en tarifas, y los dem√°s, otras). "√âsa es la decisi√≥n que el regulador (IFT) deber√° de tomar en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as, mantener el mayor diferencial posible para enfatizar su eficacia en los pr√≥ximos a√±os y evitar la perpetuidad de una asimetr√≠a competitiva entre operadores competidores".

A√∫n con todo, es a√∫n imposible saber qu√© suceder√° en este tema: los operadores podr√≠an seguir presionando, argumentando que pagar tarifas de interconexi√≥n les generar√° bajas en ingresos, y Telcel podr√≠a buscar la manera de que la tarifa sea mayor a 3 centavos.

Esperemos que los operadores y analistas nos hayamos equivocado y que esta reducci√≥n no signifique un retroceso en los beneficios que hemos obtenido los consumidores", dice Gonzalo Rojon, a trav√©s de un art√≠culo.

Las tarifas de interconexi√≥n

Estas son las tarifas que entrar√°n en vigor en 2018, fijadas por el IFT.
TITLE: 3 razones de por qu√© la eliminaci√≥n de la tarifa cero no te afectar√°
