TEXT:
Die "Paradise Papers" zeigen: Wer nur genug Geld und Einfluss hat, kann vielen Steuerpflichten und Regeln entgehen ‚Äì und verst√∂√üt mitunter nicht einmal gegen Gesetze

Die deutsche wie die internationale Presse reagiert mit Emp√∂rung auf die Enth√ºllungen

Die Paradise Papers sorgen f√ºr Emp√∂rung auf der ganzen Welt. Gro√ükonzerne, Promis, Superreiche ‚Äì die Enth√ºllungen belegen ausf√ºhrlich, dass weltweit Unternehmen und Privatpersonen bei der Steuer tricksen.

‚ÄúSkrupellose Eliten vermeiden ihre gerechte Besteuerung, w√§hrend Otto-Normal-Verbraucher zuhause Stra√üen, Schulen und Sozialausgaben finanziert‚Äù, bringt es Birgit Marshall f√ºr die ‚ÄúRheinische Post‚Äù auf den Punkt.

Klar ist: Laut Wirtschaftsexperte Gabriel Zucman verliert allein die Bundesrepublik jedes Jahr 17 Milliarden Euro an Einnahmen.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: "Paradise Papers": Liebe Eliten, wundert euch nicht, wenn die Menschen AfD w√§hlen, es liegt auch an eurem Verhalten

Politik in Bedr√§ngnis

"Spiegel"-Journalist Jakob Augstein findet in seinem Kommentar harte Worte f√ºr den laxen Umgang der Bundesrepublik mit den superreichen Steuers√ºndern. "Das System ist zutiefst krank", schreibt er. Und die Wut darauf wachse. "Sie sucht sich nur die falschen Ziele. Der Hass der Betrogenen gilt eher dem Kriegs- als dem Steuerfl√ºchtling", bemerkt Augstein. Und erg√§nzt: "Unser Planet ist ein Paradies f√ºr Arschl√∂cher."

Auch die internationale Presse sieht die Politik in der Bringschuld, die Steueroasen durch h√§rteres Vorgehen zu zerschlagen. ‚ÄúUm dieser Situation ein Ende zu bereiten, sollte man jene beiden Kr√§fte zerst√∂ren, die sie aufrechterhalten‚Äù, schreibt die franz√∂sische Zeitung ‚ÄúLe Monde‚Äù: "Die grenzenlose Gier einiger weniger und die Unt√§tigkeit der Staaten.‚Äù Letzteres sei dabei nicht unbedingt einfacher anzugehen, als Ersteres.

Denn dass Unternehmen und Einzelpersonen sich Steuerparadiese wie den Kaiman Inseln, Malta, oder Bermuda bedienen, um Geld zu horten, ist sp√§testens seit den ‚ÄúPanama Papers‚Äù bekannt. Passiert ist jedoch nicht viel, um die Steuertrickser zur Rechenschaft zu ziehen.

Marshall von der ‚ÄúRheinischen Post‚Äù glaubt, dass die ‚Äúunertr√§gliche Schieflage‚Äù gef√§hrliche Stimmungen versch√§rfen k√∂nne: ‚ÄúGerade demokratisch gew√§hlte Regierungen verlieren Glaubw√ºrdigkeit, wenn es ihnen weiterhin nicht gelingt, die Reichsten ausreichend zu besteuern‚Äù, kommentiert sie.

Mehr noch: Ranghohe Politiker wie US-Handelsminister Wilbur Ross sind selbst in die Enth√ºllungen verwickelt.

"Bild"-Zeitung: Auch der kleine Mann trickst bei der Steuer

Der einzige Trost sei, dass die Digitalisierung f√ºr mehr Transparenz sorgen werde, weil Dateien gehackt werden k√∂nnen, folgert die belgische Zeitung ‚ÄúDe Tijd‚Äù. ‚ÄúJedes neue Leck stellt die steuerliche Doppelmoral blo√ü.‚Äù

Olaf Gersemann von der ‚ÄúWelt‚Äù ist da anderer Meinung. Er sieht in den Offshore-Gesch√§ften keine Doppelmoral. ‚ÄúKonten in Steueroasen sind im Grunde nichts anderes als das Bargeld des reichen Mannes: desjenigen, der mehr Geld besitzt, als sich in Matratzen oder Wandtresoren verstauen lie√üe‚Äù, behauptet er in einem Kommentar.

Die ‚ÄúBild‚Äù-Zeitung argumentiert sogar, auch der ‚Äúkleine Mann‚Äù w√ºrde gerne mal bei der Steuer tricksen. Mehr als 40 Milliarden Euro gingen in Deutschland jedes Jahr durch allt√§glichen Steuerschummel verloren, hei√üt es in dem Bericht.

‚ÄûDahinter stecken h√§ufig dieselbe Gier, dieselben egoistischen Motive, einfach sparen zu wollen‚Äú, zitiert die ‚ÄúBild‚Äù den Chef der Deutschen Steuergewerkschaft, Thomas Eigenthaler. Der Steuerexperte vermutet, dass viele Leute f√ºr sich beschlie√üen: ‚ÄúWenn die da oben sich das erlauben, dann erlaube ich mir das auch.‚Äú

Enth√ºllungen wie die Paradise Papers k√∂nnten dieses Gef√ºhl noch verst√§rken.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: "Paradise Papers": 4 Fragen und Antworten zu den spektakul√§ren Enth√ºllungen

Wieso sind Steueroasen schlecht?

Aber darf man Steueroasen grunds√§tzlich verteufeln? Die ‚ÄúNeue Z√ºrcher Zeitung‚Äù springt jedenfalls f√ºr sie in die Bresche: ‚ÄúOffshore-Gesch√§fte geh√∂ren zu einer globalen Welt. Manchmal sind sie notwendig und manchmal Ausdruck von Missst√§nden, kaum je aber deren Ursache‚Äù, hei√üt es.

Den internationalen Steuerwettbewerb anhand einiger missbr√§uchlicher Beispiele generell als kriminell hinzustellen, sei deshalb fahrl√§ssig.

Die Londoner ‚ÄúTimes‚Äù meint Offshore-Zentren h√§tten zwar prinzipiell eine legitime Rolle, w√ºrden sie doch ‚ÄúBesitzt√ºmer vor dem Zugriff durch Schurkenstaaten sch√ºtzen.‚Äù Meistens, so r√§umt die britische Zeitung ein, w√§ren sie jedoch dazu da, um Superreichen zu helfen.

Mit Material der dpa

TITLE: "Paradies f√ºr Arschl√∂cher": So emp√∂ren sich die Medien √ºber die Steuerenth√ºllungen der Paradise Papers

SUMMARY:
Has it really been only a year since Donald Trump won the presidential election?
America has endured a wild 365 days, filled with palace intrigue, plenty of political promises and, of course, more campaigning and elections.
Trump is already running for a second term ‚Äï at least for now.
He‚Äôs held a campaign rally nearly every month since his November victory and raised tens of millions of dollars this year.
Only 1,091 days to go until the 2020 election, so fasten your seat belts.
TEXT:
Has it really been only a year since Donald Trump won the presidential election? America has endured a wild 365 days, filled with palace intrigue, plenty of political promises and, of course, more campaigning and elections.

Trump is already running for a second term ‚Äï at least for now. He‚Äôs held a campaign rally nearly every month since his November victory and raised tens of millions of dollars this year.

So far, the competition is minimal. Only one Democrat, Rep. John Delaney (Md.), has thrown his hat in the ring for 2020, which means there are currently as many Democrats seeking the presidency as there are ferrets. Moses the Pant Ferret filed his statement of candidacy with the Federal Election Commission last month.

If you think that‚Äôs weird, we‚Äôre just getting started. Only 1,091 days to go until the 2020 election, so fasten your seat belts.
TITLE: The Longest Shortest Time: 365 Days Of Trump

TEXT:
Algunas caras familiares van a regresar a Anatom√≠a de Grey en el cap√≠tulo 300, que se emite en Estados Unidos este jueves 9 de octubre.

Este drama m√©dico tan longevo va a traer de vuelta a los fantasmas de temporadas anteriores para el gran cap√≠tulo Who Lives, Who Dies, Who Tells Your Story (Quien vive, quien muere, quien cuenta tu historia), que gira en torno a un accidente en una monta√±a rusa (Lo cierto es que esperamos que no se refieran a fantasmas de verdad, porque todos sabemos c√≥mo acab√≥ eso la √∫ltima vez).

Aunque int√©rpretes como Katherine Heigl, Sandra Oh y T.R. Knight no van a volver (miembros del reparto original que ya han abandonado la serie), habr√° pacientes con un gran parecido a esos personajes que har√°n su aparici√≥n en este episodio repleto de nostalgia.

"El episodio 300 va a ser como un viaje al pasado", ha contado el actor James Pickens Jr. en E! News. "Veremos a algunos actores que llegan al hospital despu√©s de un horrible accidente y que nos recordar√°n a Izzie, George y Cristina Yang", se√±ala.

"Encontraron a tres int√©rpretes incre√≠bles... Cuando llegu√© y los vi me sorprend√≠ mucho, porque fueron una parte imprescindible del √©xito que tuvo la serie y ten√≠an mucho talento, as√≠ que los echamos mucho de menos. Por tanto, a los espectadores les gustar√≠a mucho decir 'Vaya, ah√≠ est√°n de nuevo", ha se√±alado el actor.

La actriz Sara Drew ha explicado a Entertainment Weekly que "ese parecido hace que el reparto original recuerde a esas personas y luche para que estas vivan".

Heigl dej√≥ Anatom√≠a de Grey en la sexta temporada tras un supuesto enfrentamiento con la creadora de la serie, Shonda Rhimes. Esta supuesta enemistad surgi√≥ cuando la actriz tom√≥ la pol√©mica decisi√≥n de retirarse de la carrera por un Emmy en 2008 porque pensaba que su papel "no merec√≠a una nominaci√≥n".

Knight abandon√≥ la serie antes que Heigl, cuando su personaje fallece tras un accidente de autob√∫s. Por su parte, Oh fue la que m√°s tiempo permaneci√≥ en la serie de los tres, y se despidi√≥ tras la d√©cima temporada.

Rhimes ha dejado la puerta abierta para el regreso de esta actriz, pero no as√≠ con Heigl. Ella no volver√° a los pasillos del Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital, pese al hecho de que la actriz ha manifestado su deseo de volver a interpretar a su personaje.

"Ya basta con esa historia. Le he dado mil vueltas a esa idea y he reflexionado si podr√≠a funcionar. Y creo que la respuesta es no", apunta Rhimes respecto a la posible vuelta de Heigl en 2015.

A continuaci√≥n puedes ver el v√≠deo promocional del episodio n√∫mero 300.

Este art√≠culo fue publicado originalmente en el 'HuffPost' Estados Unidos y ha sido traducido del ingl√©s por Mar√≠a Gin√©s Grao.
TITLE: 'Anatom√≠a de Grey' trae de nuevo al personaje de Katherine Heigl... o casi

ADVERTISEMENTTIRUNELVELI -- The Tirunelveli District Court on Monday granted bail to Cartoonist Bala who was arrested on Sunday for his 'defamatory' caricature on Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K. Palanisamy and State Police Commissioner.
The Tamil Nadu police had arrested Bala from Tirunelveli after a defamatory case was registered against him for allegedly portraying the Chief Minister in a distasteful manner.
Bala had allegedly portrayed the chief minister, the state's collector and the police commissioner wearing nothing and covering their private parts with money, while a baby burns in front of them.
The caricature was published after a recent incident where a couple and their two children self- immolated at the collectorate, alleging police inaction on a usury complaint.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

TIRUNELVELI -- The Tirunelveli District Court on Monday granted bail to Cartoonist Bala who was arrested on Sunday for his 'defamatory' caricature on Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K. Palanisamy and State Police Commissioner.

The Tamil Nadu police had arrested Bala from Tirunelveli after a defamatory case was registered against him for allegedly portraying the Chief Minister in a distasteful manner.

Bala had allegedly portrayed the chief minister, the state's collector and the police commissioner wearing nothing and covering their private parts with money, while a baby burns in front of them.

The caricature was published after a recent incident where a couple and their two children self- immolated at the collectorate, alleging police inaction on a usury complaint.
TITLE: Arrested For Caricature On Tamil Nadu CM, Cartoonist Bala Gets Bail

TEXT:
INTERNATIONAL - Le timing aurait sans doute pu √™tre mieux choisi. Le pr√©sident am√©ricain Donald Trump a estim√© que la journ√©e de mardi 7 novembre, date officielle du 100e anniversaire de la R√©volution bolch√©vique d'Octobre en Russie, devait √™tre d√©clar√©e comme "la journ√©e nationale des victimes du communisme". Une d√©claration qui intervient juste avant son arriv√©e en Chine.

Dans un communiqu√© publi√© par la Maison Blanche √† Washington, alors qu'il se trouvait lui √† S√©oul en Cor√©e du Sud, le pr√©sident Trump affirme que "lors du si√®cle pass√©, les r√©gimes totalitaires communistes √† travers le monde ont tu√© plus de 100 millions de personnes et soumis encore plus de personnes √† l'exploitation, la violence et des d√©vastations indicibles".

"Aujourd'hui, nous sous souvenons de ceux qui ont p√©ri et de ceux qui continuent √† souffrir sous le communisme", ajoute Donald Trump, soulignant la d√©termination des Etats-Unis √† "faire briller la flamme de la libert√© pour tous ceux qui r√™vent d'un avenir plus libre et moins sombre".

Ce communiqu√© a √©t√© publi√© √† la veille du d√©part, mercredi 8 novembre, du pr√©sident Trump vers la Chine, un r√©gime communiste depuis 1949. Apr√®s P√©kin, troisi√®me √©tape apr√®s le Japon et la Cor√©e du Sud d'une tourn√©e asiatique de 12 jours, le pr√©sident am√©ricain doit encore se rendre au Vietnam et aux Philippines.

TEXT:
Just when you thought 2017 couldn't get any worse, here comes the news that we are killing off our koalas.

Once widespread across Australia, the past 20 years has seen koala numbers decline dramatically, for some populations by as much as 80 percent.

"Yes, the dear old fluffy koala is suffering along with our other species quite badly," Ian Darbyshire, CEO of the Foundation for National Parks & Wildlife told HuffPost Australia.

"In the past five years, we have seen the population go from about 100,000 to 40,000. At this rate, they will be extinct by 2040."

So what is causing this rapid decline? And what can we do to reverse it?

"There are a lot of different factors, but habitat loss is the main cause," Darbyshire said. "If you look at south east Queensland and northern New South Wales, you've got Brisbane, which is expanding, and the Gold Coast which is expanding. With these developments comes a loss of habitat for koalas.

"Furthermore, you get habitat loss breaking down the connectivity between trees, so quite often these days you'll see koalas crossing the road. When they are down on the ground, that's when they are vulnerable, not only from traffic but also from dogs."

Koalas are having to travel further for food.

Darbyshire said a fragmentation of koala population has also led to further problems for the marsupials.

"You can drive around the country and see koalas, they are widespread but local," he said. "And their population is fragmented now. That leads to inbreeding, disease and stress.

"We are seeing Chlamydia become a real issue and that's because the population is getting stressed. And tragically, Chlamydia affects their ability to breed and they can also lose their sight.

"It's tragic because the koala is a national icon, it's a very important economic contributor for Australia's tourism and they are heading towards being vulnerable."

Large scale fires are another serious problem.

Other issues koalas are facing include large scale fires and climate change, both of which can result in koalas forcing to relocate, which is actually problematic in itself.

"It's not easy to relocate koalas as they tend to be quite choosy about the trees they'll eat. They have to have flora that's developed to the area they are in. You can't just take from one area to another. You have to make sure you introduce the right bacteria into their gut," he said.

"Males are very territorial as well, and as food gets scarce a male might roam several kilometers. You can't then just stick another male in his territory. You really have to understand what you are doing."

In terms of what you can do to help, Darbyshire said it all starts with education.

"I think the public needs a fair bit of education and support to understand they do need help. We need actions from individuals to make sure they have koala-friendly fences, that they have their dogs under control. If you see one on the road, help it across. We should be doing more to help them," he said.

A koala can't live anywhere else on earth. They are animals unique to Australia, and they can't adapt as fast as we are changing the environment around them.

If you're in an area where koalas can be found, Darbyshire encouraged you to leave water out for them on hot days and also to make it easy for koala to travel from yard to yard.

"Lean a pole on your fence or plant a tree so koalas can navigate backyards," he said. "They are having to travel further for food, which sees them [forced to navigate suburban areas] and puts them in the path of dogs.

"Koalas can be found throughout Queensland, down to New South Wales and Victoria and South Australia. So if you live in these areas, think about planting the right trees, giving them connectivity from tree to tree, controlling the burn, keeping the vegetation for them... it all helps.

"Or make a donation to us and we'll help them for you.

"A koala can't live anywhere else on earth. They are animals unique to Australia, and they can't adapt as fast as we are changing the environment around them.

"They can only have one young a year and have to be about three years old until they can have one. We are moving much faster than they are.

"Australia has a big issue -- Australia is wiping out its mammals faster than any other country on earth. We need lots of help for our native species. Talking about the koala helps because it's iconic. It's the cute cuddly Aussie.

"But it won't be here for much longer if we don't take action now."
TITLE: Australia Is Running Out Of Koalas

SUMMARY:
Everyone knows Oprah's stamp of approval is gold, which is why we can't help but freak out at the fact that the talk show queen has named a Canadian sleepwear company as one of her favourite things.
This year, The Sleep Shirt, a Vancouver- and Montreal-based sleepwear company, made the TV host's famous list.
"One of our editors wore this oxford cotton sleep shirt to the office with sandals and looked terrific," the 63-year-old revealed.
A post shared by Oprah (@oprah) on Nov 2, 2017 at 4:47pm PDTSuhner-Isenberg modelled her nightwear after a 19th century chemise she found at a vintage menswear store in London.
Besides Oprah's list of favourite things, The Sleep Shirt has also been featured on Gwyneth Paltrow's lifestyle site, Goop.
TEXT:
Oprah Winfrey arrives at the taping of 'Queen Sugar After-Show' on November 7, 2017 in California.

Everyone knows Oprah's stamp of approval is gold, which is why we can't help but freak out at the fact that the talk show queen has named a Canadian sleepwear company as one of her favourite things.

This year, The Sleep Shirt, a Vancouver- and Montreal-based sleepwear company, made the TV host's famous list. Specifically, Oprah noted the Blue Oxford Stripe Shirt as one she would wear as a stylish addition to a day outfit or for simply lounging at home.

"One of our editors wore this oxford cotton sleep shirt to the office with sandals and looked terrific," the 63-year-old revealed. "I'd relax in it at home or wear it as a cover-up. There might even be a few people who'd actually sleep in it."

Naturally, Sleep Shirt creator Alexandra Suhner-Isenberg was thrilled when she heard Oprah's positive review of her nightwear.

"She's such an influential figure, and there hasn't been a single person who hasn't been like 'oh my god' when we tell them the news," the designer told Flare. "To be recognized by such a major person and influencer is so great."

A post shared by Oprah (@oprah) on Nov 2, 2017 at 4:47pm PDT

Suhner-Isenberg modelled her nightwear after a 19th century chemise she found at a vintage menswear store in London. She then founded her company in 2012 and has been creating stylish, oversized unisex sleepshirts ever since.

And thanks to the sleepwear trend, the designer's clothes have only been gaining in popularity over the years. Besides Oprah's list of favourite things, The Sleep Shirt has also been featured on Gwyneth Paltrow's lifestyle site, Goop.

A post shared by The Sleep Shirt (@thesleepshirt) on Aug 22, 2017 at 11:57pm PDT

Back in 2012, Suhner-Isenberg told the Vancouver Sun, "In terms of why people love them, we haven't reinvented the wheel, and you can find other brands that do night shirts, but we're known for them, and it's a great product."

Plus, if it's Oprah-approved, you know it's gotta be good!

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Oprah Gives Her Stamp Of Approval To This Canadian Sleepwear Company

SUMMARY:
Term 4, for so many, can feel much like approaching the finish line of the Comrades Marathon.
Parents; work with your child: break the seemingly overwhelming task of getting through it all into bite-size, manageable pieces.
Create a daily to-do list and teach your child to tick off each completed task.
Term 4 can indeed feel much like the final struggle in the Comrades Marathon.
Encourage your child through your positive outlook about the term ahead, and reap the rewards of a more confident, motivated learner!
TEXT:
Term 4, for so many, can feel much like approaching the finish line of the Comrades Marathon. Although the end is in sight, the distance already covered in the race has been significantly challenging.

As a participant, your goal should be to successfully complete the race and claim the victory, having conquered the challenges along the way.

Determination

Just as a runner in the Comrades would need to motivate himself to continue towards his goal, despite being tired, sore and perhaps frustrated or disillusioned, so learners and parents will need to find positive ways to keep motivated and determined in the face of the exams and other assessments.

Runners who successfully complete the Comrades do so because they are prepared for the inevitable challenges that will be experienced along the way. Parents should know that the challenges of Term 4 can be navigated more easily with these helpful tips:

Arrange to get exam timetables and the exam scopes (what will be tested in each subject) as soon as possible. Parents; work with your child: break the seemingly overwhelming task of getting through it all into bite-size, manageable pieces. Create a daily to-do list and teach your child to tick off each completed task. This will give her a great sense of accomplishment and keep her motivated! Ask teachers how to get hold of practice tests and past papers. These are the best tools to use to learn for tests and exams! Create a study-friendly environment for your child. Set aside a special place with a desk and chair. Never study on a couch or a bed -- the brain will go into sleep mode. Switch off cell-phones and the TV during the period of study. Before getting started, make sure that your child knows what needs to be done during the allotted time. When completed, tick off on the to-do list. Do not forget to factor in time for exercise, healthy eating and rest. These are essential stress-busting activities. Study tip: The brain is said to remember things seven times better when you write it down! Encourage your child to write important information down while studying.

Term 4 can indeed feel much like the final struggle in the Comrades Marathon. Just as runners often seem to accomplish the impossible through good preparation and planning, so too, can your child! Focus on the end line. Encourage your child through your positive outlook about the term ahead, and reap the rewards of a more confident, motivated learner! Go for it!
TITLE: 8 Terrific Tips To Make Term 4 Count

TEXT:
Hace unos d√≠as hubo un gran debate sobre el feminismo y sus consecuencias, luego que todas las participantes del certamen de belleza Miss Per√∫ en su edici√≥n del a√±o tomaran las pasarelas para denunciar las alt√≠simas cifras de violencia de g√©nero y feminicidios en su pa√≠s. "Mis medidas son: 2.202 casos de feminicidios reportados en los √∫ltimos nueve a√±os en mi pa√≠s" dijo una de las concursantes al micr√≥fono mirando al p√∫blico televisivo entre asombrado y desconcertado. "Mis medidas son: el 81% de los agresores a ni√±as menores de cinco a√±os son cercanos a la familia" a√±adi√≥ la siguiente candidata. Una a una, las veintitr√©s mujeres participantes en el concurso describieron un temible paisaje de violencia y agresi√≥n que la mayor√≠a de las veces suele ser silenciado y ocultado por medios oficiales e, incluso, por tab√∫es sociales y culturales.

Por supuesto, la iniciativa del certamen caus√≥ revuelo en redes sociales y en medios de comunicaci√≥n, en los que como suele ser habitual, se discuti√≥ p√∫blicamente sobre los alcances del feminismo y, sobre todo, sus implicaciones. La iniciativa del concurso sorprendi√≥ y abri√≥ una amplia discusi√≥n sobre la necesidad de convertir el debate sobre la violencia de g√©nero en una discusi√≥n p√∫blica. Pero no mucha gente pareci√≥ estar de acuerdo. Los acostumbrados argumentos sobre "Una muerte es una muerte, no importa el g√©nero" se enfrentaron a concienzudos an√°lisis sobre el contexto que suele rodear un crimen de g√©nero.

En medio de ambas tendencias, la noci√≥n sobre los asesinatos de mujeres perpetrados por motivos machistas y sobre todo, menospreciados por el prejuicio y la tradici√≥n, mostr√≥ de nuevo un rostro duro y preocupante de la sociedad. Ese que ignora su existencia o lo que es a√∫n peor, contin√∫a sin asumir su gravedad e importancia.

¬øCu√°l es el error en la visi√≥n de nuestra sociedad que hace que la agresi√≥n contra las mujeres se normalice y se invisibilice, tanto como para considerarse un hecho normal y admisible?

Cuando ten√≠a unos dieciseis a√±os le√≠ un articulo en un peri√≥dico que creo se convirti√≥ en la huella de mis pesadillas m√°s personales. No recuerdo su autor, aunque s√≠ el hecho que estaba ilustrado con la caricatura de una mujer que, vestida de negro, se encog√≠a hasta casi desaparecer del plano central de la imagen. El texto ‚Äî crudo, mordaz y estremecedor sentenciaba ‚Äî analizaba el maltrato de g√©nero desde la escalofriante perspectiva de la indiferencia: "Al parecer, podr√≠as ser v√≠ctima de la violencia solo por ser hermosa y joven, o simplemente tener un aspecto saludable. Eso quiere decir que las mujeres solo estaremos a salvo una vez que entramos en la vejez. Pero tambi√©n he de mencionar que los casos de violencia sexual contra ancianas crecen exponencialmente a√±o tras a√±os. Tal vez, sea solo cuesti√≥n de no llevar ropas llamativas -tengas la edad que tengas ‚Äî y vestirse de negro y muy cerrado para cubrir el hecho que eres mujer. Sin embargo, debo decirte que tambi√©n existen pruebas irrefutables que hay cierto tipo de psic√≥patas que se excitan ante la visi√≥n de una mujer cubierta por ropas gruesas y eso desata un indice de agresividad inaudita. As√≠ que, tal vez lo mejor sea no existir, no estar en la realidad, desaparecer cualquier huella de femineidad, porque es evidente que el mero hecho de ser mujer ya es premisa para sufrir una grosera manifestaci√≥n de horror".

La iniciativa del concurso sorprendi√≥ y abri√≥ una amplia discusi√≥n sobre la necesidad de convertir el debate sobre la violencia de g√©nero en una discusi√≥n p√∫blica.

S√≠, memoric√© el pasaje. Y es que, a trav√©s de los a√±os, lo he meditado en numerosas ocasiones, aterrada y asqueada. Tal vez se trate de una exageraci√≥n de esa realidad de lo femenino y lo masculino. Sin duda, en muchas partes lo es, pero resulta inquietante pensar que en alg√∫n extremo en cierto. ¬øCu√°l es el error en la visi√≥n de nuestra sociedad que hace que la agresi√≥n contra las mujeres se normalice y se invisibilice, tanto como para considerarse un hecho normal y admisible? ¬øQu√© hace que frases como "las mujeres desean que se les ponga car√°cter" o "se mereci√≥ ser golpeada" contin√∫en siendo pronunciadas por hombres j√≥venes?

No nos enga√±emos, toda esta estructura social machista tiene su origen en el hecho que contin√∫a existiendo una creencia cultural que menosprecia a la mujer, moral e intelectualmente hablando. Por cada mujer emprendedora, fuerte y luchadora, existen diez que son educadas para el servilismo, que carecen de una educaci√≥n s√≥lida y una preparaci√≥n cultural sustentable. Y por ese motivo es tan importante la lucha diaria, la noci√≥n sobre a qu√© se enfrenta una mujer en medio de una cultura hostil y c√≥mo podemos construir una idea sobre la igualdad, que brinde una nueva manera de confrontar la violencia y el dolor femenino.

Me pregunto si al escuchar las cifras pronunciadas por las concursantes de Miss Per√∫ la mayor√≠a del p√∫blico comprendi√≥ su trascendencia. Su importancia y poder. El necesario trabajo que se requiere para comprender la envergadura del problema del maltrato de g√©nero y sus consecuencias. Sin duda, se trata de un hito en medio de la lucha por mostrar las consecuencias de la cultura del machismo en nuestro continente. El primero ‚Äî de muchos pasos ‚Äî para crear un ambiente seguro para las mujeres y ni√±as latinoamericanas. Y eso tiene su m√©rito.

TEXT:
Ein interner Machtkampf sorgt f√ºr Unruhe in der rheinland-pf√§lzischen AfD

Die Gegner des Landeschefs Uwe Junge rufen zur Revolte auf

Der Vorgang ist au√üergew√∂hnlich - und k√∂nnte Auswirkungen auf die gesamte Partei haben

Auch nach den Querelen um den R√ºckzug der AfD-Chefin Frauke Petry kommt die Partei nicht zur Ruhe.

W√§hrend sich die AfD im Bundestag sortiert, g√§rt es in den Landesverb√§nden gewaltig.

Der Landtagsfraktion in Sachsen und Nordrhein-Westfalen droht nach einer Austrittswelle das Aus. In Petrys Landesverband in Sachsen wurde gar ein Notvorstand berufen. Und auch die Auseinandersetzungen in der AfD-Fraktion in Rheinland-Pfalz nehmen zu.

Im Fokus: Der rheinland-pf√§lzische AfD-Chef Uwe Junge. Er muss sich seit einigen Wochen mit lautem, parteiinternen Widerstand herumschlagen.

Querelen um den Parteitag

‚ñ∫ Ende Oktober vers√§umte er, die Einladungen zum Parteitag rechtzeitig an die Mitglieder zu verschicken. Daraufhin regte sich heftiger Widerstand. Die HuffPost berichtete.

Solche kleinen Formfehler k√∂nnten sich "bitter r√§chen", sagte der Polit-Experte Werner Patzelt von der TU Dresden. ‚ÄúDas machen sich interne Gegner zu Nutze, die sich in der Partei gegen die F√ºhrung durchsetzen wollen.‚Äù

‚ñ∫ Nun steht Junge erneut unter Druck - im Kern geht es um eine Initiative seiner parteiinternen Rivalin und Stellvertreterin Christiane Christen.

In einem Aufruf, der bereits mehrere hundert Unterzeichner hat, appelliert sie, zu den "Gr√ºndungsidealen der Partei" zur√ºckzukehren. Christen kritisiert die undurchsichtige Verteilung von Posten und deren Bezahlung. Der Landesvorstand solle zur "Integrit√§t und Rechtstreue" zur√ºckkehren.

Vorw√ºrfe sind "falsch und b√∂swillig"

Junge wandte sich daraufhin in einer Mail w√ºtend an die rheinland-pf√§lzischen AfD-Mitglieder. Die Vorw√ºrfe seien "falsch und b√∂swillig", hei√üt es einem Schreiben, dass der HuffPost vorliegt.

Weiter schreibt Junge an die Mitglieder: "Schenken Sie Ger√ºchten und B√∂swilligkeiten keinen Glauben!"

Der Aufruf suggeriere, den Mitgliedern werde "die Partei weggenommen oder es best√ºnde zumindest die Gefahr dazu. Ich m√∂chte diesem Aufruf mit einem Schreiben an Sie alle entgegen treten, weil hier der erneute Versuch unternommen wird, die gute Arbeit des Landesvorstands und der Fraktion in Frage zu stellen."

Christen hatte sich Mitte des Jahres aus dem Landesverband zur√ºckgezogen, nachdem ihre Bewerbung auf die Spitzenkandidatur zur Bundestagswahl gescheitert war.

"Die Vorg√§nge sind bemerkenswert"

Die Vorg√§nge sind ungew√∂hnlich - und k√∂nnten auch √ºber die Landesgrenzen hinaus in der AfD zu sp√ºren sein. Denn der Machtkampf kann f√ºr Junge gef√§hrlich werden, sagt Carl Berning, Politologe an der Universit√§t Mainz.

"Seine Aussichten auf eine Karriere in Berlin schwinden, wenn der Eindruck entsteht, dass er seinen Laden nicht im Griff hat.‚Äù

Der Machtkampf sei insofern bemerkenswert, weil der Landesverband in der Au√üenwahrnehmung als einer der stabilsten in Westdeutschland gilt, erkl√§rt Berning.

"Der Machtkampf k√∂nnte Junge gef√§hrlich werden"

Junge gilt in der Partei als gem√§√üigt, galt bis zu Petrys Weggang als Vertrauter der damaligen Parteichefin und unterst√ºtzt den Partei-Ausschluss des Rechtsau√üen Bj√∂rn H√∂cke.

Einige Beobachter sehen in dem Machtkampf um Junge deswegen auch einen Kampf des rechten Lagers um die Vorherrschaft in der Partei.

"Zeit f√ºr einen Putsch ist g√ºnstig"

Zum Showdown k√∂nnte es auf dem Landesparteitag Ende des Jahres kommen. Weil dann auch der Landesvorstand gew√§hlt werden muss, k√∂nnten Junges Gegner zur offenen Revolte blasen.

‚ÄúDie Zeit f√ºr einen Putsch im Landesverband ist kurz vor dem Parteitag strategisch g√ºnstig", sagt Politologe Berning.

Bis zur n√§chsten Landtags- und Bundestagswahl ist es noch lange hin. Ein Streit um die Parteif√ºhrung w√ºrde also keine Stimmen kosten - sofern es gelingt, wieder Einigkeit herzustellen.

"Dies wird n√∂tig sein, sollte der Streit um die Parteif√ºhrung tats√§chlich eskalieren, um einen personellen Wechsel hervorzurufen", sagt Berning.

Falls es tats√§chlich zum Putsch kommt, w√§re das ein weiterer Schritt zur Radikalisierung der Partei.

(ben)
TITLE: Interne AfD-Mails zeigen: Landeschef Junge droht Putsch in Rheinland-Pfalz

Jacqui Lambie is the latest federal MP to be pulled into the ongoing citizenship saga after the Tasmania senator revealed her father was born in Scotland.
The outspoken and frequently controversial independent senator denied having any concerns over her citizenship status after publicly confirming her father had come to Australia as an infant.
"I am proud of my Scottish ancestry and my father is too," Senator Lambie said in a statement.
Senator Lambie's office has been asked specific questions by @abcnews about whether the Senator or her father have renounced British citizenship.
https://t.co/RVKuujakIx ‚Äî Moments Australia (@MomentsAU) November 8, 2017Despite herself fielding questions over her citizenship status, Senator Lambie concluded her statement with a show of support for a citizenship audit of all parlimentarians to "clear the air once and for all".
TEXT:
Jacqui Lambie is the latest federal MP to be pulled into the ongoing citizenship saga after the Tasmania senator revealed her father was born in Scotland.

The outspoken and frequently controversial independent senator denied having any concerns over her citizenship status after publicly confirming her father had come to Australia as an infant.

"I am proud of my Scottish ancestry and my father is too," Senator Lambie said in a statement.

"I'm happy to put on record that I'm satisfied that my parents are both Australian Citizens and I have no concerns about me being a dual citizen because of where they were born or came from...

"As far as I'm concerned all their affairs are in order as are mine."

Senator Lambie's office has been asked specific questions by @abcnews about whether the Senator or her father have renounced British citizenship. Awaiting response. November 8, 2017

Senator Lambie further added she had been delving into her family history in recent weeks as she wrote her autobiography, although it remains unclear whether she had been aware of her father's country of birth prior to beginning this research.

The Tasmanian crossbench senator, who previously declared she was Aboriginal in her 2014 maiden speech, said in the statement her paternal grandfather had come to Australia to enlist in the army.

Senator @JacquiLambie says she has "no concerns" she could be a dual citizen after revealing her father was born in Scotland. https://t.co/RVKuujakIx ‚Äî Moments Australia (@MomentsAU) November 8, 2017

Despite herself fielding questions over her citizenship status, Senator Lambie concluded her statement with a show of support for a citizenship audit of all parlimentarians to "clear the air once and for all".

The ongoing citizenship saga which has engulfed federal parliament in recent weeks has so far claimed five senators, as well as Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce, and continues to snowball scrutiny around many federal politicians.

On Monday, just hours after Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull stated he had been told by the Liberal Party's federal director that all Liberal Party Members "believe that they are in compliance with the Constitution", it was revealed that federal Liberal MP John Alexander was urgently trying to confirm his citizenship status.
TITLE: Doubts Raised Over Jacqui Lambie's Citizenship Status

SUMMARY:
Trump attended a state dinner at Seoul's Blue House as part of his Asian tour on Tuesday evening, where he dined with South Korean President Moon Jae-in.
Guests at the dinner were served traditional, high-quality Korean cuisine, including a dish with a 360-year-old soy sauce.
So the sauce Donald Trump ate on Tuesday evening is older than modern America itself.
The President is visiting South Korea as part of a wider Asian tour that includes visits to Vietnam, the Philippines and China as well as South Korea.
During a press conference in South Korea, Trump called for North Korea to "come to the table" and discuss destroying the nuclear weapons the rogue state has in its possession.
TEXT:
U.S. President Donald Trump is known for preferring American foods like cheeseburgers and steaks over other cuisines, just as much as he's known for enjoying the occasional game of golf or viciously shaking people's hands.

Trump attended a state dinner at Seoul's Blue House as part of his Asian tour on Tuesday evening, where he dined with South Korean President Moon Jae-in. While Trump's Japanese hosts catered to his preferences and provided him with grilled steaks and chocolate sundaes just a few days earlier, the South Koreans decided otherwise.

Guests at the dinner were served traditional, high-quality Korean cuisine, including a dish with a 360-year-old soy sauce. So if you do the math, the name of the sauce implies that it was made back in 1657, 119 years before the U.S Declaration of Independence was signed. So the sauce Donald Trump ate on Tuesday evening is older than modern America itself. I was really looking forward to a cheeseburger and fries. Here's what else was served at the dinner.

Corn porridge with fresh herb and vegetable side dishes;

Grilled sole from Geoje island with brown bean sauce consomme;

Pine mushroom rice in a stone pot with prawns caught in the waters of Dokdo mixed with stir-fried glass noodles and vegetables, and grilled Korean beef ribs seasoned with a special sauce made with a 360-year-old soy sauce served on a tray;

Triple chocolate cake served with raspberry vanilla sauce and cinnamon punch granita served with dried persimmons.

All sounds pretty delicious doesn't it?

On the menu for President Trump in Seoul tonight: corn porridge, grilled fish, Korean ribs, pine mushroom rice https://t.co/oOMNnJ1cJw pic.twitter.com/job5xl4E4k ‚Äî Anna Fifield (@annafifield) November 7, 2017

Of course, Trump isn't in South Korea just to sample the food. The President is visiting South Korea as part of a wider Asian tour that includes visits to Vietnam, the Philippines and China as well as South Korea. He has already visited Japan.

The trip aims to address the threat of North Korea, promote trade in the Indo-Pacific Region and advance American trade and economic practices in the area.

During a press conference in South Korea, Trump called for North Korea to "come to the table" and discuss destroying the nuclear weapons the rogue state has in its possession. This more diplomatic approach contrasts to previous Trump rhetoric where he threatened "fire and fury" against Pyongyang.

Trump will travel to China on Wednesday to meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping.
TITLE: Donald Trump Was Served Soy Sauce Older Than Modern America In South Korea

TEXT:
‚ÄúThor: Ragnarok‚Äù is full of a Hela lot of surprises.

Yeah, the twist that Cate Blanchett‚Äôs character, Hela, was Thor‚Äôs sister got out before the movie premiered on Friday, and Mark Ruffalo accidentally live-streamed the movie at an early screening, but many of the film‚Äôs secrets remain intact, including some major cameos.

Warning: ‚ÄúThor: Ragnarok‚Äù spoilers below!

After Thor (Chris Hemsworth) gets back to Asgard, where Loki (Tom Hiddleston) has been ruling in an Odin (Anthony Hopkins) disguise after secretly exiling the real Odin, Thor witnesses a play honoring Loki‚Äôs ‚Äúdeath,‚Äù which happened in ‚ÄúThor: The Dark World.‚Äù (Don‚Äôt worry. The dude wasn‚Äôt really dead.)

In the play scenes, Thor is played by Luke Hemsworth, Chris‚Äô older brother; Odin is played by Dr. Grant himself, Sam Neill; and Loki is played by Matt Damon wearing a ridiculous Loki wig.

Director Taika Waititi told HuffPost the Damon cameo really happened because he‚Äôs good friends with Chris.

‚ÄúIt was like an homage to the previous films but also being a bit more irreverent, being able to poke fun at ourselves,‚Äù he said in reference to the play scene. ‚ÄúChris is very good at that. He has great self-deprecating humor.‚Äù

Steve Granitz via Getty Images Luciana Barroso and Matt Damon at the "Thor: Ragnarok" premiere Oct. 10.

The director said the play was planned as an in-joke for everyone who saw ‚ÄúThor: The Dark World,‚Äù adding, ‚ÄúWe shot everything the same size and the same angle and we basically copied the entire death scene from that movie.‚Äù

For those who haven‚Äôt seen the previous ‚ÄúThor‚Äù film, Waititi says it is still an ‚Äúinteresting piece of story‚Äù that helps set up Loki‚Äôs storyline.

As far as the other surprises in the movie, you should probably just see them for yourself. Marvel has gone to great lengths to keep them quiet. Even the trailers were digitally altered from the final film to hide plot points.

‚ÄúWhen we came out with our first trailer, there were a few stories in we weren‚Äôt sure if we wanted in the film or not,‚Äù said Waititi. The director said they just ‚Äúwanted to make a cool trailer,‚Äù but promotion ‚Äúshouldn‚Äôt necessarily be just showing shots from the finished movie.‚Äù

Get ready for some moments that‚Äôll Ragna-rock your world.
TITLE: Here's How 'Thor: Ragnarok' Got That Secret Cameo
